'https://api.github.com/users/kaxil/events{/privacy}', 'received_events_url': 'https://api.github.com/users/kaxil/received_events', 'type': 'User', 'user_view_type': 'public', 'site_admin': False}, 'name': 'boring-cyborg', 'description': 'A Github bot to automatically label PRs, issues and perform all the boring operations that you don\'t want to do.\r\n\r\n\r\n![Using Boring Cyborg Probot to add new labels](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/kaxil/boring-cyborg/master/assets/usage-screenshot-1.png)\r\n\r\n![Congratulate user on first merged PR](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/kaxil/boring-cyborg/master/assets/usage-first-merged-pr.gif)\r\n\r\n## Features\r\n\r\n* Add labels based on the path of the file that are modified in the PR.\r\n* Welcome new users to your project when they open their first Issue/PR or first merged PR by an\r\nautomated comment. \r\n* Insert Issue (Jira/Github etc) link in PR description based on the Issue ID in PR title.\r\n* Verifies if commits/PR titles match the regular expression specified\r\n* Check if a branch is up to date with the master when specific files are modified in the PR. This is helpful when you desire the changes to be applied sequentially, for example, alembic migrations.\r\n\r\n## Usage\r\n\r\n1. **[Configure the Github App](https://github.com/apps/boring-cyborg)**\r\n2. After installing the Github app, create `.github/boring-cyborg.yml` in the default branch to enable it\r\n3. It will start scanning for pull requests within few minutes.\r\n\r\n```yaml\r\n##### Labeler ##########################################################################################################\r\n# Enable "labeler" for your PR that would add labels to PRs based on the paths that are modified in the PR.\r\nlabelPRBasedOnFilePath:\r\n  # Add \'label1\' to any changes within \'example\' folder or any subfolders\r\n  label1:\r\n    - example/**/*\r\n\r\n  # Add \'label2\' to any file changes within \'example2\' folder\r\n  label2:\r\n    - example2/*\r\n\r\n  # Complex: Add \'area/core\' label to any change within the \'core\' package\r\n  area/core:\r\n    - src/core/*\r\n    - src/core/**/*  \r\n\r\n  # Add \'test\' label to any change to *.spec.js files within the source dir\r\n  test:\r\n    - src/**/*.spec.js\r\n\r\n##### Greetings ########################################################################################################\r\n# Comment to be posted to welcome users when they open their first PR\r\nfirstPRWelcomeComment: >\r\n  Thanks for opening this pull request! Please check out our contributing guidelines.\r\n\r\n# Comment to be posted to congratulate user on their first merged PR\r\nfirstPRMergeComment: >\r\n  Awesome work, congrats on your first merged pull request!\r\n\r\n# Comment to be posted to on first time issues\r\nfirstIssueWelcomeComment: >\r\n  Thanks for opening your first issue here! Be sure to follow the issue template!\r\n\r\n###### IssueLink Adder #################################################################################################\r\n# Insert Issue (Jira/Github etc) link in PR description based on the Issue ID in PR title.\r\ninsertIssueLinkInPrDescription:\r\n   # specify the placeholder for the issue link that should be present in the description\r\n  descriptionIssuePlaceholderRegexp: "^Issue link: (.*)$"\r\n  matchers:\r\n    # you can have several matches - for different types of issues\r\n    # only the first matching entry is replaced\r\n    jiraIssueMatch:\r\n      # specify the regexp of issue id that you can find in the title of the PR\r\n      # the match groups can be used to build the issue id (${1}, ${2}, etc.).\r\n      titleIssueIdRegexp: \\[(AIRFLOW-[0-9]{4})\\]\r\n      # the issue link to be added. ${1}, ${2} ... are replaced with the match groups from the\r\n      # title match (remember to use quotes)\r\n      descriptionIssueLink: "[${1}](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/${1}/)"\r\n    docOnlyIssueMatch:\r\n      titleIssueIdRegexp: \\[(AIRFLOW-X{4})\\]\r\n      descriptionIssueLink: "`Document only change, no JIRA issue`"\r\n\r\n###### Title Validator #################################################################################################\r\n# Verifies if commit/PR titles match the regexp specified\r\nverifyTitles:\r\n  # Regular expression that should be matched by titles of commits or PR\r\n  titleRegexp: ^\\[AIRFLOW-[0-9]{4}\\].*$|^\\[AIRFLOW-XXXX\\].*$\r\n  # If set to true, it will always check the PR title (as opposed to the individual commits).\r\n  alwaysUsePrTitle: true\r\n  # If set to true, it will only check the commit in case there is a single commit.\r\n  # In case of multiple commits it will check PR title.\r\n  # This reflects the standard behaviour of Github that for `Squash & Merge` GitHub\r\n  # uses the PR title rather than commit messages for the squashed commit ¯\\_(ツ)_/¯\r\n  # For single-commit PRs it takes the squashed commit message from the commit as expected.\r\n  #\r\n  # If set to false it will check all commit messages. This is useful when you do not squash commits at merge.\r\n  validateEitherPrOrSingleCommitTitle: true\r\n  # The title the GitHub status should appear from.\r\n  statusTitle: "Title Validator"\r\n  # A custom message to be displayed when the title passes validation.\r\n  successMessage: "Validation successful!"\r\n  # A custom message to be displayed when the title fails validation.\r\n  # Allows insertion of ${type} (commit/PR), ${title} (the title validated) and ${regex} (the titleRegexp above).\r\n  failureMessage: "Wrong ${type} title: ${title}"\r\n\r\n###### PR/Branch Up-To-Date Checker ####################################################################################\r\n# Check if the branch is up to date with master when certain files are modified\r\ncheckUpToDate:\r\n  # The default branch is "master", change the branch if you want to check against a different target branch  \r\n  targetBranch: master\r\n  files:\r\n  # File paths that you want to check for\r\n  # In this example, it checks if the branch is up to date when alembic migrations are modified in the PR.\r\n  # It helps avoid multiple heads in alembic migrations in a collaborative development project.\r\n    - airflow/migrations/*\r\n    - airflow/migrations/**/*\r\n    - airflow/alembic.ini\r\n```\r\n\r\nAll the features are optional. Simply add the config for the feature you want to use.\r\n\r\nIf you are having issues with the GitHub app not working, please create an issue on https://github.com/kaxil/boring-cyborg/issues.\r\n\r\n', 'external_url': 'https://github.com/kaxil/boring-cyborg', 'html_url': 'https://github.com/apps/boring-cyborg', 'created_at': 'name': 'boring-cyborg', 'description': 'A Github bot to automatically label PRs, issues and perform all the boring operations that you don\'t want to do.\r\n\r\n\r\n![Using Boring Cyborg Probot to add new labels](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/kaxil/boring-cyborg/master/assets/usage-screenshot-1.png)\r\n\r\n![Congratulate user on first merged PR](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/kaxil/boring-cyborg/master/assets/usage-first-merged-pr.gif)\r\n\r\n## Features\r\n\r\n* Add labels based on the path of the file that are modified in the PR.\r\n* Welcome new users to your project when they open their first Issue/PR or first merged PR by an\r\nautomated comment. \r\n* Insert Issue (Jira/Github etc) link in PR description based on the Issue ID in PR title.\r\n* Verifies if commits/PR titles match the regular expression specified\r\n* Check if a branch is up to date with the master when specific files are modified in the PR. This is helpful when you desire the changes to be applied sequentially, for example, alembic migrations.\r\n\r\n## Usage\r\n\r\n1. **[Configure the Github App](https://github.com/apps/boring-cyborg)**\r\n2. After installing the Github app, create `.github/boring-cyborg.yml` in the default branch to enable it\r\n3. It will start scanning for pull requests within few minutes.\r\n\r\n```yaml\r\n##### Labeler ##########################################################################################################\r\n# Enable "labeler" for your PR that would add labels to PRs based on the paths that are modified in the PR.\r\nlabelPRBasedOnFilePath:\r\n  # Add \'label1\' to any changes within \'example\' folder or any subfolders\r\n  label1:\r\n    - example/**/*\r\n\r\n  # Add \'label2\' to any file changes within \'example2\' folder\r\n  label2:\r\n    - example2/*\r\n\r\n  # Complex: Add \'area/core\' label to any change within the \'core\' package\r\n  area/core:\r\n    - src/core/*\r\n    - src/core/**/*  \r\n\r\n  # Add \'test\' label to any change to *.spec.js files within the source dir\r\n  test:\r\n    - src/**/*.spec.js\r\n\r\n##### Greetings ########################################################################################################\r\n# Comment to be posted to welcome users when they open their first PR\r\nfirstPRWelcomeComment: >\r\n  Thanks for opening this pull request! Please check out our contributing guidelines.\r\n\r\n# Comment to be posted to congratulate user on their first merged PR\r\nfirstPRMergeComment: >\r\n  Awesome work, congrats on your first merged pull request!\r\n\r\n# Comment to be posted to on first time issues\r\nfirstIssueWelcomeComment: >\r\n  Thanks for opening your first issue here! Be sure to follow the issue template!\r\n\r\n###### IssueLink Adder #################################################################################################\r\n# Insert Issue (Jira/Github etc) link in PR description based on the Issue ID in PR title.\r\ninsertIssueLinkInPrDescription:\r\n   # specify the placeholder for the issue link that should be present in the description\r\n  descriptionIssuePlaceholderRegexp: "^Issue link: (.*)$"\r\n  matchers:\r\n    # you can have several matches - for different types of issues\r\n    # only the first matching entry is replaced\r\n    jiraIssueMatch:\r\n      # specify the regexp of issue id that you can find in the title of the PR\r\n      # the match groups can be used to build the issue id (${1}, ${2}, etc.).\r\n      titleIssueIdRegexp: \\[(AIRFLOW-[0-9]{4})\\]\r\n      # the issue link to be added. ${1}, ${2} ... are replaced with the match groups from the\r\n      # title match (remember to use quotes)\r\n      descriptionIssueLink: "[${1}](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/${1}/)"\r\n    docOnlyIssueMatch:\r\n      titleIssueIdRegexp: \\[(AIRFLOW-X{4})\\]\r\n      descriptionIssueLink: "`Document only change, no JIRA issue`"\r\n\r\n###### Title Validator #################################################################################################\r\n# Verifies if commit/PR titles match the regexp specified\r\nverifyTitles:\r\n  # Regular expression that should be matched by titles of commits or PR\r\n  titleRegexp: ^\\[AIRFLOW-[0-9]{4}\\].*$|^\\[AIRFLOW-XXXX\\].*$\r\n  # If set to true, it will always check the PR title (as opposed to the individual commits).\r\n  alwaysUsePrTitle: true\r\n  # If set to true, it will only check the commit in case there is a single commit.\r\n  # In case of multiple commits it will check PR title.\r\n  # This reflects the standard behaviour of Github that for `Squash & Merge` GitHub\r\n  # uses the PR title rather than commit messages for the squashed commit ¯\\_(ツ)_/¯\r\n  # For single-commit PRs it takes the squashed commit message from the commit as expected.\r\n  #\r\n  # If set to false it will check all commit messages. This is useful when you do not squash commits at merge.\r\n  validateEitherPrOrSingleCommitTitle: true\r\n  # The title the GitHub status should appear from.\r\n  statusTitle: "Title Validator"\r\n  # A custom message to be displayed when the title passes validation.\r\n  successMessage: "Validation successful!"\r\n  # A custom message to be displayed when the title fails validation.\r\n  # Allows insertion of ${type} (commit/PR), ${title} (the title validated) and ${regex} (the titleRegexp above).\r\n  failureMessage: "Wrong ${type} title: ${title}"\r\n\r\n###### PR/Branch Up-To-Date Checker ####################################################################################\r\n# Check if the branch is up to date with master when certain files are modified\r\ncheckUpToDate:\r\n  # The default branch is "master", change the branch if you want to check against a different target branch  \r\n  targetBranch: master\r\n  files:\r\n  # File paths that you want to check for\r\n  # In this example, it checks if the branch is up to date when alembic migrations are modified in the PR.\r\n  # It helps avoid multiple heads in alembic migrations in a collaborative development project.\r\n    - airflow/migrations/*\r\n    - airflow/migrations/**/*\r\n    - airflow/alembic.ini\r\n```\r\n\r\nAll the features are optional. Simply add the config for the feature you want to use.\r\n\r\nIf you are having issues with the GitHub app not working, please create an issue on https://github.com/kaxil/boring-cyborg/issues.\r\n\r\n', 'external_url': 'https://github.com/kaxil/boring-cyborg', 'html_url': 'https://github.com/apps/boring-cyborg', 'created_at': '2020-01-04T23:52:58Z', 'updated_at': '2020-03-13T21:08:37Z', 'permissions': {'checks': 'write', 'issues': 'write', 'metadata': 'read', 'pull_requests': 'write', 'single_file': 'read', 'statuses': 'write'}, 'events': ['issues', 'label', 'pull_request', 'pull_request_review', 'pull_request_review_comment']}}]
Issue #17052: Labels: bug, UI, priority:high
Issue #17051: Labels: bug, backend, priority:high, 3.3.0

'name': 'boring-cyborg', 'description': 'A Github bot to automatically label PRs, issues and perform all the boring operations that you don\'t want to do.\r\n\r\n\r\n![Using Boring Cyborg Probot to add new labels](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/kaxil/boring-cyborg/master/assets/usage-screenshot-1.png)\r\n\r\n![Congratulate user on first merged PR](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/kaxil/boring-cyborg/master/assets/usage-first-merged-pr.gif)\r\n\r\n## Features\r\n\r\n* Add labels based on the path of the file that are modified in the PR.\r\n* Welcome new users to your project when they open their first Issue/PR or first merged PR by an\r\nautomated comment. \r\n* Insert Issue (Jira/Github etc) link in PR description based on the Issue ID in PR title.\r\n* Verifies if commits/PR titles match the regular expression specified\r\n* Check if a branch is up to date with the master when specific files are modified in the PR. This is helpful when you desire the changes to be applied sequentially, for example, alembic migrations.\r\n\r\n## Usage\r\n\r\n1. **[Configure the Github App](https://github.com/apps/boring-cyborg)**\r\n2. After installing the Github app, create `.github/boring-cyborg.yml` in the default branch to enable it\r\n3. It will start scanning for pull requests within few minutes.\r\n\r\n```yaml\r\n##### Labeler ##########################################################################################################\r\n# Enable "labeler" for your PR that would add labels to PRs based on the paths that are modified in the PR.\r\nlabelPRBasedOnFilePath:\r\n  # Add \'label1\' to any changes within \'example\' folder or any subfolders\r\n  label1:\r\n    - example/**/*\r\n\r\n  # Add \'label2\' to any file changes within \'example2\' folder\r\n  label2:\r\n    - example2/*\r\n\r\n  # Complex: Add \'area/core\' label to any change within the \'core\' package\r\n  area/core:\r\n    - src/core/*\r\n    - src/core/**/*  \r\n\r\n  # Add \'test\' label to any change to *.spec.js files within the source dir\r\n  test:\r\n    - src/**/*.spec.js\r\n\r\n##### Greetings ########################################################################################################\r\n# Comment to be posted to welcome users when they open their first PR\r\nfirstPRWelcomeComment: >\r\n  Thanks for opening this pull request! Please check out our contributing guidelines.\r\n\r\n# Comment to be posted to congratulate user on their first merged PR\r\nfirstPRMergeComment: >\r\n  Awesome work, congrats on your first merged pull request!\r\n\r\n# Comment to be posted to on first time issues\r\nfirstIssueWelcomeComment: >\r\n  Thanks for opening your first issue here! Be sure to follow the issue template!\r\n\r\n###### IssueLink Adder #################################################################################################\r\n# Insert Issue (Jira/Github etc) link in PR description based on the Issue ID in PR title.\r\ninsertIssueLinkInPrDescription:\r\n   # specify the placeholder for the issue link that should be present in the description\r\n  descriptionIssuePlaceholderRegexp: "^Issue link: (.*)$"\r\n  matchers:\r\n    # you can have several matches - for different types of issues\r\n    # only the first matching entry is replaced\r\n    jiraIssueMatch:\r\n      # specify the regexp of issue id that you can find in the title of the PR\r\n      # the match groups can be used to build the issue id (${1}, ${2}, etc.).\r\n      titleIssueIdRegexp: \\[(AIRFLOW-[0-9]{4})\\]\r\n      # the issue link to be added. ${1}, ${2} ... are replaced with the match groups from the\r\n      # title match (remember to use quotes)\r\n      descriptionIssueLink: "[${1}](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/${1}/)"\r\n    docOnlyIssueMatch:\r\n      titleIssueIdRegexp: \\[(AIRFLOW-X{4})\\]\r\n      descriptionIssueLink: "`Document only change, no JIRA issue`"\r\n\r\n###### Title Validator #################################################################################################\r\n# Verifies if commit/PR titles match the regexp specified\r\nverifyTitles:\r\n  # Regular expression that should be matched by titles of commits or PR\r\n  titleRegexp: ^\\[AIRFLOW-[0-9]{4}\\].*$|^\\[AIRFLOW-XXXX\\].*$\r\n  # If set to true, it will always check the PR title (as opposed to the individual commits).\r\n  alwaysUsePrTitle: true\r\n  # If set to true, it will only check the commit in case there is a single commit.\r\n  # In case of multiple commits it will check PR title.\r\n  # This reflects the standard behaviour of Github that for `Squash & Merge` GitHub\r\n  # uses the PR title rather than commit messages for the squashed commit ¯\\_(ツ)_/¯\r\n  # For single-commit PRs it takes the squashed commit message from the commit as expected.\r\n  #\r\n  # If set to false it will check all commit messages. This is useful when you do not squash commits at merge.\r\n  validateEitherPrOrSingleCommitTitle: true\r\n  # The title the GitHub status should appear from.\r\n  statusTitle: "Title Validator"\r\n  # A custom message to be displayed when the title passes validation.\r\n  successMessage: "Validation successful!"\r\n  # A custom message to be displayed when the title fails validation.\r\n  # Allows insertion of ${type} (commit/PR), ${title} (the title validated) and ${regex} (the titleRegexp above).\r\n  failureMessage: "Wrong ${type} title: ${title}"\r\n\r\n###### PR/Branch Up-To-Date Checker ####################################################################################\r\n# Check if the branch is up to date with master when certain files are modified\r\ncheckUpToDate:\r\n  # The default branch is "master", change the branch if you want to check against a different target branch  \r\n  targetBranch: master\r\n  files:\r\n  # File paths that you want to check for\r\n  # In this example, it checks if the branch is up to date when alembic migrations are modified in the PR.\r\n  # It helps avoid multiple heads in alembic migrations in a collaborative development project.\r\n    - airflow/migrations/*\r\n    - airflow/migrations/**/*\r\n    - airflow/alembic.ini\r\n```\r\n\r\nAll the features are optional. Simply add the config for the feature you want to use.\r\n\r\nIf you are having issues with the GitHub app not working, please create an issue on https://github.com/kaxil/boring-cyborg/issues.\r\n\r\n', 'external_url': 'https://github.com/kaxil/boring-cyborg', 'html_url': 'https://github.com/apps/boring-cyborg', 'created_at': PR](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/kaxil/boring-cyborg/master/assets/usage-first-merged-pr.gif)\r\n\r\n## Features\r\n\r\n* Add labels based on the path of the file that are modified in the PR.\r\n* Welcome new users to your project when they open their first Issue/PR or first merged PR by an\r\nautomated comment. \r\n* Insert Issue (Jira/Github etc) link in PR description based on the Issue ID in PR title.\r\n* Verifies if commits/PR titles match the regular expression specified\r\n* Check if a branch is up to date with the master when specific files are modified in the PR. This is helpful when you desire the changes to be applied sequentially, for example, alembic migrations.\r\n\r\n## Usage\r\n\r\n1. **[Configure the Github App](https://github.com/apps/boring-cyborg)**\r\n2. After installing the Github app, create `.github/boring-cyborg.yml` in the default branch to enable it\r\n3. It will start scanning for pull requests within few minutes.\r\n\r\n```yaml\r\n##### Labeler ##########################################################################################################\r\n# Enable "labeler" for your PR that would add labels to PRs based on the paths that are modified in the PR.\r\nlabelPRBasedOnFilePath:\r\n  # Add \'label1\' to any changes within \'example\' folder or any subfolders\r\n  label1:\r\n    - example/**/*\r\n\r\n  # Add \'label2\' to any file changes within \'example2\' folder\r\n  label2:\r\n    - example2/*\r\n\r\n  # Complex: Add \'area/core\' label to any change within the \'core\' package\r\n  area/core:\r\n    - src/core/*\r\n    - src/core/**/*  \r\n\r\n  # Add \'test\' label to any change to *.spec.js files within the source dir\r\n  test:\r\n    - src/**/*.spec.js\r\n\r\n##### Greetings ########################################################################################################\r\n# Comment to be posted to welcome users when they open their first PR\r\nfirstPRWelcomeComment: >\r\n  Thanks for opening this pull request! Please check out our contributing guidelines.\r\n\r\n# Comment to be posted to congratulate user on their first merged PR\r\nfirstPRMergeComment: >\r\n  Awesome work, congrats on your first merged pull request!\r\n\r\n# Comment to be posted to on first time issues\r\nfirstIssueWelcomeComment: >\r\n  Thanks for opening your first issue here! Be sure to follow the issue template!\r\n\r\n###### IssueLink Adder #################################################################################################\r\n# Insert Issue (Jira/Github etc) link in PR description based on the Issue ID in PR title.\r\ninsertIssueLinkInPrDescription:\r\n   # specify the placeholder for the issue link that should be present in the description\r\n  descriptionIssuePlaceholderRegexp: "^Issue link: (.*)$"\r\n  matchers:\r\n    # you can have several matches - for different types of issues\r\n    # only the first matching entry is replaced\r\n    jiraIssueMatch:\r\n      # specify the regexp of issue id that you can find in the title of the PR\r\n      # the match groups can be used to build the issue id (${1}, ${2}, etc.).\r\n      titleIssueIdRegexp: \\[(AIRFLOW-[0-9]{4})\\]\r\n      # the issue link to be added. ${1}, ${2} ... are replaced with the match groups from the\r\n      # title match (remember to use quotes)\r\n      descriptionIssueLink: "[${1}](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/${1}/)"\r\n    docOnlyIssueMatch:\r\n      titleIssueIdRegexp: \\[(AIRFLOW-X{4})\\]\r\n      descriptionIssueLink: "`Document only change, no JIRA issue`"\r\n\r\n###### Title Validator #################################################################################################\r\n# Verifies if commit/PR titles match the regexp specified\r\nverifyTitles:\r\n  # Regular expression that should be matched by titles of commits or PR\r\n  titleRegexp: ^\\[AIRFLOW-[0-9]{4}\\].*$|^\\[AIRFLOW-XXXX\\].*$\r\n  # If set to true, it will always check the PR title (as opposed to the individual commits).\r\n  alwaysUsePrTitle: true\r\n  # If set to true, it will only check the commit in case there is a single commit.\r\n  # In case of multiple commits it will check PR title.\r\n  # This reflects the standard behaviour of Github that for `Squash & Merge` GitHub\r\n  # uses the PR title rather than commit messages for the squashed commit ¯\\_(ツ)_/¯\r\n  # For single-commit PRs it takes the squashed commit message from the commit as expected.\r\n  #\r\n  # If set to false it will check all commit messages. This is useful when you do not squash commits at merge.\r\n  validateEitherPrOrSingleCommitTitle: true\r\n  # The title the GitHub status should appear from.\r\n  statusTitle: "Title Validator"\r\n  # A custom message to be displayed when the title passes validation.\r\n  successMessage: "Validation successful!"\r\n  # A custom message to be displayed when the title fails validation.\r\n  # Allows insertion of ${type} (commit/PR), ${title} (the title validated) and ${regex} (the titleRegexp above).\r\n  failureMessage: "Wrong ${type} title: ${title}"\r\n\r\n###### PR/Branch Up-To-Date Checker ####################################################################################\r\n# Check if the branch is up to date with master when certain files are modified\r\ncheckUpToDate:\r\n  # The default branch is "master", change the branch if you want to check against a different target branch  \r\n  targetBranch: master\r\n  files:\r\n  # File paths that you want to check for\r\n  # In this example, it checks if the branch is up to date when alembic migrations are modified in the PR.\r\n  # It helps avoid multiple heads in alembic migrations in a collaborative development project.\r\n    - airflow/migrations/*\r\n    - airflow/migrations/**/*\r\n    - airflow/alembic.ini\r\n```\r\n\r\nAll the features are optional. Simply add the config for the feature you want to use.\r\n\r\nIf you are having issues with the GitHub app not working, please create an issue on https://github.com/kaxil/boring-cyborg/issues.\r\n\r\n', 'external_url': 'https://github.com/kaxil/boring-cyborg', 'html_url': 'https://github.com/apps/boring-cyborg', 'created_at': '2020-01-04T23:52:58Z', 'updated_at': '2020-03-13T21:08:37Z', 'permissions': {'checks': 'write', 'issues': 'write', 'metadata': 'read', 'pull_requests': 'write', 'single_file': 'read', 'statuses': 'public', 'site_admin': False}, 'created_at': '2025-03-13T06:42:12Z', 'updated_at': '2025-03-13T08:17:37Z', 'author_association': 'NONE', 'body': '> A task is executed only if all upstream edges are reachable, in your dag, the switch doesn\'t want `echo_teriteri` executed.\n\nYou\'re correct that in this DAG, the switch does not want `echo_teriteri` executed.\n\n**However, the key question here is:** Should `switch_channel` be considered an upstream dependency of `echo_teriteri` if the condition for the `echo_teriteri` branch is not met?\n\nIf `switch_channel` should indeed be counted as an upstream dependency, then based on the logic that "A task is executed only if all upstream edges are reachable," the second DAG should not execute `echo_teriteri` because `do_nothing` is unreachable. However, **this is not the current system behavior.**\n\nLet’s break it down:\n\n**First DAG:**\n\n1. `switch_channel` wants `echo_teriri` executed.\n2. `echo_teriri` wants `echo_teriteri` executed.\n3. `switch_channel` does not want `echo_teriteri` executed.\n4. Steps 2 and 3 conflict. Since "A task is executed only if all upstream edges are reachable," `echo_teriteri` is not executed.\n\n**Second DAG:**\n\n1. `switch_channel` wants `echo_teriri` executed.\n2. `echo_teriri` wants `echo_teriteri` executed.\n3. `switch_channel` does not want `do_nothing` executed.\n4. `do_nothing` is not executed, which should block `echo_teriteri`.\n5. Steps 2 and 4 conflict. However, **contrary to the stated logic**, `echo_teriteri` is still executed.\n\nThis inconsistency is problematic.\n\n**Most importantly:**\n\n- If the system is designed to prevent `echo_teriteri` from executing in the first DAG, the workflow instance should **end normally.**\n- Instead, the instance **ends in FAIL status** despite no failed tasks being present.\n- Restarting the instance leads to a **zombie process** that keeps running indefinitely and cannot be killed.\n', 'reactions': {'url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/apache/dolphinscheduler/issues/comments/2720136324/reactions', Issue #17046: Labels: UI, improvement

'name': 'boring-cyborg', 'description': 'A Github bot to automatically label PRs, issues and perform all the boring operations that you don\'t want to do.\r\n\r\n\r\n![Using Boring Cyborg Probot to add new labels](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/kaxil/boring-cyborg/master/assets/usage-screenshot-1.png)\r\n\r\n![Congratulate user on first merged PR](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/kaxil/boring-cyborg/master/assets/usage-first-merged-pr.gif)\r\n\r\n## Features\r\n\r\n* Add labels based on the path of the file that are modified in the PR.\r\n* Welcome new users to your project when they open their first Issue/PR or first merged PR by an\r\nautomated comment. \r\n* Insert Issue (Jira/Github etc) link in PR description based on the Issue ID in PR title.\r\n* Verifies if commits/PR titles match the regular expression specified\r\n* Check if a branch is up to date with the master when specific files are modified in the PR. This is helpful when you desire the changes to be applied sequentially, for example, alembic migrations.\r\n\r\n## Usage\r\n\r\n1. **[Configure the Github App](https://github.com/apps/boring-cyborg)**\r\n2. After installing the Github app, create `.github/boring-cyborg.yml` in the default branch to enable it\r\n3. It will start scanning for pull requests within few minutes.\r\n\r\n```yaml\r\n##### Labeler ##########################################################################################################\r\n# Enable "labeler" for your PR that would add labels to PRs based on the paths that are modified in the PR.\r\nlabelPRBasedOnFilePath:\r\n  # Add \'label1\' to any changes within \'example\' folder or any subfolders\r\n  label1:\r\n    - example/**/*\r\n\r\n  # Add \'label2\' to any file changes within \'example2\' folder\r\n  label2:\r\n    - example2/*\r\n\r\n  # Complex: Add \'area/core\' label to any change within the \'core\' package\r\n  area/core:\r\n    - src/core/*\r\n    - src/core/**/*  \r\n\r\n  # Add \'test\' label to any change to *.spec.js files within the source dir\r\n  test:\r\n    - src/**/*.spec.js\r\n\r\n##### Greetings ########################################################################################################\r\n# Comment to be posted to welcome users when they open their first PR\r\nfirstPRWelcomeComment: >\r\n  Thanks for opening this pull request! Please check out our contributing guidelines.\r\n\r\n# Comment to be posted to congratulate user on their first merged PR\r\nfirstPRMergeComment: >\r\n  Awesome work, congrats on your first merged pull request!\r\n\r\n# Comment to be posted to on first time issues\r\nfirstIssueWelcomeComment: >\r\n  Thanks for opening your first issue here! Be sure to follow the issue template!\r\n\r\n###### IssueLink Adder #################################################################################################\r\n# Insert Issue (Jira/Github etc) link in PR description based on the Issue ID in PR title.\r\ninsertIssueLinkInPrDescription:\r\n   # specify the placeholder for the issue link that should be present in the description\r\n  descriptionIssuePlaceholderRegexp: "^Issue link: (.*)$"\r\n  matchers:\r\n    # you can have several matches - for different types of issues\r\n    # only the first matching entry is replaced\r\n    jiraIssueMatch:\r\n      # specify the regexp of issue id that you can find in the title of the PR\r\n      # the match groups can be used to build the issue id (${1}, ${2}, etc.).\r\n      titleIssueIdRegexp: \\[(AIRFLOW-[0-9]{4})\\]\r\n      # the issue link to be added. ${1}, ${2} ... are replaced with the match groups from the\r\n      # title match (remember to use quotes)\r\n      descriptionIssueLink: "[${1}](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/${1}/)"\r\n    docOnlyIssueMatch:\r\n      titleIssueIdRegexp: \\[(AIRFLOW-X{4})\\]\r\n      descriptionIssueLink: "`Document only change, no JIRA issue`"\r\n\r\n###### Title Validator #################################################################################################\r\n# Verifies if commit/PR titles match the regexp specified\r\nverifyTitles:\r\n  # Regular expression that should be matched by titles of commits or PR\r\n  titleRegexp: ^\\[AIRFLOW-[0-9]{4}\\].*$|^\\[AIRFLOW-XXXX\\].*$\r\n  # If set to true, it will always check the PR title (as opposed to the individual commits).\r\n  alwaysUsePrTitle: true\r\n  # If set to true, it will only check the commit in case there is a single commit.\r\n  # In case of multiple commits it will check PR title.\r\n  # This reflects the standard behaviour of Github that for `Squash & Merge` GitHub\r\n  # uses the PR title rather than commit messages for the squashed commit ¯\\_(ツ)_/¯\r\n  # For single-commit PRs it takes the squashed commit message from the commit as expected.\r\n  #\r\n  # If set to false it will check all commit messages. This is useful when you do not squash commits at merge.\r\n  validateEitherPrOrSingleCommitTitle: true\r\n  # The title the GitHub status should appear from.\r\n  statusTitle: "Title Validator"\r\n  # A custom message to be displayed when the title passes validation.\r\n  successMessage: "Validation successful!"\r\n  # A custom message to be displayed when the title fails validation.\r\n  # Allows insertion of ${type} (commit/PR), ${title} (the title validated) and ${regex} (the titleRegexp above).\r\n  failureMessage: "Wrong ${type} title: ${title}"\r\n\r\n###### PR/Branch Up-To-Date Checker ####################################################################################\r\n# Check if the branch is up to date with master when certain files are modified\r\ncheckUpToDate:\r\n  # The default branch is "master", change the branch if you want to check against a different target branch  \r\n  targetBranch: master\r\n  files:\r\n  # File paths that you want to check for\r\n  # In this example, it checks if the branch is up to date when alembic migrations are modified in the PR.\r\n  # It helps avoid multiple heads in alembic migrations in a collaborative development project.\r\n    - airflow/migrations/*\r\n    - airflow/migrations/**/*\r\n    - airflow/alembic.ini\r\n```\r\n\r\nAll the features are optional. Simply add the config for the feature you want to use.\r\n\r\nIf you are having issues with the GitHub app not working, please create an issue on https://github.com/kaxil/boring-cyborg/issues.\r\n\r\n', 'external_url': 'https://github.com/kaxil/boring-cyborg', 'html_url': 'https://github.com/apps/boring-cyborg', 'created_at': 'https://api.github.com/users/kaxil/events{/privacy}', 'received_events_url': 'https://api.github.com/users/kaxil/received_events', 'type': 'User', 'user_view_type': 'public', 'site_admin': False}, 'name': 'boring-cyborg', 'description': 'A Github bot to automatically label PRs, issues and perform all the boring operations that you don\'t want to do.\r\n\r\n\r\n![Using Boring Cyborg Probot to add new labels](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/kaxil/boring-cyborg/master/assets/usage-screenshot-1.png)\r\n\r\n![Congratulate user on first merged PR](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/kaxil/boring-cyborg/master/assets/usage-first-merged-pr.gif)\r\n\r\n## Features\r\n\r\n* Add labels based on the path of the file that are modified in the PR.\r\n* Welcome new users to your project when they open their first Issue/PR or first merged PR by an\r\nautomated comment. \r\n* Insert Issue (Jira/Github etc) link in PR description based on the Issue ID in PR title.\r\n* Verifies if commits/PR titles match the regular expression specified\r\n* Check if a branch is up to date with the master when specific files are modified in the PR. This is helpful when you desire the changes to be applied sequentially, for example, alembic migrations.\r\n\r\n## Usage\r\n\r\n1. **[Configure the Github App](https://github.com/apps/boring-cyborg)**\r\n2. After installing the Github app, create `.github/boring-cyborg.yml` in the default branch to enable it\r\n3. It will start scanning for pull requests within few minutes.\r\n\r\n```yaml\r\n##### Labeler ##########################################################################################################\r\n# Enable "labeler" for your PR that would add labels to PRs based on the paths that are modified in the PR.\r\nlabelPRBasedOnFilePath:\r\n  # Add \'label1\' to any changes within \'example\' folder or any subfolders\r\n  label1:\r\n    - example/**/*\r\n\r\n  # Add \'label2\' to any file changes within \'example2\' folder\r\n  label2:\r\n    - example2/*\r\n\r\n  # Complex: Add \'area/core\' label to any change within the \'core\' package\r\n  area/core:\r\n    - src/core/*\r\n    - src/core/**/*  \r\n\r\n  # Add \'test\' label to any change to *.spec.js files within the source dir\r\n  test:\r\n    - src/**/*.spec.js\r\n\r\n##### Greetings ########################################################################################################\r\n# Comment to be posted to welcome users when they open their first PR\r\nfirstPRWelcomeComment: >\r\n  Thanks for opening this pull request! Please check out our contributing guidelines.\r\n\r\n# Comment to be posted to congratulate user on their first merged PR\r\nfirstPRMergeComment: >\r\n  Awesome work, congrats on your first merged pull request!\r\n\r\n# Comment to be posted to on first time issues\r\nfirstIssueWelcomeComment: >\r\n  Thanks for opening your first issue here! Be sure to follow the issue template!\r\n\r\n###### IssueLink Adder #################################################################################################\r\n# Insert Issue (Jira/Github etc) link in PR description based on the Issue ID in PR title.\r\ninsertIssueLinkInPrDescription:\r\n   # specify the placeholder for the issue link that should be present in the description\r\n  descriptionIssuePlaceholderRegexp: "^Issue link: (.*)$"\r\n  matchers:\r\n    # you can have several matches - for different types of issues\r\n    # only the first matching entry is replaced\r\n    jiraIssueMatch:\r\n      # specify the regexp of issue id that you can find in the title of the PR\r\n      # the match groups can be used to build the issue id (${1}, ${2}, etc.).\r\n      titleIssueIdRegexp: \\[(AIRFLOW-[0-9]{4})\\]\r\n      # the issue link to be added. ${1}, ${2} ... are replaced with the match groups from the\r\n      # title match (remember to use quotes)\r\n      descriptionIssueLink: "[${1}](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/${1}/)"\r\n    docOnlyIssueMatch:\r\n      titleIssueIdRegexp: \\[(AIRFLOW-X{4})\\]\r\n      descriptionIssueLink: "`Document only change, no JIRA issue`"\r\n\r\n###### Title Validator #################################################################################################\r\n# Verifies if commit/PR titles match the regexp specified\r\nverifyTitles:\r\n  # Regular expression that should be matched by titles of commits or PR\r\n  titleRegexp: ^\\[AIRFLOW-[0-9]{4}\\].*$|^\\[AIRFLOW-XXXX\\].*$\r\n  # If set to true, it will always check the PR title (as opposed to the individual commits).\r\n  alwaysUsePrTitle: true\r\n  # If set to true, it will only check the commit in case there is a single commit.\r\n  # In case of multiple commits it will check PR title.\r\n  # This reflects the standard behaviour of Github that for `Squash & Merge` GitHub\r\n  # uses the PR title rather than commit messages for the squashed commit ¯\\_(ツ)_/¯\r\n  # For single-commit PRs it takes the squashed commit message from the commit as expected.\r\n  #\r\n  # If set to false it will check all commit messages. This is useful when you do not squash commits at merge.\r\n  validateEitherPrOrSingleCommitTitle: true\r\n  # The title the GitHub status should appear from.\r\n  statusTitle: "Title Validator"\r\n  # A custom message to be displayed when the title passes validation.\r\n  successMessage: "Validation successful!"\r\n  # A custom message to be displayed when the title fails validation.\r\n  # Allows insertion of ${type} (commit/PR), ${title} (the title validated) and ${regex} (the titleRegexp above).\r\n  failureMessage: "Wrong ${type} title: ${title}"\r\n\r\n###### PR/Branch Up-To-Date Checker ####################################################################################\r\n# Check if the branch is up to date with master when certain files are modified\r\ncheckUpToDate:\r\n  # The default branch is "master", change the branch if you want to check against a different target branch  \r\n  targetBranch: master\r\n  files:\r\n  # File paths that you want to check for\r\n  # In this example, it checks if the branch is up to date when alembic migrations are modified in the PR.\r\n  # It helps avoid multiple heads in alembic migrations in a collaborative development project.\r\n    - airflow/migrations/*\r\n    - airflow/migrations/**/*\r\n    - airflow/alembic.ini\r\n```\r\n\r\nAll the features are optional. Simply add the config for the feature you want to use.\r\n\r\nIf you are having issues with the GitHub app not working, please create an issue on https://github.com/kaxil/boring-cyborg/issues.\r\n\r\n', 'external_url': 'https://github.com/kaxil/boring-cyborg', 'html_url': 'https://github.com/apps/boring-cyborg', 'created_at': '2020-01-04T23:52:58Z', 'updated_at': '2020-03-13T21:08:37Z', 'permissions': {'checks': 'write', 'issues': 'write', 'metadata': 'read', 'pull_requests': 'write', 'single_file': 'read', 'statuses': 'write'}, 'events': ['issues', 'label', 'pull_request', 'pull_request_review', 'pull_request_review_comment']}}]

'name': 'boring-cyborg', 'description': 'A Github bot to automatically label PRs, issues and perform all the boring operations that you don\'t want to do.\r\n\r\n\r\n![Using Boring Cyborg Probot to add new labels](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/kaxil/boring-cyborg/master/assets/usage-screenshot-1.png)\r\n\r\n![Congratulate user on first merged PR](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/kaxil/boring-cyborg/master/assets/usage-first-merged-pr.gif)\r\n\r\n## Features\r\n\r\n* Add labels based on the path of the file that are modified in the PR.\r\n* Welcome new users to your project when they open their first Issue/PR or first merged PR by an\r\nautomated comment. \r\n* Insert Issue (Jira/Github etc) link in PR description based on the Issue ID in PR title.\r\n* Verifies if commits/PR titles match the regular expression specified\r\n* Check if a branch is up to date with the master when specific files are modified in the PR. This is helpful when you desire the changes to be applied sequentially, for example, alembic migrations.\r\n\r\n## Usage\r\n\r\n1. **[Configure the Github App](https://github.com/apps/boring-cyborg)**\r\n2. After installing the Github app, create `.github/boring-cyborg.yml` in the default branch to enable it\r\n3. It will start scanning for pull requests within few minutes.\r\n\r\n```yaml\r\n##### Labeler ##########################################################################################################\r\n# Enable "labeler" for your PR that would add labels to PRs based on the paths that are modified in the PR.\r\nlabelPRBasedOnFilePath:\r\n  # Add \'label1\' to any changes within \'example\' folder or any subfolders\r\n  label1:\r\n    - example/**/*\r\n\r\n  # Add \'label2\' to any file changes within \'example2\' folder\r\n  label2:\r\n    - example2/*\r\n\r\n  # Complex: Add \'area/core\' label to any change within the \'core\' package\r\n  area/core:\r\n    - src/core/*\r\n    - src/core/**/*  \r\n\r\n  # Add \'test\' label to any change to *.spec.js files within the source dir\r\n  test:\r\n    - src/**/*.spec.js\r\n\r\n##### Greetings ########################################################################################################\r\n# Comment to be posted to welcome users when they open their first PR\r\nfirstPRWelcomeComment: >\r\n  Thanks for opening this pull request! Please check out our contributing guidelines.\r\n\r\n# Comment to be posted to congratulate user on their first merged PR\r\nfirstPRMergeComment: >\r\n  Awesome work, congrats on your first merged pull request!\r\n\r\n# Comment to be posted to on first time issues\r\nfirstIssueWelcomeComment: >\r\n  Thanks for opening your first issue here! Be sure to follow the issue template!\r\n\r\n###### IssueLink Adder #################################################################################################\r\n# Insert Issue (Jira/Github etc) link in PR description based on the Issue ID in PR title.\r\ninsertIssueLinkInPrDescription:\r\n   # specify the placeholder for the issue link that should be present in the description\r\n  descriptionIssuePlaceholderRegexp: "^Issue link: (.*)$"\r\n  matchers:\r\n    # you can have several matches - for different types of issues\r\n    # only the first matching entry is replaced\r\n    jiraIssueMatch:\r\n      # specify the regexp of issue id that you can find in the title of the PR\r\n      # the match groups can be used to build the issue id (${1}, ${2}, etc.).\r\n      titleIssueIdRegexp: \\[(AIRFLOW-[0-9]{4})\\]\r\n      # the issue link to be added. ${1}, ${2} ... are replaced with the match groups from the\r\n      # title match (remember to use quotes)\r\n      descriptionIssueLink: "[${1}](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/${1}/)"\r\n    docOnlyIssueMatch:\r\n      titleIssueIdRegexp: \\[(AIRFLOW-X{4})\\]\r\n      descriptionIssueLink: "`Document only change, no JIRA issue`"\r\n\r\n###### Title Validator #################################################################################################\r\n# Verifies if commit/PR titles match the regexp specified\r\nverifyTitles:\r\n  # Regular expression that should be matched by titles of commits or PR\r\n  titleRegexp: ^\\[AIRFLOW-[0-9]{4}\\].*$|^\\[AIRFLOW-XXXX\\].*$\r\n  # If set to true, it will always check the PR title (as opposed to the individual commits).\r\n  alwaysUsePrTitle: true\r\n  # If set to true, it will only check the commit in case there is a single commit.\r\n  # In case of multiple commits it will check PR title.\r\n  # This reflects the standard behaviour of Github that for `Squash & Merge` GitHub\r\n  # uses the PR title rather than commit messages for the squashed commit ¯\\_(ツ)_/¯\r\n  # For single-commit PRs it takes the squashed commit message from the commit as expected.\r\n  #\r\n  # If set to false it will check all commit messages. This is useful when you do not squash commits at merge.\r\n  validateEitherPrOrSingleCommitTitle: true\r\n  # The title the GitHub status should appear from.\r\n  statusTitle: "Title Validator"\r\n  # A custom message to be displayed when the title passes validation.\r\n  successMessage: "Validation successful!"\r\n  # A custom message to be displayed when the title fails validation.\r\n  # Allows insertion of ${type} (commit/PR), ${title} (the title validated) and ${regex} (the titleRegexp above).\r\n  failureMessage: "Wrong ${type} title: ${title}"\r\n\r\n###### PR/Branch Up-To-Date Checker ####################################################################################\r\n# Check if the branch is up to date with master when certain files are modified\r\ncheckUpToDate:\r\n  # The default branch is "master", change the branch if you want to check against a different target branch  \r\n  targetBranch: master\r\n  files:\r\n  # File paths that you want to check for\r\n  # In this example, it checks if the branch is up to date when alembic migrations are modified in the PR.\r\n  # It helps avoid multiple heads in alembic migrations in a collaborative development project.\r\n    - airflow/migrations/*\r\n    - airflow/migrations/**/*\r\n    - airflow/alembic.ini\r\n```\r\n\r\nAll the features are optional. Simply add the config for the feature you want to use.\r\n\r\nIf you are having issues with the GitHub app not working, please create an issue on https://github.com/kaxil/boring-cyborg/issues.\r\n\r\n', 'external_url': 'https://github.com/kaxil/boring-cyborg', 'html_url': 'https://github.com/apps/boring-cyborg', 'created_at': This is helpful when you desire the changes to be applied sequentially, for example, alembic migrations.\r\n\r\n## Usage\r\n\r\n1. **[Configure the Github App](https://github.com/apps/boring-cyborg)**\r\n2. After installing the Github app, create `.github/boring-cyborg.yml` in the default branch to enable it\r\n3. It will start scanning for pull requests within few minutes.\r\n\r\n```yaml\r\n##### Labeler ##########################################################################################################\r\n# Enable "labeler" for your PR that would add labels to PRs based on the paths that are modified in the PR.\r\nlabelPRBasedOnFilePath:\r\n  # Add \'label1\' to any changes within \'example\' folder or any subfolders\r\n  label1:\r\n    - example/**/*\r\n\r\n  # Add \'label2\' to any file changes within \'example2\' folder\r\n  label2:\r\n    - example2/*\r\n\r\n  # Complex: Add \'area/core\' label to any change within the \'core\' package\r\n  area/core:\r\n    - src/core/*\r\n    - src/core/**/*  \r\n\r\n  # Add \'test\' label to any change to *.spec.js files within the source dir\r\n  test:\r\n    - src/**/*.spec.js\r\n\r\n##### Greetings ########################################################################################################\r\n# Comment to be posted to welcome users when they open their first PR\r\nfirstPRWelcomeComment: >\r\n  Thanks for opening this pull request! Please check out our contributing guidelines.\r\n\r\n# Comment to be posted to congratulate user on their first merged PR\r\nfirstPRMergeComment: >\r\n  Awesome work, congrats on your first merged pull request!\r\n\r\n# Comment to be posted to on first time issues\r\nfirstIssueWelcomeComment: >\r\n  Thanks for opening your first issue here! Be sure to follow the issue template!\r\n\r\n###### IssueLink Adder #################################################################################################\r\n# Insert Issue (Jira/Github etc) link in PR description based on the Issue ID in PR title.\r\ninsertIssueLinkInPrDescription:\r\n   # specify the placeholder for the issue link that should be present in the description\r\n  descriptionIssuePlaceholderRegexp: "^Issue link: (.*)$"\r\n  matchers:\r\n    # you can have several matches - for different types of issues\r\n    # only the first matching entry is replaced\r\n    jiraIssueMatch:\r\n      # specify the regexp of issue id that you can find in the title of the PR\r\n      # the match groups can be used to build the issue id (${1}, ${2}, etc.).\r\n      titleIssueIdRegexp: \\[(AIRFLOW-[0-9]{4})\\]\r\n      # the issue link to be added. ${1}, ${2} ... are replaced with the match groups from the\r\n      # title match (remember to use quotes)\r\n      descriptionIssueLink: "[${1}](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/${1}/)"\r\n    docOnlyIssueMatch:\r\n      titleIssueIdRegexp: \\[(AIRFLOW-X{4})\\]\r\n      descriptionIssueLink: "`Document only change, no JIRA issue`"\r\n\r\n###### Title Validator #################################################################################################\r\n# Verifies if commit/PR titles match the regexp specified\r\nverifyTitles:\r\n  # Regular expression that should be matched by titles of commits or PR\r\n  titleRegexp: ^\\[AIRFLOW-[0-9]{4}\\].*$|^\\[AIRFLOW-XXXX\\].*$\r\n  # If set to true, it will always check the PR title (as opposed to the individual commits).\r\n  alwaysUsePrTitle: true\r\n  # If set to true, it will only check the commit in case there is a single commit.\r\n  # In case of multiple commits it will check PR title.\r\n  # This reflects the standard behaviour of Github that for `Squash & Merge` GitHub\r\n  # uses the PR title rather than commit messages for the squashed commit ¯\\_(ツ)_/¯\r\n  # For single-commit PRs it takes the squashed commit message from the commit as expected.\r\n  #\r\n  # If set to false it will check all commit messages. This is useful when you do not squash commits at merge.\r\n  validateEitherPrOrSingleCommitTitle: true\r\n  # The title the GitHub status should appear from.\r\n  statusTitle: "Title Validator"\r\n  # A custom message to be displayed when the title passes validation.\r\n  successMessage: "Validation successful!"\r\n  # A custom message to be displayed when the title fails validation.\r\n  # Allows insertion of ${type} (commit/PR), ${title} (the title validated) and ${regex} (the titleRegexp above).\r\n  failureMessage: "Wrong ${type} title: ${title}"\r\n\r\n###### PR/Branch Up-To-Date Checker ####################################################################################\r\n# Check if the branch is up to date with master when certain files are modified\r\ncheckUpToDate:\r\n  # The default branch is "master", change the branch if you want to check against a different target branch  \r\n  targetBranch: master\r\n  files:\r\n  # File paths that you want to check for\r\n  # In this example, it checks if the branch is up to date when alembic migrations are modified in the PR.\r\n  # It helps avoid multiple heads in alembic migrations in a collaborative development project.\r\n    - airflow/migrations/*\r\n    - airflow/migrations/**/*\r\n    - airflow/alembic.ini\r\n```\r\n\r\nAll the features are optional. Simply add the config for the feature you want to use.\r\n\r\nIf you are having issues with the GitHub app not working, please create an issue on https://github.com/kaxil/boring-cyborg/issues.\r\n\r\n', 'external_url': 'https://github.com/kaxil/boring-cyborg', 'html_url': 'https://github.com/apps/boring-cyborg', 'created_at': '2020-01-04T23:52:58Z', 'updated_at': '2020-03-13T21:08:37Z', 'permissions': {'checks': 'write', 'issues': 'write', 'metadata': 'read', 'pull_requests': 'write', 'single_file': 'read', 'statuses': 'write'}, 'events': ['issues', 'label', 'pull_request', 'pull_request_review', 'pull_request_review_comment']}}]

'https://api.github.com/users/kaxil/events{/privacy}', 'received_events_url': 'https://api.github.com/users/kaxil/received_events', 'type': 'User', 'user_view_type': 'public', 'site_admin': False}, 'name': 'boring-cyborg', 'description': 'A Github bot to automatically label PRs, issues and perform all the boring operations that you don\'t want to do.\r\n\r\n\r\n![Using Boring Cyborg Probot to add new labels](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/kaxil/boring-cyborg/master/assets/usage-screenshot-1.png)\r\n\r\n![Congratulate user on first merged PR](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/kaxil/boring-cyborg/master/assets/usage-first-merged-pr.gif)\r\n\r\n## Features\r\n\r\n* Add labels based on the path of the file that are modified in the PR.\r\n* Welcome new users to your project when they open their first Issue/PR or first merged PR by an\r\nautomated comment. \r\n* Insert Issue (Jira/Github etc) link in PR description based on the Issue ID in PR title.\r\n* Verifies if commits/PR titles match the regular expression specified\r\n* Check if a branch is up to date with the master when specific files are modified in the PR. This is helpful when you desire the changes to be applied sequentially, for example, alembic migrations.\r\n\r\n## Usage\r\n\r\n1. **[Configure the Github App](https://github.com/apps/boring-cyborg)**\r\n2. After installing the Github app, create `.github/boring-cyborg.yml` in the default branch to enable it\r\n3. It will start scanning for pull requests within few minutes.\r\n\r\n```yaml\r\n##### Labeler ##########################################################################################################\r\n# Enable "labeler" for your PR that would add labels to PRs based on the paths that are modified in the PR.\r\nlabelPRBasedOnFilePath:\r\n  # Add \'label1\' to any changes within \'example\' folder or any subfolders\r\n  label1:\r\n    - example/**/*\r\n\r\n  # Add \'label2\' to any file changes within \'example2\' folder\r\n  label2:\r\n    - example2/*\r\n\r\n  # Complex: Add \'area/core\' label to any change within the \'core\' package\r\n  area/core:\r\n    - src/core/*\r\n    - src/core/**/*  \r\n\r\n  # Add \'test\' label to any change to *.spec.js files within the source dir\r\n  test:\r\n    - src/**/*.spec.js\r\n\r\n##### Greetings ########################################################################################################\r\n# Comment to be posted to welcome users when they open their first PR\r\nfirstPRWelcomeComment: >\r\n  Thanks for opening this pull request! Please check out our contributing guidelines.\r\n\r\n# Comment to be posted to congratulate user on their first merged PR\r\nfirstPRMergeComment: >\r\n  Awesome work, congrats on your first merged pull request!\r\n\r\n# Comment to be posted to on first time issues\r\nfirstIssueWelcomeComment: >\r\n  Thanks for opening your first issue here! Be sure to follow the issue template!\r\n\r\n###### IssueLink Adder #################################################################################################\r\n# Insert Issue (Jira/Github etc) link in PR description based on the Issue ID in PR title.\r\ninsertIssueLinkInPrDescription:\r\n   # specify the placeholder for the issue link that should be present in the description\r\n  descriptionIssuePlaceholderRegexp: "^Issue link: (.*)$"\r\n  matchers:\r\n    # you can have several matches - for different types of issues\r\n    # only the first matching entry is replaced\r\n    jiraIssueMatch:\r\n      # specify the regexp of issue id that you can find in the title of the PR\r\n      # the match groups can be used to build the issue id (${1}, ${2}, etc.).\r\n      titleIssueIdRegexp: \\[(AIRFLOW-[0-9]{4})\\]\r\n      # the issue link to be added. ${1}, ${2} ... are replaced with the match groups from the\r\n      # title match (remember to use quotes)\r\n      descriptionIssueLink: "[${1}](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/${1}/)"\r\n    docOnlyIssueMatch:\r\n      titleIssueIdRegexp: \\[(AIRFLOW-X{4})\\]\r\n      descriptionIssueLink: "`Document only change, no JIRA issue`"\r\n\r\n###### Title Validator #################################################################################################\r\n# Verifies if commit/PR titles match the regexp specified\r\nverifyTitles:\r\n  # Regular expression that should be matched by titles of commits or PR\r\n  titleRegexp: ^\\[AIRFLOW-[0-9]{4}\\].*$|^\\[AIRFLOW-XXXX\\].*$\r\n  # If set to true, it will always check the PR title (as opposed to the individual commits).\r\n  alwaysUsePrTitle: true\r\n  # If set to true, it will only check the commit in case there is a single commit.\r\n  # In case of multiple commits it will check PR title.\r\n  # This reflects the standard behaviour of Github that for `Squash & Merge` GitHub\r\n  # uses the PR title rather than commit messages for the squashed commit ¯\\_(ツ)_/¯\r\n  # For single-commit PRs it takes the squashed commit message from the commit as expected.\r\n  #\r\n  # If set to false it will check all commit messages. This is useful when you do not squash commits at merge.\r\n  validateEitherPrOrSingleCommitTitle: true\r\n  # The title the GitHub status should appear from.\r\n  statusTitle: "Title Validator"\r\n  # A custom message to be displayed when the title passes validation.\r\n  successMessage: "Validation successful!"\r\n  # A custom message to be displayed when the title fails validation.\r\n  # Allows insertion of ${type} (commit/PR), ${title} (the title validated) and ${regex} (the titleRegexp above).\r\n  failureMessage: "Wrong ${type} title: ${title}"\r\n\r\n###### PR/Branch Up-To-Date Checker ####################################################################################\r\n# Check if the branch is up to date with master when certain files are modified\r\ncheckUpToDate:\r\n  # The default branch is "master", change the branch if you want to check against a different target branch  \r\n  targetBranch: master\r\n  files:\r\n  # File paths that you want to check for\r\n  # In this example, it checks if the branch is up to date when alembic migrations are modified in the PR.\r\n  # It helps avoid multiple heads in alembic migrations in a collaborative development project.\r\n    - airflow/migrations/*\r\n    - airflow/migrations/**/*\r\n    - airflow/alembic.ini\r\n```\r\n\r\nAll the features are optional. Simply add the config for the feature you want to use.\r\n\r\nIf you are having issues with the GitHub app not working, please create an issue on https://github.com/kaxil/boring-cyborg/issues.\r\n\r\n', 'external_url': 'https://github.com/kaxil/boring-cyborg', 'html_url': 'https://github.com/apps/boring-cyborg', 'created_at': '2025-01-23T02:28:43Z', 'author_association': 'MEMBER', 'body': "`DelayQueue` contains a `PriorityBlockingQueue `, the element 1 should be return here, so it will not block other events.\nThe main problem here is the event bus worker will `poll` events from the event bus at an interval (default is 100ms), since one worker needs to fire multiple event bus, so it cannot block here. But this is ok, since poll is very fast.\n\nIt's great if we can move `PriorityDelayQueue` under `dolphinscheduler-eventbus`, since the main logic are same at `DelayEntry` and `AbstractDelayEvent`. state FAILURE\n[WI-3954361][TI-0] - 2025-01-22 15:00:20.579 INFO  [ds-workflow-eventbus-worker-20] o.a.d.s.m.e.w.l.h.AbstractWorkflowLifecycleEventHandler:[47] - Begin fire workflow <Workflow-with-retry-task>-20250122145518737 LifecycleEvent[WorkflowStopLifecycleEvent{workflow=<Workflow-with-retry-task>-20250122145518737}] with state: RUNNING_EXECUTION\n[WI-3954361][TI-0] - 2025-01-22 15:00:20.582 INFO  [ds-workflow-eventbus-worker-20] o.a.d.s.m.e.w.s.AbstractWorkflowStateAction:[150] - Success set WorkflowExecuteRunnable: <Workflow-with-retry-task>-20250122145518737 state from: RUNNING_EXECUTION to READY_STOP\n\n...\n```\n\nand i just found the main reason is here !!:\n\nhttps://github.com/apache/dolphinscheduler/blob/352b47bd8576a47f83285ecfffec589de462fac0/dolphinscheduler-eventbus/src/main/java/org/apache/dolphinscheduler/eventbus/AbstractDelayEvent.java#L62-L64\n\nAbstractDelayEvent use createTimeInNano to compare other event, DelayQueue will sort the events using createTimeInNano, so the retry event was first put in queue, DelayQueue will take retry event first.\n\nif i change the compared value `createTimeInNano` to `createTimeInNano + delayTime`, that will not block the Following 0 delay events any more.\n\n\n', 'reactions': {'url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/apache/dolphinscheduler/issues/comments/2608725571/reactions', 'total_count': 0, '+1': 0, '-1': 0, 'laugh': 0, 'hooray': 0, 'confused': 0, 'heart': 0, 'rocket': 0, <Workflow-with-retry-task>-20250122145518737 state from: RUNNING_EXECUTION to READY_STOP\n> \n> ...\n> ```\n> \n> and i just found the main reason is here !!:\n> \n> [dolphinscheduler/dolphinscheduler-eventbus/src/main/java/org/apache/dolphinscheduler/eventbus/AbstractDelayEvent.java](https://github.com/apache/dolphinscheduler/blob/352b47bd8576a47f83285ecfffec589de462fac0/dolphinscheduler-eventbus/src/main/java/org/apache/dolphinscheduler/eventbus/AbstractDelayEvent.java#L62-L64)\n> \n> Lines 62 to 64 in [352b47b](/apache/dolphinscheduler/commit/352b47bd8576a47f83285ecfffec589de462fac0)\n> \n>  public int compareTo(Delayed other) { \n>      return Long.compare(this.createTimeInNano, ((AbstractDelayEvent) other).createTimeInNano); \n>  } \n> AbstractDelayEvent use createTimeInNano to compare other event, DelayQueue will sort the events using createTimeInNano, so the retry event was first put in queue, DelayQueue will take retry event first.\n> \n> if i change the compared value `createTimeInNano` to `createTimeInNano + delayTime`, that will not block the Following 0 delay events any more.\n\nThis is a bug 👍 .\n\nIf the event is not expired then should use `exipre time` to compare them, if the event is already expired then should use create time to compare them.', 'reactions': {'url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/apache/dolphinscheduler/issues/comments/2608748984/reactions', 'total_count': 0, '+1': 0, '-1': 0, 'laugh': 0, The majority of popular languages can be analyzed automatically; no configuration is required!\r\n\r\nWith [SonarQube Cloud](https://sonarcloud.io/github), you get:\r\n\r\n-   Fast, precise static analysis and feedback on your code\r\n    \r\n-   Support for popular languages, frameworks, and IaC tools\r\n    \r\n-   Free analysis for open-source projects and private projects up to max 50k LoC\r\n    \r\n-   Automatic analysis of pull requests and branches with results reported inline\r\n    \r\n-   IDE Support with [SonarQube for IDE](https://www.sonarsource.com/products/sonarlint/) integration\r\n    \r\n-   Quality Gate (added as a GitHub check) acting at two different levels - first, preventing you from merging pull requests that contain issues - and later, helping you to release only clean, safe code\r\n    \r\n-   Sign up for SonarQube free tier and begin scanning your private and public repositories\r\n    \r\n\r\nA [GitHub Action](https://github.com/marketplace/actions/sonarcloud-scan) is available in the marketplace to make it easy for you (for projects where automatic analysis isn't available). 'https://api.github.com/users/kaxil/events{/privacy}', 'received_events_url': 'https://api.github.com/users/kaxil/received_events', 'type': 'User', 'user_view_type': 'public', 'site_admin': False}, 'name': 'boring-cyborg', 'description': 'A Github bot to automatically label PRs, issues and perform all the boring operations that you don\'t want to do.\r\n\r\n\r\n![Using Boring Cyborg Probot to add new labels](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/kaxil/boring-cyborg/master/assets/usage-screenshot-1.png)\r\n\r\n![Congratulate user on first merged PR](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/kaxil/boring-cyborg/master/assets/usage-first-merged-pr.gif)\r\n\r\n## Features\r\n\r\n* Add labels based on the path of the file that are modified in the PR.\r\n* Welcome new users to your project when they open their first Issue/PR or first merged PR by an\r\nautomated comment. \r\n* Insert Issue (Jira/Github etc) link in PR description based on the Issue ID in PR title.\r\n* Verifies if commits/PR titles match the regular expression specified\r\n* Check if a branch is up to date with the master when specific files are modified in the PR. This is helpful when you desire the changes to be applied sequentially, for example, alembic migrations.\r\n\r\n## Usage\r\n\r\n1. **[Configure the Github App](https://github.com/apps/boring-cyborg)**\r\n2. After installing the Github app, create `.github/boring-cyborg.yml` in the default branch to enable it\r\n3. It will start scanning for pull requests within few minutes.\r\n\r\n```yaml\r\n##### Labeler ##########################################################################################################\r\n# Enable "labeler" for your PR that would add labels to PRs based on the paths that are modified in the PR.\r\nlabelPRBasedOnFilePath:\r\n  # Add \'label1\' to any changes within \'example\' folder or any subfolders\r\n  label1:\r\n    - example/**/*\r\n\r\n  # Add \'label2\' to any file changes within \'example2\' folder\r\n  label2:\r\n    - example2/*\r\n\r\n  # Complex: Add \'area/core\' label to any change within the \'core\' package\r\n  area/core:\r\n    - src/core/*\r\n    - src/core/**/*  \r\n\r\n  # Add \'test\' label to any change to *.spec.js files within the source dir\r\n  test:\r\n    - src/**/*.spec.js\r\n\r\n##### Greetings ########################################################################################################\r\n# Comment to be posted to welcome users when they open their first PR\r\nfirstPRWelcomeComment: >\r\n  Thanks for opening this pull request! Please check out our contributing guidelines.\r\n\r\n# Comment to be posted to congratulate user on their first merged PR\r\nfirstPRMergeComment: >\r\n  Awesome work, congrats on your first merged pull request!\r\n\r\n# Comment to be posted to on first time issues\r\nfirstIssueWelcomeComment: >\r\n  Thanks for opening your first issue here! Be sure to follow the issue template!\r\n\r\n###### IssueLink Adder #################################################################################################\r\n# Insert Issue (Jira/Github etc) link in PR description based on the Issue ID in PR title.\r\ninsertIssueLinkInPrDescription:\r\n   # specify the placeholder for the issue link that should be present in the description\r\n  descriptionIssuePlaceholderRegexp: "^Issue link: (.*)$"\r\n  matchers:\r\n    # you can have several matches - for different types of issues\r\n    # only the first matching entry is replaced\r\n    jiraIssueMatch:\r\n      # specify the regexp of issue id that you can find in the title of the PR\r\n      # the match groups can be used to build the issue id (${1}, ${2}, etc.).\r\n      titleIssueIdRegexp: \\[(AIRFLOW-[0-9]{4})\\]\r\n      # the issue link to be added. ${1}, ${2} ... are replaced with the match groups from the\r\n      # title match (remember to use quotes)\r\n      descriptionIssueLink: "[${1}](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/${1}/)"\r\n    docOnlyIssueMatch:\r\n      titleIssueIdRegexp: \\[(AIRFLOW-X{4})\\]\r\n      descriptionIssueLink: "`Document only change, no JIRA issue`"\r\n\r\n###### Title Validator #################################################################################################\r\n# Verifies if commit/PR titles match the regexp specified\r\nverifyTitles:\r\n  # Regular expression that should be matched by titles of commits or PR\r\n  titleRegexp: ^\\[AIRFLOW-[0-9]{4}\\].*$|^\\[AIRFLOW-XXXX\\].*$\r\n  # If set to true, it will always check the PR title (as opposed to the individual commits).\r\n  alwaysUsePrTitle: true\r\n  # If set to true, it will only check the commit in case there is a single commit.\r\n  # In case of multiple commits it will check PR title.\r\n  # This reflects the standard behaviour of Github that for `Squash & Merge` GitHub\r\n  # uses the PR title rather than commit messages for the squashed commit ¯\\_(ツ)_/¯\r\n  # For single-commit PRs it takes the squashed commit message from the commit as expected.\r\n  #\r\n  # If set to false it will check all commit messages. This is useful when you do not squash commits at merge.\r\n  validateEitherPrOrSingleCommitTitle: true\r\n  # The title the GitHub status should appear from.\r\n  statusTitle: "Title Validator"\r\n  # A custom message to be displayed when the title passes validation.\r\n  successMessage: "Validation successful!"\r\n  # A custom message to be displayed when the title fails validation.\r\n  # Allows insertion of ${type} (commit/PR), ${title} (the title validated) and ${regex} (the titleRegexp above).\r\n  failureMessage: "Wrong ${type} title: ${title}"\r\n\r\n###### PR/Branch Up-To-Date Checker ####################################################################################\r\n# Check if the branch is up to date with master when certain files are modified\r\ncheckUpToDate:\r\n  # The default branch is "master", change the branch if you want to check against a different target branch  \r\n  targetBranch: master\r\n  files:\r\n  # File paths that you want to check for\r\n  # In this example, it checks if the branch is up to date when alembic migrations are modified in the PR.\r\n  # It helps avoid multiple heads in alembic migrations in a collaborative development project.\r\n    - airflow/migrations/*\r\n    - airflow/migrations/**/*\r\n    - airflow/alembic.ini\r\n```\r\n\r\nAll the features are optional. Simply add the config for the feature you want to use.\r\n\r\nIf you are having issues with the GitHub app not working, please create an issue on https://github.com/kaxil/boring-cyborg/issues.\r\n\r\n', 'external_url': 'https://github.com/kaxil/boring-cyborg', 'html_url': 'https://github.com/apps/boring-cyborg', 'created_at': 'https://api.github.com/users/kaxil/events{/privacy}', 'received_events_url': 'https://api.github.com/users/kaxil/received_events', 'type': 'User', 'user_view_type': 'public', 'site_admin': False}, 'name': 'boring-cyborg', 'description': 'A Github bot to automatically label PRs, issues and perform all the boring operations that you don\'t want to do.\r\n\r\n\r\n![Using Boring Cyborg Probot to add new labels](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/kaxil/boring-cyborg/master/assets/usage-screenshot-1.png)\r\n\r\n![Congratulate user on first merged PR](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/kaxil/boring-cyborg/master/assets/usage-first-merged-pr.gif)\r\n\r\n## Features\r\n\r\n* Add labels based on the path of the file that are modified in the PR.\r\n* Welcome new users to your project when they open their first Issue/PR or first merged PR by an\r\nautomated comment. \r\n* Insert Issue (Jira/Github etc) link in PR description based on the Issue ID in PR title.\r\n* Verifies if commits/PR titles match the regular expression specified\r\n* Check if a branch is up to date with the master when specific files are modified in the PR. This is helpful when you desire the changes to be applied sequentially, for example, alembic migrations.\r\n\r\n## Usage\r\n\r\n1. **[Configure the Github App](https://github.com/apps/boring-cyborg)**\r\n2. After installing the Github app, create `.github/boring-cyborg.yml` in the default branch to enable it\r\n3. It will start scanning for pull requests within few minutes.\r\n\r\n```yaml\r\n##### Labeler ##########################################################################################################\r\n# Enable "labeler" for your PR that would add labels to PRs based on the paths that are modified in the PR.\r\nlabelPRBasedOnFilePath:\r\n  # Add \'label1\' to any changes within \'example\' folder or any subfolders\r\n  label1:\r\n    - example/**/*\r\n\r\n  # Add \'label2\' to any file changes within \'example2\' folder\r\n  label2:\r\n    - example2/*\r\n\r\n  # Complex: Add \'area/core\' label to any change within the \'core\' package\r\n  area/core:\r\n    - src/core/*\r\n    - src/core/**/*  \r\n\r\n  # Add \'test\' label to any change to *.spec.js files within the source dir\r\n  test:\r\n    - src/**/*.spec.js\r\n\r\n##### Greetings ########################################################################################################\r\n# Comment to be posted to welcome users when they open their first PR\r\nfirstPRWelcomeComment: >\r\n  Thanks for opening this pull request! Please check out our contributing guidelines.\r\n\r\n# Comment to be posted to congratulate user on their first merged PR\r\nfirstPRMergeComment: >\r\n  Awesome work, congrats on your first merged pull request!\r\n\r\n# Comment to be posted to on first time issues\r\nfirstIssueWelcomeComment: >\r\n  Thanks for opening your first issue here! Be sure to follow the issue template!\r\n\r\n###### IssueLink Adder #################################################################################################\r\n# Insert Issue (Jira/Github etc) link in PR description based on the Issue ID in PR title.\r\ninsertIssueLinkInPrDescription:\r\n   # specify the placeholder for the issue link that should be present in the description\r\n  descriptionIssuePlaceholderRegexp: "^Issue link: (.*)$"\r\n  matchers:\r\n    # you can have several matches - for different types of issues\r\n    # only the first matching entry is replaced\r\n    jiraIssueMatch:\r\n      # specify the regexp of issue id that you can find in the title of the PR\r\n      # the match groups can be used to build the issue id (${1}, ${2}, etc.).\r\n      titleIssueIdRegexp: \\[(AIRFLOW-[0-9]{4})\\]\r\n      # the issue link to be added. ${1}, ${2} ... are replaced with the match groups from the\r\n      # title match (remember to use quotes)\r\n      descriptionIssueLink: "[${1}](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/${1}/)"\r\n    docOnlyIssueMatch:\r\n      titleIssueIdRegexp: \\[(AIRFLOW-X{4})\\]\r\n      descriptionIssueLink: "`Document only change, no JIRA issue`"\r\n\r\n###### Title Validator #################################################################################################\r\n# Verifies if commit/PR titles match the regexp specified\r\nverifyTitles:\r\n  # Regular expression that should be matched by titles of commits or PR\r\n  titleRegexp: ^\\[AIRFLOW-[0-9]{4}\\].*$|^\\[AIRFLOW-XXXX\\].*$\r\n  # If set to true, it will always check the PR title (as opposed to the individual commits).\r\n  alwaysUsePrTitle: true\r\n  # If set to true, it will only check the commit in case there is a single commit.\r\n  # In case of multiple commits it will check PR title.\r\n  # This reflects the standard behaviour of Github that for `Squash & Merge` GitHub\r\n  # uses the PR title rather than commit messages for the squashed commit ¯\\_(ツ)_/¯\r\n  # For single-commit PRs it takes the squashed commit message from the commit as expected.\r\n  #\r\n  # If set to false it will check all commit messages. This is useful when you do not squash commits at merge.\r\n  validateEitherPrOrSingleCommitTitle: true\r\n  # The title the GitHub status should appear from.\r\n  statusTitle: "Title Validator"\r\n  # A custom message to be displayed when the title passes validation.\r\n  successMessage: "Validation successful!"\r\n  # A custom message to be displayed when the title fails validation.\r\n  # Allows insertion of ${type} (commit/PR), ${title} (the title validated) and ${regex} (the titleRegexp above).\r\n  failureMessage: "Wrong ${type} title: ${title}"\r\n\r\n###### PR/Branch Up-To-Date Checker ####################################################################################\r\n# Check if the branch is up to date with master when certain files are modified\r\ncheckUpToDate:\r\n  # The default branch is "master", change the branch if you want to check against a different target branch  \r\n  targetBranch: master\r\n  files:\r\n  # File paths that you want to check for\r\n  # In this example, it checks if the branch is up to date when alembic migrations are modified in the PR.\r\n  # It helps avoid multiple heads in alembic migrations in a collaborative development project.\r\n    - airflow/migrations/*\r\n    - airflow/migrations/**/*\r\n    - airflow/alembic.ini\r\n```\r\n\r\nAll the features are optional. Simply add the config for the feature you want to use.\r\n\r\nIf you are having issues with the GitHub app not working, please create an issue on https://github.com/kaxil/boring-cyborg/issues.\r\n\r\n', 'external_url': 'https://github.com/kaxil/boring-cyborg', 'html_url': 'https://github.com/apps/boring-cyborg', 'created_at': then it detected the same failoverNodePath and goes to stop.\r\n> \r\n> Or maybe if a master do failover to itself, it should change or remove the failoverNodePath?\r\n\r\nIf the master stop and startup again, the `failoverNodePath` will changed, since the master startup time has changed.\r\nAnd failoverNodePath contains the master startup time.\r\n\r\n```java\r\npublic static String getFailoverFinishedNodePath(final String masterAddress, final long masterStartupTime) {\r\n        return RegistryNodeType.FAILOVER_FINISH_NODES.getRegistryPath() + "/" + masterAddress + "-" +
