'2025-01-09T09:50:36Z', 'author_association': 'MEMBER', 'body': "I got you, this could happen, since the global master failover event time might equals with master startup time.\r\n\r\n```\r\npublic void initialized() {\r\n    ServerLifeCycleManager.toRunning();\r\n    final long startupTime = System.currentTimeMillis();\r\n    ....\r\n    this.systemEventBus.publish(GlobalMasterFailoverEvent.of(new Date(startupTime)));\r\n}\r\n```\r\n\r\nThe `failoverFinishedNodePath` is used to avoid duplicate failover one master and avoid the master still running once it has been failovered.\r\n\r\nWe need to change the `failoverFinishedNodePath` to ` /{masterAddress-masterStartupTime-masterId`, for global master failover the masterId is unknown, then this problem should be fixed. We can use uuid as the master's id.\r\n", 'reactions': {'url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/apache/dolphinscheduler/issues/comments/2579628665/reactions', 'total_count': 1, '+1': 0, '-1': 0, 'laugh': 0, 'hooray': 1, 'confused': 0, 'heart': 0, 'rocket': 0, 'eyes': 0}, 'performed_via_github_app': None}]

It is full of pitfalls. I installed it according to the instructions https://dolphinscheduler.apache.org/zh-cn/docs/3.1.5/guide/installation/pseudo-cluster. I found that I encountered problems almost every 1-2 steps. I asked step by step. I have been struggling with chatgpt 4o. It has been 2 days and only two-thirds of the way. I admit that I am a novice on Ubuntu. I temporarily learned some Ubuntu commands in order to install the pilot project. However, for the majority of users who want to promote the development of the community, the importance of documentation far exceeds the project itself. I hope that everyone can work together to make this open source The project truly benefits the public, so that the public can be more motivated to give feedback and improve. Now I will briefly describe several document problems I found as follows:\r\n1. The section "Preparing the DolphinScheduler startup environment" should be placed at the top of the document. Reason: If you directly follow the "preparatory work", all tools that require pre-installation will be installed in the account you are currently logged in, but in fact they should be installed in a new account. For example, as described in subsequent documents: Create the dolphinscheduler user.\r\n2. # To create a user, you need to log in as root: useradd dolphinscheduler. This command should be preceded by sudo, or tell the user how to first enter the root account.\r\n3. # Modify the directory permissions so that the deployment user has operating permissions on the apache-dolphinscheduler-*-bin directory after the binary package is decompressed. chown -R dolphinscheduler:dolphinscheduler apache-dolphinscheduler-*-bin. The description here is very unclear. It should be explained that apache-dolphinscheduler-*-bin is replaced with the file name after decompression of the binary installation package.\r\n4. Enter the installation directory of zookeeper, copy the zoo_sample.cfg configuration file to conf/zoo.cfg, and change the value of dataDir in conf/zoo.cfg to dataDir=./tmp/zookeeper. The zoo_sample.cfg configuration file has changed in the new version.\r\n5. Modify the install_env.sh file. Where is this file? Not found yet\r\nThe above are just a small part. The majority of popular languages can be analyzed automatically; no configuration is required!\r\n\r\nWith [SonarQube Cloud](https://sonarcloud.io/github), you get:\r\n\r\n-   Fast, precise static analysis and feedback on your code\r\n    \r\n-   Support for popular languages, frameworks, and IaC tools\r\n    \r\n-   Free analysis for open-source projects and private projects up to max 50k LoC\r\n    \r\n-   Automatic analysis of pull requests and branches with results reported inline\r\n    \r\n-   IDE Support with [SonarQube for IDE](https://www.sonarsource.com/products/sonarlint/) integration\r\n    \r\n-   Quality Gate (added as a GitHub check) acting at two different levels - first, preventing you from merging pull requests that contain issues - and later, helping you to release only clean, safe code\r\n    \r\n-   Sign up for SonarQube free tier and begin scanning your private and public repositories\r\n    \r\n\r\nA [GitHub Action](https://github.com/marketplace/actions/sonarcloud-scan) is available in the marketplace to make it easy for you (for projects where automatic analysis isn't available). SonarQube Cloud also integrates smoothly with Jenkins, CircleCI, TravisCI, CirrusCI, and many other tools.\r\n\r\nA free tier is available that allows you to explore the benefits of SonarQube Cloud using your public and private repositories. 'name': 'boring-cyborg', 'description': 'A Github bot to automatically label PRs, issues and perform all the boring operations that you don\'t want to do.\r\n\r\n\r\n![Using Boring Cyborg Probot to add new labels](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/kaxil/boring-cyborg/master/assets/usage-screenshot-1.png)\r\n\r\n![Congratulate user on first merged PR](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/kaxil/boring-cyborg/master/assets/usage-first-merged-pr.gif)\r\n\r\n## Features\r\n\r\n* Add labels based on the path of the file that are modified in the PR.\r\n* Welcome new users to your project when they open their first Issue/PR or first merged PR by an\r\nautomated comment. \r\n* Insert Issue (Jira/Github etc) link in PR description based on the Issue ID in PR title.\r\n* Verifies if commits/PR titles match the regular expression specified\r\n* Check if a branch is up to date with the master when specific files are modified in the PR. This is helpful when you desire the changes to be applied sequentially, for example, alembic migrations.\r\n\r\n## Usage\r\n\r\n1. **[Configure the Github App](https://github.com/apps/boring-cyborg)**\r\n2. After installing the Github app, create `.github/boring-cyborg.yml` in the default branch to enable it\r\n3. It will start scanning for pull requests within few minutes.\r\n\r\n```yaml\r\n##### Labeler ##########################################################################################################\r\n# Enable "labeler" for your PR that would add labels to PRs based on the paths that are modified in the PR.\r\nlabelPRBasedOnFilePath:\r\n  # Add \'label1\' to any changes within \'example\' folder or any subfolders\r\n  label1:\r\n    - example/**/*\r\n\r\n  # Add \'label2\' to any file changes within \'example2\' folder\r\n  label2:\r\n    - example2/*\r\n\r\n  # Complex: Add \'area/core\' label to any change within the \'core\' package\r\n  area/core:\r\n    - src/core/*\r\n    - src/core/**/*  \r\n\r\n  # Add \'test\' label to any change to *.spec.js files within the source dir\r\n  test:\r\n    - src/**/*.spec.js\r\n\r\n##### Greetings ########################################################################################################\r\n# Comment to be posted to welcome users when they open their first PR\r\nfirstPRWelcomeComment: >\r\n  Thanks for opening this pull request! Please check out our contributing guidelines.\r\n\r\n# Comment to be posted to congratulate user on their first merged PR\r\nfirstPRMergeComment: >\r\n  Awesome work, congrats on your first merged pull request!\r\n\r\n# Comment to be posted to on first time issues\r\nfirstIssueWelcomeComment: >\r\n  Thanks for opening your first issue here! Be sure to follow the issue template!\r\n\r\n###### IssueLink Adder #################################################################################################\r\n# Insert Issue (Jira/Github etc) link in PR description based on the Issue ID in PR title.\r\ninsertIssueLinkInPrDescription:\r\n   # specify the placeholder for the issue link that should be present in the description\r\n  descriptionIssuePlaceholderRegexp: "^Issue link: (.*)$"\r\n  matchers:\r\n    # you can have several matches - for different types of issues\r\n    # only the first matching entry is replaced\r\n    jiraIssueMatch:\r\n      # specify the regexp of issue id that you can find in the title of the PR\r\n      # the match groups can be used to build the issue id (${1}, ${2}, etc.).\r\n      titleIssueIdRegexp: \\[(AIRFLOW-[0-9]{4})\\]\r\n      # the issue link to be added. ${1}, ${2} ... are replaced with the match groups from the\r\n      # title match (remember to use quotes)\r\n      descriptionIssueLink: "[${1}](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/${1}/)"\r\n    docOnlyIssueMatch:\r\n      titleIssueIdRegexp: \\[(AIRFLOW-X{4})\\]\r\n      descriptionIssueLink: "`Document only change, no JIRA issue`"\r\n\r\n###### Title Validator #################################################################################################\r\n# Verifies if commit/PR titles match the regexp specified\r\nverifyTitles:\r\n  # Regular expression that should be matched by titles of commits or PR\r\n  titleRegexp: ^\\[AIRFLOW-[0-9]{4}\\].*$|^\\[AIRFLOW-XXXX\\].*$\r\n  # If set to true, it will always check the PR title (as opposed to the individual commits).\r\n  alwaysUsePrTitle: true\r\n  # If set to true, it will only check the commit in case there is a single commit.\r\n  # In case of multiple commits it will check PR title.\r\n  # This reflects the standard behaviour of Github that for `Squash & Merge` GitHub\r\n  # uses the PR title rather than commit messages for the squashed commit ¯\\_(ツ)_/¯\r\n  # For single-commit PRs it takes the squashed commit message from the commit as expected.\r\n  #\r\n  # If set to false it will check all commit messages. This is useful when you do not squash commits at merge.\r\n  validateEitherPrOrSingleCommitTitle: true\r\n  # The title the GitHub status should appear from.\r\n  statusTitle: "Title Validator"\r\n  # A custom message to be displayed when the title passes validation.\r\n  successMessage: "Validation successful!"\r\n  # A custom message to be displayed when the title fails validation.\r\n  # Allows insertion of ${type} (commit/PR), ${title} (the title validated) and ${regex} (the titleRegexp above).\r\n  failureMessage: "Wrong ${type} title: ${title}"\r\n\r\n###### PR/Branch Up-To-Date Checker ####################################################################################\r\n# Check if the branch is up to date with master when certain files are modified\r\ncheckUpToDate:\r\n  # The default branch is "master", change the branch if you want to check against a different target branch  \r\n  targetBranch: master\r\n  files:\r\n  # File paths that you want to check for\r\n  # In this example, it checks if the branch is up to date when alembic migrations are modified in the PR.\r\n  # It helps avoid multiple heads in alembic migrations in a collaborative development project.\r\n    - airflow/migrations/*\r\n    - airflow/migrations/**/*\r\n    - airflow/alembic.ini\r\n```\r\n\r\nAll the features are optional. Simply add the config for the feature you want to use.\r\n\r\nIf you are having issues with the GitHub app not working, please create an issue on https://github.com/kaxil/boring-cyborg/issues.\r\n\r\n', 'external_url': 'https://github.com/kaxil/boring-cyborg', 'html_url': 'https://github.com/apps/boring-cyborg', 'created_at': 'https://api.github.com/users/kaxil/events{/privacy}', 'received_events_url': 'https://api.github.com/users/kaxil/received_events', 'type': 'User', 'user_view_type': 'public', 'site_admin': False}, 'name': 'boring-cyborg', 'description': 'A Github bot to automatically label PRs, issues and perform all the boring operations that you don\'t want to do.\r\n\r\n\r\n![Using Boring Cyborg Probot to add new labels](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/kaxil/boring-cyborg/master/assets/usage-screenshot-1.png)\r\n\r\n![Congratulate user on first merged PR](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/kaxil/boring-cyborg/master/assets/usage-first-merged-pr.gif)\r\n\r\n## Features\r\n\r\n* Add labels based on the path of the file that are modified in the PR.\r\n* Welcome new users to your project when they open their first Issue/PR or first merged PR by an\r\nautomated comment. \r\n* Insert Issue (Jira/Github etc) link in PR description based on the Issue ID in PR title.\r\n* Verifies if commits/PR titles match the regular expression specified\r\n* Check if a branch is up to date with the master when specific files are modified in the PR. This is helpful when you desire the changes to be applied sequentially, for example, alembic migrations.\r\n\r\n## Usage\r\n\r\n1. **[Configure the Github App](https://github.com/apps/boring-cyborg)**\r\n2. After installing the Github app, create `.github/boring-cyborg.yml` in the default branch to enable it\r\n3. It will start scanning for pull requests within few minutes.\r\n\r\n```yaml\r\n##### Labeler ##########################################################################################################\r\n# Enable "labeler" for your PR that would add labels to PRs based on the paths that are modified in the PR.\r\nlabelPRBasedOnFilePath:\r\n  # Add \'label1\' to any changes within \'example\' folder or any subfolders\r\n  label1:\r\n    - example/**/*\r\n\r\n  # Add \'label2\' to any file changes within \'example2\' folder\r\n  label2:\r\n    - example2/*\r\n\r\n  # Complex: Add \'area/core\' label to any change within the \'core\' package\r\n  area/core:\r\n    - src/core/*\r\n    - src/core/**/*  \r\n\r\n  # Add \'test\' label to any change to *.spec.js files within the source dir\r\n  test:\r\n    - src/**/*.spec.js\r\n\r\n##### Greetings ########################################################################################################\r\n# Comment to be posted to welcome users when they open their first PR\r\nfirstPRWelcomeComment: >\r\n  Thanks for opening this pull request! Please check out our contributing guidelines.\r\n\r\n# Comment to be posted to congratulate user on their first merged PR\r\nfirstPRMergeComment: >\r\n  Awesome work, congrats on your first merged pull request!\r\n\r\n# Comment to be posted to on first time issues\r\nfirstIssueWelcomeComment: >\r\n  Thanks for opening your first issue here! Be sure to follow the issue template!\r\n\r\n###### IssueLink Adder #################################################################################################\r\n# Insert Issue (Jira/Github etc) link in PR description based on the Issue ID in PR title.\r\ninsertIssueLinkInPrDescription:\r\n   # specify the placeholder for the issue link that should be present in the description\r\n  descriptionIssuePlaceholderRegexp: "^Issue link: (.*)$"\r\n  matchers:\r\n    # you can have several matches - for different types of issues\r\n    # only the first matching entry is replaced\r\n    jiraIssueMatch:\r\n      # specify the regexp of issue id that you can find in the title of the PR\r\n      # the match groups can be used to build the issue id (${1}, ${2}, etc.).\r\n      titleIssueIdRegexp: \\[(AIRFLOW-[0-9]{4})\\]\r\n      # the issue link to be added. ${1}, ${2} ... are replaced with the match groups from the\r\n      # title match (remember to use quotes)\r\n      descriptionIssueLink: "[${1}](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/${1}/)"\r\n    docOnlyIssueMatch:\r\n      titleIssueIdRegexp: \\[(AIRFLOW-X{4})\\]\r\n      descriptionIssueLink: "`Document only change, no JIRA issue`"\r\n\r\n###### Title Validator #################################################################################################\r\n# Verifies if commit/PR titles match the regexp specified\r\nverifyTitles:\r\n  # Regular expression that should be matched by titles of commits or PR\r\n  titleRegexp: ^\\[AIRFLOW-[0-9]{4}\\].*$|^\\[AIRFLOW-XXXX\\].*$\r\n  # If set to true, it will always check the PR title (as opposed to the individual commits).\r\n  alwaysUsePrTitle: true\r\n  # If set to true, it will only check the commit in case there is a single commit.\r\n  # In case of multiple commits it will check PR title.\r\n  # This reflects the standard behaviour of Github that for `Squash & Merge` GitHub\r\n  # uses the PR title rather than commit messages for the squashed commit ¯\\_(ツ)_/¯\r\n  # For single-commit PRs it takes the squashed commit message from the commit as expected.\r\n  #\r\n  # If set to false it will check all commit messages. This is useful when you do not squash commits at merge.\r\n  validateEitherPrOrSingleCommitTitle: true\r\n  # The title the GitHub status should appear from.\r\n  statusTitle: "Title Validator"\r\n  # A custom message to be displayed when the title passes validation.\r\n  successMessage: "Validation successful!"\r\n  # A custom message to be displayed when the title fails validation.\r\n  # Allows insertion of ${type} (commit/PR), ${title} (the title validated) and ${regex} (the titleRegexp above).\r\n  failureMessage: "Wrong ${type} title: ${title}"\r\n\r\n###### PR/Branch Up-To-Date Checker ####################################################################################\r\n# Check if the branch is up to date with master when certain files are modified\r\ncheckUpToDate:\r\n  # The default branch is "master", change the branch if you want to check against a different target branch  \r\n  targetBranch: master\r\n  files:\r\n  # File paths that you want to check for\r\n  # In this example, it checks if the branch is up to date when alembic migrations are modified in the PR.\r\n  # It helps avoid multiple heads in alembic migrations in a collaborative development project.\r\n    - airflow/migrations/*\r\n    - airflow/migrations/**/*\r\n    - airflow/alembic.ini\r\n```\r\n\r\nAll the features are optional. Simply add the config for the feature you want to use.\r\n\r\nIf you are having issues with the GitHub app not working, please create an issue on https://github.com/kaxil/boring-cyborg/issues.\r\n\r\n', 'external_url': 'https://github.com/kaxil/boring-cyborg', 'html_url': 'https://github.com/apps/boring-cyborg', 'created_at': 'https://api.github.com/users/kaxil/events{/privacy}', 'received_events_url': 'https://api.github.com/users/kaxil/received_events', 'type': 'User', 'user_view_type': 'public', 'site_admin': False}, 'name': 'boring-cyborg', 'description': 'A Github bot to automatically label PRs, issues and perform all the boring operations that you don\'t want to do.\r\n\r\n\r\n![Using Boring Cyborg Probot to add new labels](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/kaxil/boring-cyborg/master/assets/usage-screenshot-1.png)\r\n\r\n![Congratulate user on first merged PR](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/kaxil/boring-cyborg/master/assets/usage-first-merged-pr.gif)\r\n\r\n## Features\r\n\r\n* Add labels based on the path of the file that are modified in the PR.\r\n* Welcome new users to your project when they open their first Issue/PR or first merged PR by an\r\nautomated comment. \r\n* Insert Issue (Jira/Github etc) link in PR description based on the Issue ID in PR title.\r\n* Verifies if commits/PR titles match the regular expression specified\r\n* Check if a branch is up to date with the master when specific files are modified in the PR. This is helpful when you desire the changes to be applied sequentially, for example, alembic migrations.\r\n\r\n## Usage\r\n\r\n1. **[Configure the Github App](https://github.com/apps/boring-cyborg)**\r\n2. After installing the Github app, create `.github/boring-cyborg.yml` in the default branch to enable it\r\n3. It will start scanning for pull requests within few minutes.\r\n\r\n```yaml\r\n##### Labeler ##########################################################################################################\r\n# Enable "labeler" for your PR that would add labels to PRs based on the paths that are modified in the PR.\r\nlabelPRBasedOnFilePath:\r\n  # Add \'label1\' to any changes within \'example\' folder or any subfolders\r\n  label1:\r\n    - example/**/*\r\n\r\n  # Add \'label2\' to any file changes within \'example2\' folder\r\n  label2:\r\n    - example2/*\r\n\r\n  # Complex: Add \'area/core\' label to any change within the \'core\' package\r\n  area/core:\r\n    - src/core/*\r\n    - src/core/**/*  \r\n\r\n  # Add \'test\' label to any change to *.spec.js files within the source dir\r\n  test:\r\n    - src/**/*.spec.js\r\n\r\n##### Greetings ########################################################################################################\r\n# Comment to be posted to welcome users when they open their first PR\r\nfirstPRWelcomeComment: >\r\n  Thanks for opening this pull request! Please check out our contributing guidelines.\r\n\r\n# Comment to be posted to congratulate user on their first merged PR\r\nfirstPRMergeComment: >\r\n  Awesome work, congrats on your first merged pull request!\r\n\r\n# Comment to be posted to on first time issues\r\nfirstIssueWelcomeComment: >\r\n  Thanks for opening your first issue here! Be sure to follow the issue template!\r\n\r\n###### IssueLink Adder #################################################################################################\r\n# Insert Issue (Jira/Github etc) link in PR description based on the Issue ID in PR title.\r\ninsertIssueLinkInPrDescription:\r\n   # specify the placeholder for the issue link that should be present in the description\r\n  descriptionIssuePlaceholderRegexp: "^Issue link: (.*)$"\r\n  matchers:\r\n    # you can have several matches - for different types of issues\r\n    # only the first matching entry is replaced\r\n    jiraIssueMatch:\r\n      # specify the regexp of issue id that you can find in the title of the PR\r\n      # the match groups can be used to build the issue id (${1}, ${2}, etc.).\r\n      titleIssueIdRegexp: \\[(AIRFLOW-[0-9]{4})\\]\r\n      # the issue link to be added. ${1}, ${2} ... are replaced with the match groups from the\r\n      # title match (remember to use quotes)\r\n      descriptionIssueLink: "[${1}](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/${1}/)"\r\n    docOnlyIssueMatch:\r\n      titleIssueIdRegexp: \\[(AIRFLOW-X{4})\\]\r\n      descriptionIssueLink: "`Document only change, no JIRA issue`"\r\n\r\n###### Title Validator #################################################################################################\r\n# Verifies if commit/PR titles match the regexp specified\r\nverifyTitles:\r\n  # Regular expression that should be matched by titles of commits or PR\r\n  titleRegexp: ^\\[AIRFLOW-[0-9]{4}\\].*$|^\\[AIRFLOW-XXXX\\].*$\r\n  # If set to true, it will always check the PR title (as opposed to the individual commits).\r\n  alwaysUsePrTitle: true\r\n  # If set to true, it will only check the commit in case there is a single commit.\r\n  # In case of multiple commits it will check PR title.\r\n  # This reflects the standard behaviour of Github that for `Squash & Merge` GitHub\r\n  # uses the PR title rather than commit messages for the squashed commit ¯\\_(ツ)_/¯\r\n  # For single-commit PRs it takes the squashed commit message from the commit as expected.\r\n  #\r\n  # If set to false it will check all commit messages. This is useful when you do not squash commits at merge.\r\n  validateEitherPrOrSingleCommitTitle: true\r\n  # The title the GitHub status should appear from.\r\n  statusTitle: "Title Validator"\r\n  # A custom message to be displayed when the title passes validation.\r\n  successMessage: "Validation successful!"\r\n  # A custom message to be displayed when the title fails validation.\r\n  # Allows insertion of ${type} (commit/PR), ${title} (the title validated) and ${regex} (the titleRegexp above).\r\n  failureMessage: "Wrong ${type} title: ${title}"\r\n\r\n###### PR/Branch Up-To-Date Checker ####################################################################################\r\n# Check if the branch is up to date with master when certain files are modified\r\ncheckUpToDate:\r\n  # The default branch is "master", change the branch if you want to check against a different target branch  \r\n  targetBranch: master\r\n  files:\r\n  # File paths that you want to check for\r\n  # In this example, it checks if the branch is up to date when alembic migrations are modified in the PR.\r\n  # It helps avoid multiple heads in alembic migrations in a collaborative development project.\r\n    - airflow/migrations/*\r\n    - airflow/migrations/**/*\r\n    - airflow/alembic.ini\r\n```\r\n\r\nAll the features are optional. Simply add the config for the feature you want to use.\r\n\r\nIf you are having issues with the GitHub app not working, please create an issue on https://github.com/kaxil/boring-cyborg/issues.\r\n\r\n', 'external_url': 'https://github.com/kaxil/boring-cyborg', 'html_url': 'https://github.com/apps/boring-cyborg', 'created_at': '2020-01-04T23:52:58Z', 'updated_at': '2020-03-13T21:08:37Z', 'permissions': {'checks': 'write', 'issues': 'write', 'metadata': 'read', 'pull_requests': 'write', 'single_file': 'read', 'statuses': 'write'}, 'events': ['issues', 'label', 'pull_request', 'pull_request_review', 'pull_request_review_comment']}}]

'https://api.github.com/users/kaxil/events{/privacy}', 'received_events_url': 'https://api.github.com/users/kaxil/received_events', 'type': 'User', 'user_view_type': 'public', 'site_admin': False}, 'name': 'boring-cyborg', 'description': 'A Github bot to automatically label PRs, issues and perform all the boring operations that you don\'t want to do.\r\n\r\n\r\n![Using Boring Cyborg Probot to add new labels](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/kaxil/boring-cyborg/master/assets/usage-screenshot-1.png)\r\n\r\n![Congratulate user on first merged PR](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/kaxil/boring-cyborg/master/assets/usage-first-merged-pr.gif)\r\n\r\n## Features\r\n\r\n* Add labels based on the path of the file that are modified in the PR.\r\n* Welcome new users to your project when they open their first Issue/PR or first merged PR by an\r\nautomated comment. \r\n* Insert Issue (Jira/Github etc) link in PR description based on the Issue ID in PR title.\r\n* Verifies if commits/PR titles match the regular expression specified\r\n* Check if a branch is up to date with the master when specific files are modified in the PR. This is helpful when you desire the changes to be applied sequentially, for example, alembic migrations.\r\n\r\n## Usage\r\n\r\n1. **[Configure the Github App](https://github.com/apps/boring-cyborg)**\r\n2. After installing the Github app, create `.github/boring-cyborg.yml` in the default branch to enable it\r\n3. It will start scanning for pull requests within few minutes.\r\n\r\n```yaml\r\n##### Labeler ##########################################################################################################\r\n# Enable "labeler" for your PR that would add labels to PRs based on the paths that are modified in the PR.\r\nlabelPRBasedOnFilePath:\r\n  # Add \'label1\' to any changes within \'example\' folder or any subfolders\r\n  label1:\r\n    - example/**/*\r\n\r\n  # Add \'label2\' to any file changes within \'example2\' folder\r\n  label2:\r\n    - example2/*\r\n\r\n  # Complex: Add \'area/core\' label to any change within the \'core\' package\r\n  area/core:\r\n    - src/core/*\r\n    - src/core/**/*  \r\n\r\n  # Add \'test\' label to any change to *.spec.js files within the source dir\r\n  test:\r\n    - src/**/*.spec.js\r\n\r\n##### Greetings ########################################################################################################\r\n# Comment to be posted to welcome users when they open their first PR\r\nfirstPRWelcomeComment: >\r\n  Thanks for opening this pull request! Please check out our contributing guidelines.\r\n\r\n# Comment to be posted to congratulate user on their first merged PR\r\nfirstPRMergeComment: >\r\n  Awesome work, congrats on your first merged pull request!\r\n\r\n# Comment to be posted to on first time issues\r\nfirstIssueWelcomeComment: >\r\n  Thanks for opening your first issue here! Be sure to follow the issue template!\r\n\r\n###### IssueLink Adder #################################################################################################\r\n# Insert Issue (Jira/Github etc) link in PR description based on the Issue ID in PR title.\r\ninsertIssueLinkInPrDescription:\r\n   # specify the placeholder for the issue link that should be present in the description\r\n  descriptionIssuePlaceholderRegexp: "^Issue link: (.*)$"\r\n  matchers:\r\n    # you can have several matches - for different types of issues\r\n    # only the first matching entry is replaced\r\n    jiraIssueMatch:\r\n      # specify the regexp of issue id that you can find in the title of the PR\r\n      # the match groups can be used to build the issue id (${1}, ${2}, etc.).\r\n      titleIssueIdRegexp: \\[(AIRFLOW-[0-9]{4})\\]\r\n      # the issue link to be added. ${1}, ${2} ... are replaced with the match groups from the\r\n      # title match (remember to use quotes)\r\n      descriptionIssueLink: "[${1}](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/${1}/)"\r\n    docOnlyIssueMatch:\r\n      titleIssueIdRegexp: \\[(AIRFLOW-X{4})\\]\r\n      descriptionIssueLink: "`Document only change, no JIRA issue`"\r\n\r\n###### Title Validator #################################################################################################\r\n# Verifies if commit/PR titles match the regexp specified\r\nverifyTitles:\r\n  # Regular expression that should be matched by titles of commits or PR\r\n  titleRegexp: ^\\[AIRFLOW-[0-9]{4}\\].*$|^\\[AIRFLOW-XXXX\\].*$\r\n  # If set to true, it will always check the PR title (as opposed to the individual commits).\r\n  alwaysUsePrTitle: true\r\n  # If set to true, it will only check the commit in case there is a single commit.\r\n  # In case of multiple commits it will check PR title.\r\n  # This reflects the standard behaviour of Github that for `Squash & Merge` GitHub\r\n  # uses the PR title rather than commit messages for the squashed commit ¯\\_(ツ)_/¯\r\n  # For single-commit PRs it takes the squashed commit message from the commit as expected.\r\n  #\r\n  # If set to false it will check all commit messages. This is useful when you do not squash commits at merge.\r\n  validateEitherPrOrSingleCommitTitle: true\r\n  # The title the GitHub status should appear from.\r\n  statusTitle: "Title Validator"\r\n  # A custom message to be displayed when the title passes validation.\r\n  successMessage: "Validation successful!"\r\n  # A custom message to be displayed when the title fails validation.\r\n  # Allows insertion of ${type} (commit/PR), ${title} (the title validated) and ${regex} (the titleRegexp above).\r\n  failureMessage: "Wrong ${type} title: ${title}"\r\n\r\n###### PR/Branch Up-To-Date Checker ####################################################################################\r\n# Check if the branch is up to date with master when certain files are modified\r\ncheckUpToDate:\r\n  # The default branch is "master", change the branch if you want to check against a different target branch  \r\n  targetBranch: master\r\n  files:\r\n  # File paths that you want to check for\r\n  # In this example, it checks if the branch is up to date when alembic migrations are modified in the PR.\r\n  # It helps avoid multiple heads in alembic migrations in a collaborative development project.\r\n    - airflow/migrations/*\r\n    - airflow/migrations/**/*\r\n    - airflow/alembic.ini\r\n```\r\n\r\nAll the features are optional. Simply add the config for the feature you want to use.\r\n\r\nIf you are having issues with the GitHub app not working, please create an issue on https://github.com/kaxil/boring-cyborg/issues.\r\n\r\n', 'external_url': 'https://github.com/kaxil/boring-cyborg', 'html_url': 'https://github.com/apps/boring-cyborg', 'created_at': '2020-01-04T23:52:58Z', 'updated_at': '2020-03-13T21:08:37Z', 'permissions': {'checks': 'write', 'issues': 'write', 'metadata': 'read', 'pull_requests': 'write', 'single_file': 'read', 'statuses': 'write'}, 'events': ['issues', 'label', 'pull_request', 'pull_request_review', 'pull_request_review_comment']}}]

\r\nExecution process analysis:  \r\nFlinkTask inherits the AbstractYarnTask and implements its own getScript method. ShellCommandExecutor\r\n![UML样例](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/43c24532-b097-4a1a-9b3d-79375eb08ad6)\r\n\r\n\r\n\r\n当前的FlinkTask 有shell和flink '2025-01-27T01:42:46Z', 'author_association': 'NONE', 'body': "Hello, I looked up a lot of information and code, here is how to submit flink tasks to k8s cluster on ds and how to handle compatibility replies.\nCompatibility processing, through different command parameters to support different flink versions. I'm currently planning to support flink session clusters on kubernetes in this release.\n\nAs for the k8s front and back end you talked about, I am not particularly clear about what is the k8s front end, is it by exposing the k8s objects applied in the k8s cluster, such as NodePort, Ngpress or other, I hope you can inform me\nWe all know that external applications cannot access k8s internal applications directly, and the same is true of dolphinscheduler in non-K8S deployment environments.\nIf we have a dolphinscheduler deployed on a host outside of k8s, to schedule flink applications inside k8s on that dolphinscheduler, we need to expose the cluster inside k8s, either by opening a port per machine, or through something like an nginx proxy\nThis exposed location allows dolphinscheduler to access the flink cluster inside the k8s and deploy applications.\nThat's what I think, too. I refer to this flink article: https://nightlies.apache.org/flink/flink-docs-release-1.20/zh/docs/deployment/resource-providers/standalone/kubernetes/\n\nIf the community has any questions and wants to let me know, I'd appreciate it.\n\n\n您好，我查阅了很多资料和代码，这是怎么让在ds上提交flink任务到k8s集群和怎么处理兼容性的回复。 \n兼容性处理，通过不同的命令参数支持不同flink版本。目前我打算在这个版本上支持kubernetes上的flink session集群。 \n \n对于您说说的k8s前后端，我不是特别清楚什么是k8s前端，是通过暴露k8s集群内应用的k8s对象吗，如NodePort，Ngpress还是其他的，希望您能告知我 \n我们都知道外部应用无法直接访问k8s内部应用，同理dolphinscheduler在非k8s部署环境下也是如此。 \n如果我们在一个k8s外的主机部署了dolphinscheduler，要在这个dolphinscheduler上调度k8s内的flink应用，我们需要把k8s内部的集群暴露出来，或是在每个机器开放一个端口，或是通过类似nginx代理的方式 \ndolphinscheduler可以通过这个暴露出来的地方去访问k8s内部的flink集群，并部署应用。 \n这也是我的想法。我参考了flink的这篇文章：https://nightlies.apache.org/flink/flink-docs-release-1.20/zh/docs/deployment/resource-providers/standalone/kubernetes/ \n \n如果社区有什么疑问希望能告知我，不胜感激。", 'reactions': {'url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/apache/dolphinscheduler/issues/comments/2614708013/reactions', 'total_count': 0, '+1': 0, '-1': 0, 'laugh': 0, 'hooray': 0, 'confused': 0, 'heart': 0, 'rocket': 0, 'eyes': 0}, 'performed_via_github_app': None}]

Issue #16879: Labels: bug, help wanted
Comments: [{'url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/apache/dolphinscheduler/issues/comments/2518976127', 'html_url': 'https://github.com/apache/dolphinscheduler/issues/16879#issuecomment-2518976127', 'issue_url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/apache/dolphinscheduler/issues/16879', 'id': 2518976127, 'node_id': 'IC_kwDOClTkms6WJIZ_', 'user': {'login': 'github-actions[bot]', 'id': 41898282, 'node_id': 'MDM6Qm90NDE4OTgyODI=', 'avatar_url': 'https://avatars.githubusercontent.com/in/15368?v=4', 'gravatar_id': '', 'url': 'https://api.github.com/users/github-actions%5Bbot%5D', 'html_url': 'https://github.com/apps/github-actions', 'followers_url': 'https://api.github.com/users/github-actions%5Bbot%5D/followers', 'following_url': 'https://api.github.com/users/github-actions%5Bbot%5D/following{/other_user}', 'gists_url': 'https://api.github.com/users/github-actions%5Bbot%5D/gists{/gist_id}', 'starred_url': 'https://api.github.com/users/github-actions%5Bbot%5D/starred{/owner}{/repo}', 'subscriptions_url': 'https://api.github.com/users/github-actions%5Bbot%5D/subscriptions', 'organizations_url': 'https://api.github.com/users/github-actions%5Bbot%5D/orgs', 'repos_url': 'https://api.github.com/users/github-actions%5Bbot%5D/repos', 'events_url': 'https://api.github.com/users/github-actions%5Bbot%5D/events{/privacy}', 'received_events_url': 'https://api.github.com/users/github-actions%5Bbot%5D/received_events', 'type': 'Bot', 'user_view_type': 'public', 'site_admin': False}, 'created_at': '2024-12-05T02:52:26Z', 'updated_at': '2024-12-05T02:52:26Z', 'author_association': 'NONE', 'body': '### Search before asking\n\n- [X] I had searched in the [issues](https://github.com/apache/dolphinscheduler/issues?q=is%3Aissue) and found no similar issues.\n\n\n### What happened\n\nIn the workflow, create multiple sub-processes, for example, create 12 sub-processes. When the sub-process obtains the parameters of the upstream task, there will be coverage/error/ and the parameters obtained by the 12 nodes are exactly the same, which is not as expected.\r\nJudging from the query in the database, there is no problem with the parameters of the generated 12 sub-process instances. However, in the varpool setting phase, the varpool corresponding to the parent_process_instance_id is obtained, which results in the task instance in the sub-process instance being executed. Parameters are always the same\r\n\r\n<img width="1009" alt="iShot_2024-12-05_10 44 15" src="https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/073be1eb-916b-4344-bfab-f5cb3b7dba95">\r\n\n\n### What you expected to happen\n\nJudging from the query in the database, there is no problem with the parameters of the generated 12 sub-process instances. However, in the varpool setting phase, the varpool corresponding to the parent_process_instance_id is obtained, which results in the task instance in the sub-process instance being executed. Parameters are always the same\r\nThrough the debug setSubProcessParam method, it can be seen that there is a problem with the varpool parameters obtained by each sub-process task instance, and duplicates occur randomly.\n\n### How to reproduce\n\nI have verified that this problem exists in the standalone image of 3.2.1, the standalone image of 3.2.2, and the debug image code. It can also be reproduced on the two image web service pages. I provided my verification workflow json, ⚠️Note: After importing, you need to change the reference of the sub-process in the main process to the new id\r\n[workflow_1733366901095.json](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/18016619/workflow_1733366901095.json)\r\n\n\n### Anything else\n\n_No response_\n\n### Version\n\n3.2.x\n\n### Are you willing to submit PR?\n\n- [X] Yes I am willing to submit a PR!\n\n### Code of Conduct\n\n- [X] I agree to follow this project\'s [Code of 'https://api.github.com/users/kaxil/events{/privacy}', 'received_events_url': 'https://api.github.com/users/kaxil/received_events', 'type': 'User', 'user_view_type': 'public', 'site_admin': False}, 'name': 'boring-cyborg', 'description': 'A Github bot to automatically label PRs, issues and perform all the boring operations that you don\'t want to do.\r\n\r\n\r\n![Using Boring Cyborg Probot to add new labels](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/kaxil/boring-cyborg/master/assets/usage-screenshot-1.png)\r\n\r\n![Congratulate user on first merged PR](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/kaxil/boring-cyborg/master/assets/usage-first-merged-pr.gif)\r\n\r\n## Features\r\n\r\n* Add labels based on the path of the file that are modified in the PR.\r\n* Welcome new users to your project when they open their first Issue/PR or first merged PR by an\r\nautomated comment. \r\n* Insert Issue (Jira/Github etc) link in PR description based on the Issue ID in PR title.\r\n* Verifies if commits/PR titles match the regular expression specified\r\n* Check if a branch is up to date with the master when specific files are modified in the PR. This is helpful when you desire the changes to be applied sequentially, for example, alembic migrations.\r\n\r\n## Usage\r\n\r\n1. **[Configure the Github App](https://github.com/apps/boring-cyborg)**\r\n2. After installing the Github app, create `.github/boring-cyborg.yml` in the default branch to enable it\r\n3. It will start scanning for pull requests within few minutes.\r\n\r\n```yaml\r\n##### Labeler ##########################################################################################################\r\n# Enable "labeler" for your PR that would add labels to PRs based on the paths that are modified in the PR.\r\nlabelPRBasedOnFilePath:\r\n  # Add \'label1\' to any changes within \'example\' folder or any subfolders\r\n  label1:\r\n    - example/**/*\r\n\r\n  # Add \'label2\' to any file changes within \'example2\' folder\r\n  label2:\r\n    - example2/*\r\n\r\n  # Complex: Add \'area/core\' label to any change within the \'core\' package\r\n  area/core:\r\n    - src/core/*\r\n    - src/core/**/*  \r\n\r\n  # Add \'test\' label to any change to *.spec.js files within the source dir\r\n  test:\r\n    - src/**/*.spec.js\r\n\r\n##### Greetings ########################################################################################################\r\n# Comment to be posted to welcome users when they open their first PR\r\nfirstPRWelcomeComment: >\r\n  Thanks for opening this pull request! Please check out our contributing guidelines.\r\n\r\n# Comment to be posted to congratulate user on their first merged PR\r\nfirstPRMergeComment: >\r\n  Awesome work, congrats on your first merged pull request!\r\n\r\n# Comment to be posted to on first time issues\r\nfirstIssueWelcomeComment: >\r\n  Thanks for opening your first issue here! Be sure to follow the issue template!\r\n\r\n###### IssueLink Adder #################################################################################################\r\n# Insert Issue (Jira/Github etc) link in PR description based on the Issue ID in PR title.\r\ninsertIssueLinkInPrDescription:\r\n   # specify the placeholder for the issue link that should be present in the description\r\n  descriptionIssuePlaceholderRegexp: "^Issue link: (.*)$"\r\n  matchers:\r\n    # you can have several matches - for different types of issues\r\n    # only the first matching entry is replaced\r\n    jiraIssueMatch:\r\n      # specify the regexp of issue id that you can find in the title of the PR\r\n      # the match groups can be used to build the issue id (${1}, ${2}, etc.).\r\n      titleIssueIdRegexp: \\[(AIRFLOW-[0-9]{4})\\]\r\n      # the issue link to be added. ${1}, ${2} ... are replaced with the match groups from the\r\n      # title match (remember to use quotes)\r\n      descriptionIssueLink: "[${1}](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/${1}/)"\r\n    docOnlyIssueMatch:\r\n      titleIssueIdRegexp: \\[(AIRFLOW-X{4})\\]\r\n      descriptionIssueLink: "`Document only change, no JIRA issue`"\r\n\r\n###### Title Validator #################################################################################################\r\n# Verifies if commit/PR titles match the regexp specified\r\nverifyTitles:\r\n  # Regular expression that should be matched by titles of commits or PR\r\n  titleRegexp: ^\\[AIRFLOW-[0-9]{4}\\].*$|^\\[AIRFLOW-XXXX\\].*$\r\n  # If set to true, it will always check the PR title (as opposed to the individual commits).\r\n  alwaysUsePrTitle: true\r\n  # If set to true, it will only check the commit in case there is a single commit.\r\n  # In case of multiple commits it will check PR title.\r\n  # This reflects the standard behaviour of Github that for `Squash & Merge` GitHub\r\n  # uses the PR title rather than commit messages for the squashed commit ¯\\_(ツ)_/¯\r\n  # For single-commit PRs it takes the squashed commit message from the commit as expected.\r\n  #\r\n  # If set to false it will check all commit messages. This is useful when you do not squash commits at merge.\r\n  validateEitherPrOrSingleCommitTitle: true\r\n  # The title the GitHub status should appear from.\r\n  statusTitle: "Title Validator"\r\n  # A custom message to be displayed when the title passes validation.\r\n  successMessage: "Validation successful!"\r\n  # A custom message to be displayed when the title fails validation.\r\n  # Allows insertion of ${type} (commit/PR), ${title} (the title validated) and ${regex} (the titleRegexp above).\r\n  failureMessage: "Wrong ${type} title: ${title}"\r\n\r\n###### PR/Branch Up-To-Date Checker ####################################################################################\r\n# Check if the branch is up to date with master when certain files are modified\r\ncheckUpToDate:\r\n  # The default branch is "master", change the branch if you want to check against a different target branch  \r\n  targetBranch: master\r\n  files:\r\n  # File paths that you want to check for\r\n  # In this example, it checks if the branch is up to date when alembic migrations are modified in the PR.\r\n  # It helps avoid multiple heads in alembic migrations in a collaborative development project.\r\n    - airflow/migrations/*\r\n    - airflow/migrations/**/*\r\n    - airflow/alembic.ini\r\n```\r\n\r\nAll the features are optional. Simply add the config for the feature you want to use.\r\n\r\nIf you are having issues with the GitHub app not working, please create an issue on https://github.com/kaxil/boring-cyborg/issues.\r\n\r\n', 'external_url': 'https://github.com/kaxil/boring-cyborg', 'html_url': 'https://github.com/apps/boring-cyborg', 'created_at': 'name': 'boring-cyborg', 'description': 'A Github bot to automatically label PRs, issues and perform all the boring operations that you don\'t want to do.\r\n\r\n\r\n![Using Boring Cyborg Probot to add new labels](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/kaxil/boring-cyborg/master/assets/usage-screenshot-1.png)\r\n\r\n![Congratulate user on first merged PR](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/kaxil/boring-cyborg/master/assets/usage-first-merged-pr.gif)\r\n\r\n## Features\r\n\r\n* Add labels based on the path of the file that are modified in the PR.\r\n* Welcome new users to your project when they open their first Issue/PR or first merged PR by an\r\nautomated comment. \r\n* Insert Issue (Jira/Github etc) link in PR description based on the Issue ID in PR title.\r\n* Verifies if commits/PR titles match the regular expression specified\r\n* Check if a branch is up to date with the master when specific files are modified in the PR. This is helpful when you desire the changes to be applied sequentially, for example, alembic migrations.\r\n\r\n## Usage\r\n\r\n1. **[Configure the Github App](https://github.com/apps/boring-cyborg)**\r\n2. After installing the Github app, create `.github/boring-cyborg.yml` in the default branch to enable it\r\n3. It will start scanning for pull requests within few minutes.\r\n\r\n```yaml\r\n##### Labeler ##########################################################################################################\r\n# Enable "labeler" for your PR that would add labels to PRs based on the paths that are modified in the PR.\r\nlabelPRBasedOnFilePath:\r\n  # Add \'label1\' to any changes within \'example\' folder or any subfolders\r\n  label1:\r\n    - example/**/*\r\n\r\n  # Add \'label2\' to any file changes within \'example2\' folder\r\n  label2:\r\n    - example2/*\r\n\r\n  # Complex: Add \'area/core\' label to any change within the \'core\' package\r\n  area/core:\r\n    - src/core/*\r\n    - src/core/**/*  \r\n\r\n  # Add \'test\' label to any change to *.spec.js files within the source dir\r\n  test:\r\n    - src/**/*.spec.js\r\n\r\n##### Greetings ########################################################################################################\r\n# Comment to be posted to welcome users when they open their first PR\r\nfirstPRWelcomeComment: >\r\n  Thanks for opening this pull request! Please check out our contributing guidelines.\r\n\r\n# Comment to be posted to congratulate user on their first merged PR\r\nfirstPRMergeComment: >\r\n  Awesome work, congrats on your first merged pull request!\r\n\r\n# Comment to be posted to on first time issues\r\nfirstIssueWelcomeComment: >\r\n  Thanks for opening your first issue here! Be sure to follow the issue template!\r\n\r\n###### IssueLink Adder #################################################################################################\r\n# Insert Issue (Jira/Github etc) link in PR description based on the Issue ID in PR title.\r\ninsertIssueLinkInPrDescription:\r\n   # specify the placeholder for the issue link that should be present in the description\r\n  descriptionIssuePlaceholderRegexp: "^Issue link: (.*)$"\r\n  matchers:\r\n    # you can have several matches - for different types of issues\r\n    # only the first matching entry is replaced\r\n    jiraIssueMatch:\r\n      # specify the regexp of issue id that you can find in the title of the PR\r\n      # the match groups can be used to build the issue id (${1}, ${2}, etc.).\r\n      titleIssueIdRegexp: \\[(AIRFLOW-[0-9]{4})\\]\r\n      # the issue link to be added. ${1}, ${2} ... are replaced with the match groups from the\r\n      # title match (remember to use quotes)\r\n      descriptionIssueLink: "[${1}](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/${1}/)"\r\n    docOnlyIssueMatch:\r\n      titleIssueIdRegexp: \\[(AIRFLOW-X{4})\\]\r\n      descriptionIssueLink: "`Document only change, no JIRA issue`"\r\n\r\n###### Title Validator #################################################################################################\r\n# Verifies if commit/PR titles match the regexp specified\r\nverifyTitles:\r\n  # Regular expression that should be matched by titles of commits or PR\r\n  titleRegexp: ^\\[AIRFLOW-[0-9]{4}\\].*$|^\\[AIRFLOW-XXXX\\].*$\r\n  # If set to true, it will always check the PR title (as opposed to the individual commits).\r\n  alwaysUsePrTitle: true\r\n  # If set to true, it will only check the commit in case there is a single commit.\r\n  # In case of multiple commits it will check PR title.\r\n  # This reflects the standard behaviour of Github that for `Squash & Merge` GitHub\r\n  # uses the PR title rather than commit messages for the squashed commit ¯\\_(ツ)_/¯\r\n  # For single-commit PRs it takes the squashed commit message from the commit as expected.\r\n  #\r\n  # If set to false it will check all commit messages. This is useful when you do not squash commits at merge.\r\n  validateEitherPrOrSingleCommitTitle: true\r\n  # The title the GitHub status should appear from.\r\n  statusTitle: "Title Validator"\r\n  # A custom message to be displayed when the title passes validation.\r\n  successMessage: "Validation successful!"\r\n  # A custom message to be displayed when the title fails validation.\r\n  # Allows insertion of ${type} (commit/PR), ${title} (the title validated) and ${regex} (the titleRegexp above).\r\n  failureMessage: "Wrong ${type} title: ${title}"\r\n\r\n###### PR/Branch Up-To-Date Checker ####################################################################################\r\n# Check if the branch is up to date with master when certain files are modified\r\ncheckUpToDate:\r\n  # The default branch is "master", change the branch if you want to check against a different target branch  \r\n  targetBranch: master\r\n  files:\r\n  # File paths that you want to check for\r\n  # In this example, it checks if the branch is up to date when alembic migrations are modified in the PR.\r\n  # It helps avoid multiple heads in alembic migrations in a collaborative development project.\r\n    - airflow/migrations/*\r\n    - airflow/migrations/**/*\r\n    - airflow/alembic.ini\r\n```\r\n\r\nAll the features are optional. Simply add the config for the feature you want to use.\r\n\r\nIf you are having issues with the GitHub app not working, please create an issue on PR](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/kaxil/boring-cyborg/master/assets/usage-first-merged-pr.gif)\r\n\r\n## Features\r\n\r\n* Add labels based on the path of the file that are modified in the PR.\r\n* Welcome new users to your project when they open their first Issue/PR or first merged PR by an\r\nautomated comment. \r\n* Insert Issue (Jira/Github etc) link in PR description based on the Issue ID in PR title.\r\n* Verifies if commits/PR titles match the regular expression specified\r\n* Check if a branch is up to date with the master when specific files are modified in the PR. This is helpful when you desire the changes to be applied sequentially, for example, alembic migrations.\r\n\r\n## Usage\r\n\r\n1. **[Configure the Github App](https://github.com/apps/boring-cyborg)**\r\n2. After installing the Github app, create `.github/boring-cyborg.yml` in the default branch to enable it\r\n3. It will start scanning for pull requests within few minutes.\r\n\r\n```yaml\r\n##### Labeler ##########################################################################################################\r\n# Enable "labeler" for your PR that would add labels to PRs based on the paths that are modified in the PR.\r\nlabelPRBasedOnFilePath:\r\n  # Add \'label1\' to any changes within \'example\' folder or any subfolders\r\n  label1:\r\n    - example/**/*\r\n\r\n  # Add \'label2\' to any file changes within \'example2\' folder\r\n  label2:\r\n    - example2/*\r\n\r\n  # Complex: Add \'area/core\' label to any change within the \'core\' package\r\n  area/core:\r\n    - src/core/*\r\n    - src/core/**/*  \r\n\r\n  # Add \'test\' label to any change to *.spec.js files within the source dir\r\n  test:\r\n    - src/**/*.spec.js\r\n\r\n##### Greetings ########################################################################################################\r\n# Comment to be posted to welcome users when they open their first PR\r\nfirstPRWelcomeComment: >\r\n  Thanks for opening this pull request! Please check out our contributing guidelines.\r\n\r\n# Comment to be posted to congratulate user on their first merged PR\r\nfirstPRMergeComment: >\r\n  Awesome work, congrats on your first merged pull request!\r\n\r\n# Comment to be posted to on first time issues\r\nfirstIssueWelcomeComment: >\r\n  Thanks for opening your first issue here! Be sure to follow the issue template!\r\n\r\n###### IssueLink Adder #################################################################################################\r\n# Insert Issue (Jira/Github etc) link in PR description based on the Issue ID in PR title.\r\ninsertIssueLinkInPrDescription:\r\n   # specify the placeholder for the issue link that should be present in the description\r\n  descriptionIssuePlaceholderRegexp: "^Issue link: (.*)$"\r\n  matchers:\r\n    # you can have several matches - for different types of issues\r\n    # only the first matching entry is replaced\r\n    jiraIssueMatch:\r\n      # specify the regexp of issue id that you can find in the title of the PR\r\n      # the match groups can be used to build the issue id (${1}, ${2}, etc.).\r\n      titleIssueIdRegexp: \\[(AIRFLOW-[0-9]{4})\\]\r\n      # the issue link to be added. ${1}, ${2} ... are replaced with the match groups from the\r\n      # title match (remember to use quotes)\r\n      descriptionIssueLink: "[${1}](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/${1}/)"\r\n    docOnlyIssueMatch:\r\n      titleIssueIdRegexp: \\[(AIRFLOW-X{4})\\]\r\n      descriptionIssueLink: "`Document only change, no JIRA issue`"\r\n\r\n###### Title Validator #################################################################################################\r\n# Verifies if commit/PR titles match the regexp specified\r\nverifyTitles:\r\n  # Regular expression that should be matched by titles of commits or PR\r\n  titleRegexp: ^\\[AIRFLOW-[0-9]{4}\\].*$|^\\[AIRFLOW-XXXX\\].*$\r\n  # If set to true, it will always check the PR title (as opposed to the individual commits).\r\n  alwaysUsePrTitle: true\r\n  # If set to true, it will only check the commit in case there is a single commit.\r\n  # In case of multiple commits it will check PR title.\r\n  # This reflects the standard behaviour of Github that for `Squash & Merge` GitHub\r\n  # uses the PR title rather than commit messages for the squashed commit ¯\\_(ツ)_/¯\r\n  # For single-commit PRs it takes the squashed commit message from the commit as expected.\r\n  #\r\n  # If set to false it will check all commit messages. This is useful when you do not squash commits at merge.\r\n  validateEitherPrOrSingleCommitTitle: true\r\n  # The title the GitHub status should appear from.\r\n  statusTitle: "Title Validator"\r\n  # A custom message to be displayed when the title passes validation.\r\n  successMessage: "Validation successful!"\r\n  # A custom message to be displayed when the title fails validation.\r\n  # Allows insertion of ${type} (commit/PR), ${title} (the title validated) and ${regex} (the titleRegexp above).\r\n  failureMessage: "Wrong ${type} title: ${title}"\r\n\r\n###### PR/Branch Up-To-Date Checker ####################################################################################\r\n# Check if the branch is up to date with master when certain files are modified\r\ncheckUpToDate:\r\n  # The default branch is "master", change the branch if you want to check against a different target branch  \r\n  targetBranch: master\r\n  files:\r\n  # File paths that you want to check for\r\n  # In this example, it checks if the branch is up to date when alembic migrations are modified in the PR.\r\n  # It helps avoid multiple heads in alembic migrations in a collaborative development project.\r\n    - airflow/migrations/*\r\n    - airflow/migrations/**/*\r\n    - airflow/alembic.ini\r\n```\r\n\r\nAll the features are optional. Simply add the config for the feature you want to use.\r\n\r\nIf you are having issues with the GitHub app not working, please create an issue on https://github.com/kaxil/boring-cyborg/issues.\r\n\r\n', 'external_url': 'https://github.com/kaxil/boring-cyborg', 'html_url': 'https://github.com/apps/boring-cyborg', 'created_at': The majority of popular languages can be analyzed automatically; no configuration is required!\r\n\r\nWith [SonarQube Cloud](https://sonarcloud.io/github), you get:\r\n\r\n-   Fast, precise static analysis and feedback on your code\r\n    \r\n-   Support for popular languages, frameworks, and IaC tools\r\n    \r\n-   Free analysis for open-source projects and private projects up to max 50k LoC\r\n    \r\n-   Automatic analysis of pull requests and branches with results reported inline\r\n    \r\n-   IDE Support with [SonarQube for IDE](https://www.sonarsource.com/products/sonarlint/) integration\r\n    \r\n-   Quality Gate (added as a GitHub check) acting at two different levels - first, preventing you from merging pull requests that contain issues - and later, helping you to release only clean, safe code\r\n    \r\n-   Sign up for SonarQube free tier and begin scanning your private and public repositories\r\n    \r\n\r\nA [GitHub Action](https://github.com/marketplace/actions/sonarcloud-scan) is available in the marketplace to make it easy for you (for projects where automatic analysis isn't available). SonarQube Cloud also integrates smoothly with Jenkins, CircleCI, TravisCI, CirrusCI, and many other tools.\r\n\r\nA free tier is available that allows you to explore the benefits of SonarQube Cloud using your public and private repositories. a new shell script, then only output the following text in the script\'s text box, and then use the supplemental data directly to perform the task\r\nThe ct variable is ${system.datetime}\r\n-------------------------------------------------------------------------\r\n#!/bin/bash\r\n# 显示当前时间\r\necho "当前时间为 : ${ct}"\r\n\r\n# 截取时间部分\r\nsub_time=$(echo $ct | cut -c 9-14)\r\necho "日期部分为 : ${sub_time}"\r\n# 判断时间部分\r\nif [ "$sub_time" == "000000" ]; then\r\n    echo "yes"\r\nelse\r\n    echo "no"\r\nfi\n\n### Anything else\n\n_No response_\n\n### Version\n\n3.2.x\n\n### Are you willing to submit PR?\n\n- [ ] Yes I am willing to submit a PR!\n\n### Code of Conduct\n\n- [X] I agree to follow this project\'s [Code of 'name': 'boring-cyborg', 'description': 'A Github bot to automatically label PRs, issues and perform all the boring operations that you don\'t want to do.\r\n\r\n\r\n![Using Boring Cyborg Probot to add new labels](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/kaxil/boring-cyborg/master/assets/usage-screenshot-1.png)\r\n\r\n![Congratulate user on first merged PR](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/kaxil/boring-cyborg/master/assets/usage-first-merged-pr.gif)\r\n\r\n## Features\r\n\r\n* Add labels based on the path of the file that are modified in the PR.\r\n* Welcome new users to your project when they open their first Issue/PR or first merged PR by an\r\nautomated comment. \r\n* Insert Issue (Jira/Github etc) link in PR description based on the Issue ID in PR title.\r\n* Verifies if commits/PR titles match the regular expression specified\r\n* Check if a branch is up to date with the master when specific files are modified in the PR. This is helpful when you desire the changes to be applied sequentially, for example, alembic migrations.\r\n\r\n## Usage\r\n\r\n1. **[Configure the Github App](https://github.com/apps/boring-cyborg)**\r\n2. After installing the Github app, create `.github/boring-cyborg.yml` in the default branch to enable it\r\n3. It will start scanning for pull requests within few minutes.\r\n\r\n```yaml\r\n##### Labeler ##########################################################################################################\r\n# Enable "labeler" for your PR that would add labels to PRs based on the paths that are modified in the PR.\r\nlabelPRBasedOnFilePath:\r\n  # Add \'label1\' to any changes within \'example\' folder or any subfolders\r\n  label1:\r\n    - example/**/*\r\n\r\n  # Add \'label2\' to any file changes within \'example2\' folder\r\n  label2:\r\n    - example2/*\r\n\r\n  # Complex: Add \'area/core\' label to any change within the \'core\' package\r\n  area/core:\r\n    - src/core/*\r\n    - src/core/**/*  \r\n\r\n  # Add \'test\' label to any change to *.spec.js files within the source dir\r\n  test:\r\n    - src/**/*.spec.js\r\n\r\n##### Greetings ########################################################################################################\r\n# Comment to be posted to welcome users when they open their first PR\r\nfirstPRWelcomeComment: >\r\n  Thanks for opening this pull request! Please check out our contributing guidelines.\r\n\r\n# Comment to be posted to congratulate user on their first merged PR\r\nfirstPRMergeComment: >\r\n  Awesome work, congrats on your first merged pull request!\r\n\r\n# Comment to be posted to on first time issues\r\nfirstIssueWelcomeComment: >\r\n  Thanks for opening your first issue here! Be sure to follow the issue template!\r\n\r\n###### IssueLink Adder #################################################################################################\r\n# Insert Issue (Jira/Github etc) link in PR description based on the Issue ID in PR title.\r\ninsertIssueLinkInPrDescription:\r\n   # specify the placeholder for the issue link that should be present in the description\r\n  descriptionIssuePlaceholderRegexp: "^Issue link: (.*)$"\r\n  matchers:\r\n    # you can have several matches - for different types of issues\r\n    # only the first matching entry is replaced\r\n    jiraIssueMatch:\r\n      # specify the regexp of issue id that you can find in the title of the PR\r\n      # the match groups can be used to build the issue id (${1}, ${2}, etc.).\r\n      titleIssueIdRegexp: \\[(AIRFLOW-[0-9]{4})\\]\r\n      # the issue link to be added. ${1}, ${2} ... are replaced with the match groups from the\r\n      # title match (remember to use quotes)\r\n      descriptionIssueLink: "[${1}](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/${1}/)"\r\n    docOnlyIssueMatch:\r\n      titleIssueIdRegexp: \\[(AIRFLOW-X{4})\\]\r\n      descriptionIssueLink: "`Document only change, no JIRA issue`"\r\n\r\n###### Title Validator #################################################################################################\r\n# Verifies if commit/PR titles match the regexp specified\r\nverifyTitles:\r\n  # Regular expression that should be matched by titles of commits or PR\r\n  titleRegexp: ^\\[AIRFLOW-[0-9]{4}\\].*$|^\\[AIRFLOW-XXXX\\].*$\r\n  # If set to true, it will always check the PR title (as opposed to the individual commits).\r\n  alwaysUsePrTitle: true\r\n  # If set to true, it will only check the commit in case there is a single commit.\r\n  # In case of multiple commits it will check PR title.\r\n  # This reflects the standard behaviour of Github that for `Squash & Merge` GitHub\r\n  # uses the PR title rather than commit messages for the squashed commit ¯\\_(ツ)_/¯\r\n  # For single-commit PRs it takes the squashed commit message from the commit as expected.\r\n  #\r\n  # If set to false it will check all commit messages. This is useful when you do not squash commits at merge.\r\n  validateEitherPrOrSingleCommitTitle: true\r\n  # The title the GitHub status should appear from.\r\n  statusTitle: "Title Validator"\r\n  # A custom message to be displayed when the title passes validation.\r\n  successMessage: "Validation successful!"\r\n  # A custom message to be displayed when the title fails validation.\r\n  # Allows insertion of ${type} (commit/PR), ${title} (the title validated) and ${regex} (the titleRegexp above).\r\n  failureMessage: "Wrong ${type} title: ${title}"\r\n\r\n###### PR/Branch Up-To-Date Checker ####################################################################################\r\n# Check if the branch is up to date with master when certain files are modified\r\ncheckUpToDate:\r\n  # The default branch is "master", change the branch if you want to check against a different target branch  \r\n  targetBranch: master\r\n  files:\r\n  # File paths that you want to check for\r\n  # In this example, it checks if the branch is up to date when alembic migrations are modified in the PR.\r\n  # It helps avoid multiple heads in alembic migrations in a collaborative development project.\r\n    - airflow/migrations/*\r\n    - airflow/migrations/**/*\r\n    - airflow/alembic.ini\r\n```\r\n\r\nAll the features are optional. Simply add the config for the feature you want to use.\r\n\r\nIf you are having issues with the GitHub app not working, please create an issue on https://github.com/kaxil/boring-cyborg/issues.\r\n\r\n', 'external_url': 'https://github.com/kaxil/boring-cyborg', 'html_url': 'https://github.com/apps/boring-cyborg', 'created_at': 'https://api.github.com/users/kaxil/events{/privacy}', 'received_events_url': 'https://api.github.com/users/kaxil/received_events', 'type': 'User', 'user_view_type': 'public', 'site_admin': False}, 'name': 'boring-cyborg', 'description': 'A Github bot to automatically label PRs, issues and perform all the boring operations that you don\'t want to do.\r\n\r\n\r\n![Using Boring Cyborg Probot to add new labels](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/kaxil/boring-cyborg/master/assets/usage-screenshot-1.png)\r\n\r\n![Congratulate user on first merged PR](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/kaxil/boring-cyborg/master/assets/usage-first-merged-pr.gif)\r\n\r\n## Features\r\n\r\n* Add labels based on the path of the file that are modified in the PR.\r\n* Welcome new users to your project when they open their first Issue/PR or first merged PR by an\r\nautomated comment. \r\n* Insert Issue (Jira/Github etc) link in PR description based on the Issue ID in PR title.\r\n* Verifies if commits/PR titles match the regular expression specified\r\n* Check if a branch is up to date with the master when specific files are modified in the PR. This is helpful when you desire the changes to be applied sequentially, for example, alembic migrations.\r\n\r\n## Usage\r\n\r\n1. **[Configure the Github App](https://github.com/apps/boring-cyborg)**\r\n2. After installing the Github app, create `.github/boring-cyborg.yml` in the default branch to enable it\r\n3. It will start scanning for pull requests within few minutes.\r\n\r\n```yaml\r\n##### Labeler ##########################################################################################################\r\n# Enable "labeler" for your PR that would add labels to PRs based on the paths that are modified in the PR.\r\nlabelPRBasedOnFilePath:\r\n  # Add \'label1\' to any changes within \'example\' folder or any subfolders\r\n  label1:\r\n    - example/**/*\r\n\r\n  # Add \'label2\' to any file changes within \'example2\' folder\r\n  label2:\r\n    - example2/*\r\n\r\n  # Complex: Add \'area/core\' label to any change within the \'core\' package\r\n  area/core:\r\n    - src/core/*\r\n    - src/core/**/*  \r\n\r\n  # Add \'test\' label to any change to *.spec.js files within the source dir\r\n  test:\r\n    - src/**/*.spec.js\r\n\r\n##### Greetings ########################################################################################################\r\n# Comment to be posted to welcome users when they open their first PR\r\nfirstPRWelcomeComment: >\r\n  Thanks for opening this pull request! Please check out our contributing guidelines.\r\n\r\n# Comment to be posted to congratulate user on their first merged PR\r\nfirstPRMergeComment: >\r\n  Awesome work, congrats on your first merged pull request!\r\n\r\n# Comment to be posted to on first time issues\r\nfirstIssueWelcomeComment: >\r\n  Thanks for opening your first issue here! Be sure to follow the issue template!\r\n\r\n###### IssueLink Adder #################################################################################################\r\n# Insert Issue (Jira/Github etc) link in PR description based on the Issue ID in PR title.\r\ninsertIssueLinkInPrDescription:\r\n   # specify the placeholder for the issue link that should be present in the description\r\n  descriptionIssuePlaceholderRegexp: "^Issue link: (.*)$"\r\n  matchers:\r\n    # you can have several matches - for different types of issues\r\n    # only the first matching entry is replaced\r\n    jiraIssueMatch:\r\n      # specify the regexp of issue id that you can find in the title of the PR\r\n      # the match groups can be used to build the issue id (${1}, ${2}, etc.).\r\n      titleIssueIdRegexp: \\[(AIRFLOW-[0-9]{4})\\]\r\n      # the issue link to be added. ${1}, ${2} ... are replaced with the match groups from the\r\n      # title match (remember to use quotes)\r\n      descriptionIssueLink: "[${1}](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/${1}/)"\r\n    docOnlyIssueMatch:\r\n      titleIssueIdRegexp: \\[(AIRFLOW-X{4})\\]\r\n      descriptionIssueLink: "`Document only change, no JIRA issue`"\r\n\r\n###### Title Validator #################################################################################################\r\n# Verifies if commit/PR titles match the regexp specified\r\nverifyTitles:\r\n  # Regular expression that should be matched by titles of commits or PR\r\n  titleRegexp: ^\\[AIRFLOW-[0-9]{4}\\].*$|^\\[AIRFLOW-XXXX\\].*$\r\n  # If set to true, it will always check the PR title (as opposed to the individual commits).\r\n  alwaysUsePrTitle: true\r\n  # If set to true, it will only check the commit in case there is a single commit.\r\n  # In case of multiple commits it will check PR title.\r\n  # This reflects the standard behaviour of Github that for `Squash & Merge` GitHub\r\n  # uses the PR title rather than commit messages for the squashed commit ¯\\_(ツ)_/¯\r\n  # For single-commit PRs it takes the squashed commit message from the commit as expected.\r\n  #\r\n  # If set to false it will check all commit messages. This is useful when you do not squash commits at merge.\r\n  validateEitherPrOrSingleCommitTitle: true\r\n  # The title the GitHub status should appear from.\r\n  statusTitle: "Title Validator"\r\n  # A custom message to be displayed when the title passes validation.\r\n  successMessage: "Validation successful!"\r\n  # A custom message to be displayed when the title fails validation.\r\n  # Allows insertion of ${type} (commit/PR), ${title} (the title validated) and ${regex} (the titleRegexp above).\r\n  failureMessage: "Wrong ${type} title: ${title}"\r\n\r\n###### PR/Branch Up-To-Date Checker ####################################################################################\r\n# Check if the branch is up to date with master when certain files are modified\r\ncheckUpToDate:\r\n  # The default branch is "master", change the branch if you want to check against a different target branch  \r\n  targetBranch: master\r\n  files:\r\n  # File paths that you want to check for\r\n  # In this example, it checks if the branch is up to date when alembic migrations are modified in the PR.\r\n  # It helps avoid multiple heads in alembic migrations in a collaborative development project.\r\n    - airflow/migrations/*\r\n    - airflow/migrations/**/*\r\n    - airflow/alembic.ini\r\n```\r\n\r\nAll the features are optional. Simply add the config for the feature you want to use.\r\n\r\nIf you are having issues with the GitHub app not working, please create an issue on https://github.com/kaxil/boring-cyborg/issues.\r\n\r\n', 'external_url': 'https://github.com/kaxil/boring-cyborg', 'html_url': 'https://github.com/apps/boring-cyborg', 'created_at': '2020-01-04T23:52:58Z', 'updated_at': '2020-03-13T21:08:37Z', 'permissions': {'checks': 'write', 'issues': 'write', 'metadata': 'read', 'pull_requests': 'write', 'single_file': 'read', 'statuses': 'write'}, 'events': ['issues', 'label', 'pull_request', 'pull_request_review', 'pull_request_review_comment']}}]
