'https://api.github.com/users/kaxil/subscriptions', 'organizations_url': 'https://api.github.com/users/kaxil/orgs', 'repos_url': 'https://api.github.com/users/kaxil/repos', 'events_url': 'https://api.github.com/users/kaxil/events{/privacy}', 'received_events_url': 'https://api.github.com/users/kaxil/received_events', 'type': 'User', 'user_view_type': 'public', 'site_admin': False}, 'name': 'boring-cyborg', 'description': 'A Github bot to automatically label PRs, issues and perform all the boring operations that you don\'t want to do.\r\n\r\n\r\n![Using Boring Cyborg Probot to add new labels](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/kaxil/boring-cyborg/master/assets/usage-screenshot-1.png)\r\n\r\n![Congratulate user on first merged PR](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/kaxil/boring-cyborg/master/assets/usage-first-merged-pr.gif)\r\n\r\n## Features\r\n\r\n* Add labels based on the path of the file that are modified in the PR.\r\n* Welcome new users to your project when they open their first Issue/PR or first merged PR by an\r\nautomated comment. \r\n* Insert Issue (Jira/Github etc) link in PR description based on the Issue ID in PR title.\r\n* Verifies if commits/PR titles match the regular expression specified\r\n* Check if a branch is up to date with the master when specific files are modified in the PR. This is helpful when you desire the changes to be applied sequentially, for example, alembic migrations.\r\n\r\n## Usage\r\n\r\n1. **[Configure the Github App](https://github.com/apps/boring-cyborg)**\r\n2. After installing the Github app, create `.github/boring-cyborg.yml` in the default branch to enable it\r\n3. It will start scanning for pull requests within few minutes.\r\n\r\n```yaml\r\n##### Labeler ##########################################################################################################\r\n# Enable "labeler" for your PR that would add labels to PRs based on the paths that are modified in the PR.\r\nlabelPRBasedOnFilePath:\r\n  # Add \'label1\' to any changes within \'example\' folder or any subfolders\r\n  label1:\r\n    - example/**/*\r\n\r\n  # Add \'label2\' to any file changes within \'example2\' folder\r\n  label2:\r\n    - example2/*\r\n\r\n  # Complex: Add \'area/core\' label to any change within the \'core\' package\r\n  area/core:\r\n    - src/core/*\r\n    - src/core/**/*  \r\n\r\n  # Add \'test\' label to any change to *.spec.js files within the source dir\r\n  test:\r\n    - src/**/*.spec.js\r\n\r\n##### Greetings ########################################################################################################\r\n# Comment to be posted to welcome users when they open their first PR\r\nfirstPRWelcomeComment: >\r\n  Thanks for opening this pull request! Please check out our contributing guidelines.\r\n\r\n# Comment to be posted to congratulate user on their first merged PR\r\nfirstPRMergeComment: >\r\n  Awesome work, congrats on your first merged pull request!\r\n\r\n# Comment to be posted to on first time issues\r\nfirstIssueWelcomeComment: >\r\n  Thanks for opening your first issue here! Be sure to follow the issue template!\r\n\r\n###### IssueLink Adder #################################################################################################\r\n# Insert Issue (Jira/Github etc) link in PR description based on the Issue ID in PR title.\r\ninsertIssueLinkInPrDescription:\r\n   # specify the placeholder for the issue link that should be present in the description\r\n  descriptionIssuePlaceholderRegexp: "^Issue link: (.*)$"\r\n  matchers:\r\n    # you can have several matches - for different types of issues\r\n    # only the first matching entry is replaced\r\n    jiraIssueMatch:\r\n      # specify the regexp of issue id that you can find in the title of the PR\r\n      # the match groups can be used to build the issue id (${1}, ${2}, etc.).\r\n      titleIssueIdRegexp: \\[(AIRFLOW-[0-9]{4})\\]\r\n      # the issue link to be added. ${1}, ${2} ... are replaced with the match groups from the\r\n      # title match (remember to use quotes)\r\n      descriptionIssueLink: "[${1}](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/${1}/)"\r\n    docOnlyIssueMatch:\r\n      titleIssueIdRegexp: \\[(AIRFLOW-X{4})\\]\r\n      descriptionIssueLink: "`Document only change, no JIRA issue`"\r\n\r\n###### Title Validator #################################################################################################\r\n# Verifies if commit/PR titles match the regexp specified\r\nverifyTitles:\r\n  # Regular expression that should be matched by titles of commits or PR\r\n  titleRegexp: ^\\[AIRFLOW-[0-9]{4}\\].*$|^\\[AIRFLOW-XXXX\\].*$\r\n  # If set to true, it will always check the PR title (as opposed to the individual commits).\r\n  alwaysUsePrTitle: true\r\n  # If set to true, it will only check the commit in case there is a single commit.\r\n  # In case of multiple commits it will check PR title.\r\n  # This reflects the standard behaviour of Github that for `Squash & Merge` GitHub\r\n  # uses the PR title rather than commit messages for the squashed commit ¯\\_(ツ)_/¯\r\n  # For single-commit PRs it takes the squashed commit message from the commit as expected.\r\n  #\r\n  # If set to false it will check all commit messages. This is useful when you do not squash commits at merge.\r\n  validateEitherPrOrSingleCommitTitle: true\r\n  # The title the GitHub status should appear from.\r\n  statusTitle: "Title Validator"\r\n  # A custom message to be displayed when the title passes validation.\r\n  successMessage: "Validation successful!"\r\n  # A custom message to be displayed when the title fails validation.\r\n  # Allows insertion of ${type} (commit/PR), ${title} (the title validated) and ${regex} (the titleRegexp above).\r\n  failureMessage: "Wrong ${type} title: ${title}"\r\n\r\n###### PR/Branch Up-To-Date Checker ####################################################################################\r\n# Check if the branch is up to date with master when certain files are modified\r\ncheckUpToDate:\r\n  # The default branch is "master", change the branch if you want to check against a different target branch  \r\n  targetBranch: master\r\n  files:\r\n  # File paths that you want to check for\r\n  # In this example, it checks if the branch is up to date when alembic migrations are modified in the PR.\r\n  # It helps avoid multiple heads in alembic migrations in a collaborative development project.\r\n    - airflow/migrations/*\r\n    - airflow/migrations/**/*\r\n    - airflow/alembic.ini\r\n```\r\n\r\nAll the features are optional. Simply add the config for the feature you want to use.\r\n\r\nIf you are having issues with the GitHub app not working, please create an issue on https://github.com/kaxil/boring-cyborg/issues.\r\n\r\n', 'external_url': 'https://github.com/kaxil/boring-cyborg', 'html_url': 'https://github.com/apps/boring-cyborg', 'created_at': PR.\r\n* Welcome new users to your project when they open their first Issue/PR or first merged PR by an\r\nautomated comment. \r\n* Insert Issue (Jira/Github etc) link in PR description based on the Please check out our contributing guidelines.\r\n\r\n# Comment to be posted to congratulate user on their first merged PR\r\nfirstPRMergeComment: >\r\n  Awesome work, congrats on your first merged pull request!\r\n\r\n# Comment to be posted to on first time issues\r\nfirstIssueWelcomeComment: >\r\n  Thanks for opening your first issue here! Be sure to follow the issue template!\r\n\r\n###### IssueLink Adder #################################################################################################\r\n# Insert Issue (Jira/Github etc) link in PR description based on the Issue ID in PR title.\r\ninsertIssueLinkInPrDescription:\r\n   # specify the placeholder for the issue link that should be present in the description\r\n  descriptionIssuePlaceholderRegexp: "^Issue link: (.*)$"\r\n  matchers:\r\n    # you can have several matches - for different types of issues\r\n    # only the first matching entry is replaced\r\n    jiraIssueMatch:\r\n      # specify the regexp of issue id that you can find in the title of the PR\r\n      # the match groups can be used to build the issue id (${1}, ${2}, etc.).\r\n      titleIssueIdRegexp: \\[(AIRFLOW-[0-9]{4})\\]\r\n      # the issue link to be added. ${1}, ${2} ... are replaced with the match groups from the\r\n      # title match (remember to use quotes)\r\n      descriptionIssueLink: "[${1}](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/${1}/)"\r\n    docOnlyIssueMatch:\r\n      titleIssueIdRegexp: \\[(AIRFLOW-X{4})\\]\r\n      descriptionIssueLink: "`Document only change, no JIRA issue`"\r\n\r\n###### Title Validator #################################################################################################\r\n# Verifies if commit/PR titles match the regexp specified\r\nverifyTitles:\r\n  # Regular expression that should be matched by titles of commits or PR\r\n  titleRegexp: ^\\[AIRFLOW-[0-9]{4}\\].*$|^\\[AIRFLOW-XXXX\\].*$\r\n  # If set to true, it will always check the PR title (as opposed to the individual commits).\r\n  alwaysUsePrTitle: true\r\n  # If set to true, it will only check the commit in case there is a single commit.\r\n  # In case of multiple commits it will check PR title.\r\n  # This reflects the standard behaviour of Github that for `Squash & Merge` GitHub\r\n  # uses the PR title rather than commit messages for the squashed commit ¯\\_(ツ)_/¯\r\n  # For single-commit PRs it takes the squashed commit message from the commit as expected.\r\n  #\r\n  # If set to false it will check all commit messages. This is useful when you do not squash commits at merge.\r\n  validateEitherPrOrSingleCommitTitle: true\r\n  # The title the GitHub status should appear from.\r\n  statusTitle: "Title Validator"\r\n  # A custom message to be displayed when the title passes validation.\r\n  successMessage: "Validation successful!"\r\n  # A custom message to be displayed when the title fails validation.\r\n  # Allows insertion of ${type} (commit/PR), ${title} (the title validated) and ${regex} (the titleRegexp above).\r\n  failureMessage: "Wrong ${type} title: ${title}"\r\n\r\n###### PR/Branch Up-To-Date Checker ####################################################################################\r\n# Check if the branch is up to date with master when certain files are modified\r\ncheckUpToDate:\r\n  # The default branch is "master", change the branch if you want to check against a different target branch  \r\n  targetBranch: master\r\n  files:\r\n  # File paths that you want to check for\r\n  # In this example, it checks if the branch is up to date when alembic migrations are modified in the PR.\r\n  # It helps avoid multiple heads in alembic migrations in a collaborative development project.\r\n    - airflow/migrations/*\r\n    - airflow/migrations/**/*\r\n    - airflow/alembic.ini\r\n```\r\n\r\nAll the features are optional. Simply add the config for the feature you want to use.\r\n\r\nIf you are having issues with the GitHub app not working, please create an issue on https://github.com/kaxil/boring-cyborg/issues.\r\n\r\n', 'external_url': 'https://github.com/kaxil/boring-cyborg', 'html_url': 'https://github.com/apps/boring-cyborg', 'created_at': '2020-01-04T23:52:58Z', 'updated_at': '2020-03-13T21:08:37Z', 'permissions': {'checks': 'write', 'issues': 'write', 'metadata': 'read', 'pull_requests': 'write', 'single_file': 'read', 'statuses': 'write'}, 'events': ['issues', 'label', 'pull_request', 'pull_request_review', 'pull_request_review_comment']}}]

'https://api.github.com/users/kaxil/events{/privacy}', 'received_events_url': 'https://api.github.com/users/kaxil/received_events', 'type': 'User', 'user_view_type': 'public', 'site_admin': False}, 'name': 'boring-cyborg', 'description': 'A Github bot to automatically label PRs, issues and perform all the boring operations that you don\'t want to do.\r\n\r\n\r\n![Using Boring Cyborg Probot to add new labels](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/kaxil/boring-cyborg/master/assets/usage-screenshot-1.png)\r\n\r\n![Congratulate user on first merged PR](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/kaxil/boring-cyborg/master/assets/usage-first-merged-pr.gif)\r\n\r\n## Features\r\n\r\n* Add labels based on the path of the file that are modified in the PR.\r\n* Welcome new users to your project when they open their first Issue/PR or first merged PR by an\r\nautomated comment. \r\n* Insert Issue (Jira/Github etc) link in PR description based on the Issue ID in PR title.\r\n* Verifies if commits/PR titles match the regular expression specified\r\n* Check if a branch is up to date with the master when specific files are modified in the PR. This is helpful when you desire the changes to be applied sequentially, for example, alembic migrations.\r\n\r\n## Usage\r\n\r\n1. **[Configure the Github App](https://github.com/apps/boring-cyborg)**\r\n2. After installing the Github app, create `.github/boring-cyborg.yml` in the default branch to enable it\r\n3. It will start scanning for pull requests within few minutes.\r\n\r\n```yaml\r\n##### Labeler ##########################################################################################################\r\n# Enable "labeler" for your PR that would add labels to PRs based on the paths that are modified in the PR.\r\nlabelPRBasedOnFilePath:\r\n  # Add \'label1\' to any changes within \'example\' folder or any subfolders\r\n  label1:\r\n    - example/**/*\r\n\r\n  # Add \'label2\' to any file changes within \'example2\' folder\r\n  label2:\r\n    - example2/*\r\n\r\n  # Complex: Add \'area/core\' label to any change within the \'core\' package\r\n  area/core:\r\n    - src/core/*\r\n    - src/core/**/*  \r\n\r\n  # Add \'test\' label to any change to *.spec.js files within the source dir\r\n  test:\r\n    - src/**/*.spec.js\r\n\r\n##### Greetings ########################################################################################################\r\n# Comment to be posted to welcome users when they open their first PR\r\nfirstPRWelcomeComment: >\r\n  Thanks for opening this pull request! Please check out our contributing guidelines.\r\n\r\n# Comment to be posted to congratulate user on their first merged PR\r\nfirstPRMergeComment: >\r\n  Awesome work, congrats on your first merged pull request!\r\n\r\n# Comment to be posted to on first time issues\r\nfirstIssueWelcomeComment: >\r\n  Thanks for opening your first issue here! Be sure to follow the issue template!\r\n\r\n###### IssueLink Adder #################################################################################################\r\n# Insert Issue (Jira/Github etc) link in PR description based on the Issue ID in PR title.\r\ninsertIssueLinkInPrDescription:\r\n   # specify the placeholder for the issue link that should be present in the description\r\n  descriptionIssuePlaceholderRegexp: "^Issue link: (.*)$"\r\n  matchers:\r\n    # you can have several matches - for different types of issues\r\n    # only the first matching entry is replaced\r\n    jiraIssueMatch:\r\n      # specify the regexp of issue id that you can find in the title of the PR\r\n      # the match groups can be used to build the issue id (${1}, ${2}, etc.).\r\n      titleIssueIdRegexp: \\[(AIRFLOW-[0-9]{4})\\]\r\n      # the issue link to be added. ${1}, ${2} ... are replaced with the match groups from the\r\n      # title match (remember to use quotes)\r\n      descriptionIssueLink: "[${1}](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/${1}/)"\r\n    docOnlyIssueMatch:\r\n      titleIssueIdRegexp: \\[(AIRFLOW-X{4})\\]\r\n      descriptionIssueLink: "`Document only change, no JIRA issue`"\r\n\r\n###### Title Validator #################################################################################################\r\n# Verifies if commit/PR titles match the regexp specified\r\nverifyTitles:\r\n  # Regular expression that should be matched by titles of commits or PR\r\n  titleRegexp: ^\\[AIRFLOW-[0-9]{4}\\].*$|^\\[AIRFLOW-XXXX\\].*$\r\n  # If set to true, it will always check the PR title (as opposed to the individual commits).\r\n  alwaysUsePrTitle: true\r\n  # If set to true, it will only check the commit in case there is a single commit.\r\n  # In case of multiple commits it will check PR title.\r\n  # This reflects the standard behaviour of Github that for `Squash & Merge` GitHub\r\n  # uses the PR title rather than commit messages for the squashed commit ¯\\_(ツ)_/¯\r\n  # For single-commit PRs it takes the squashed commit message from the commit as expected.\r\n  #\r\n  # If set to false it will check all commit messages. This is useful when you do not squash commits at merge.\r\n  validateEitherPrOrSingleCommitTitle: true\r\n  # The title the GitHub status should appear from.\r\n  statusTitle: "Title Validator"\r\n  # A custom message to be displayed when the title passes validation.\r\n  successMessage: "Validation successful!"\r\n  # A custom message to be displayed when the title fails validation.\r\n  # Allows insertion of ${type} (commit/PR), ${title} (the title validated) and ${regex} (the titleRegexp above).\r\n  failureMessage: "Wrong ${type} title: ${title}"\r\n\r\n###### PR/Branch Up-To-Date Checker ####################################################################################\r\n# Check if the branch is up to date with master when certain files are modified\r\ncheckUpToDate:\r\n  # The default branch is "master", change the branch if you want to check against a different target branch  \r\n  targetBranch: master\r\n  files:\r\n  # File paths that you want to check for\r\n  # In this example, it checks if the branch is up to date when alembic migrations are modified in the PR.\r\n  # It helps avoid multiple heads in alembic migrations in a collaborative development project.\r\n    - airflow/migrations/*\r\n    - airflow/migrations/**/*\r\n    - airflow/alembic.ini\r\n```\r\n\r\nAll the features are optional. Simply add the config for the feature you want to use.\r\n\r\nIf you are having issues with the GitHub app not working, please create an issue on https://github.com/kaxil/boring-cyborg/issues.\r\n\r\n', 'external_url': 'https://github.com/kaxil/boring-cyborg', 'html_url': 'https://github.com/apps/boring-cyborg', 'created_at': 'https://api.github.com/users/kaxil/events{/privacy}', 'received_events_url': 'https://api.github.com/users/kaxil/received_events', 'type': 'User', 'user_view_type': 'public', 'site_admin': False}, 'name': 'boring-cyborg', 'description': 'A Github bot to automatically label PRs, issues and perform all the boring operations that you don\'t want to do.\r\n\r\n\r\n![Using Boring Cyborg Probot to add new labels](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/kaxil/boring-cyborg/master/assets/usage-screenshot-1.png)\r\n\r\n![Congratulate user on first merged PR](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/kaxil/boring-cyborg/master/assets/usage-first-merged-pr.gif)\r\n\r\n## Features\r\n\r\n* Add labels based on the path of the file that are modified in the PR.\r\n* Welcome new users to your project when they open their first Issue/PR or first merged PR by an\r\nautomated comment. \r\n* Insert Issue (Jira/Github etc) link in PR description based on the Issue ID in PR title.\r\n* Verifies if commits/PR titles match the regular expression specified\r\n* Check if a branch is up to date with the master when specific files are modified in the PR. This is helpful when you desire the changes to be applied sequentially, for example, alembic migrations.\r\n\r\n## Usage\r\n\r\n1. **[Configure the Github App](https://github.com/apps/boring-cyborg)**\r\n2. After installing the Github app, create `.github/boring-cyborg.yml` in the default branch to enable it\r\n3. It will start scanning for pull requests within few minutes.\r\n\r\n```yaml\r\n##### Labeler ##########################################################################################################\r\n# Enable "labeler" for your PR that would add labels to PRs based on the paths that are modified in the PR.\r\nlabelPRBasedOnFilePath:\r\n  # Add \'label1\' to any changes within \'example\' folder or any subfolders\r\n  label1:\r\n    - example/**/*\r\n\r\n  # Add \'label2\' to any file changes within \'example2\' folder\r\n  label2:\r\n    - example2/*\r\n\r\n  # Complex: Add \'area/core\' label to any change within the \'core\' package\r\n  area/core:\r\n    - src/core/*\r\n    - src/core/**/*  \r\n\r\n  # Add \'test\' label to any change to *.spec.js files within the source dir\r\n  test:\r\n    - src/**/*.spec.js\r\n\r\n##### Greetings ########################################################################################################\r\n# Comment to be posted to welcome users when they open their first PR\r\nfirstPRWelcomeComment: >\r\n  Thanks for opening this pull request! Please check out our contributing guidelines.\r\n\r\n# Comment to be posted to congratulate user on their first merged PR\r\nfirstPRMergeComment: >\r\n  Awesome work, congrats on your first merged pull request!\r\n\r\n# Comment to be posted to on first time issues\r\nfirstIssueWelcomeComment: >\r\n  Thanks for opening your first issue here! Be sure to follow the issue template!\r\n\r\n###### IssueLink Adder #################################################################################################\r\n# Insert Issue (Jira/Github etc) link in PR description based on the Issue ID in PR title.\r\ninsertIssueLinkInPrDescription:\r\n   # specify the placeholder for the issue link that should be present in the description\r\n  descriptionIssuePlaceholderRegexp: "^Issue link: (.*)$"\r\n  matchers:\r\n    # you can have several matches - for different types of issues\r\n    # only the first matching entry is replaced\r\n    jiraIssueMatch:\r\n      # specify the regexp of issue id that you can find in the title of the PR\r\n      # the match groups can be used to build the issue id (${1}, ${2}, etc.).\r\n      titleIssueIdRegexp: \\[(AIRFLOW-[0-9]{4})\\]\r\n      # the issue link to be added. ${1}, ${2} ... are replaced with the match groups from the\r\n      # title match (remember to use quotes)\r\n      descriptionIssueLink: "[${1}](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/${1}/)"\r\n    docOnlyIssueMatch:\r\n      titleIssueIdRegexp: \\[(AIRFLOW-X{4})\\]\r\n      descriptionIssueLink: "`Document only change, no JIRA issue`"\r\n\r\n###### Title Validator #################################################################################################\r\n# Verifies if commit/PR titles match the regexp specified\r\nverifyTitles:\r\n  # Regular expression that should be matched by titles of commits or PR\r\n  titleRegexp: ^\\[AIRFLOW-[0-9]{4}\\].*$|^\\[AIRFLOW-XXXX\\].*$\r\n  # If set to true, it will always check the PR title (as opposed to the individual commits).\r\n  alwaysUsePrTitle: true\r\n  # If set to true, it will only check the commit in case there is a single commit.\r\n  # In case of multiple commits it will check PR title.\r\n  # This reflects the standard behaviour of Github that for `Squash & Merge` GitHub\r\n  # uses the PR title rather than commit messages for the squashed commit ¯\\_(ツ)_/¯\r\n  # For single-commit PRs it takes the squashed commit message from the commit as expected.\r\n  #\r\n  # If set to false it will check all commit messages. This is useful when you do not squash commits at merge.\r\n  validateEitherPrOrSingleCommitTitle: true\r\n  # The title the GitHub status should appear from.\r\n  statusTitle: "Title Validator"\r\n  # A custom message to be displayed when the title passes validation.\r\n  successMessage: "Validation successful!"\r\n  # A custom message to be displayed when the title fails validation.\r\n  # Allows insertion of ${type} (commit/PR), ${title} (the title validated) and ${regex} (the titleRegexp above).\r\n  failureMessage: "Wrong ${type} title: ${title}"\r\n\r\n###### PR/Branch Up-To-Date Checker ####################################################################################\r\n# Check if the branch is up to date with master when certain files are modified\r\ncheckUpToDate:\r\n  # The default branch is "master", change the branch if you want to check against a different target branch  \r\n  targetBranch: master\r\n  files:\r\n  # File paths that you want to check for\r\n  # In this example, it checks if the branch is up to date when alembic migrations are modified in the PR.\r\n  # It helps avoid multiple heads in alembic migrations in a collaborative development project.\r\n    - airflow/migrations/*\r\n    - airflow/migrations/**/*\r\n    - airflow/alembic.ini\r\n```\r\n\r\nAll the features are optional. Simply add the config for the feature you want to use.\r\n\r\nIf you are having issues with the GitHub app not working, please create an issue on https://github.com/kaxil/boring-cyborg/issues.\r\n\r\n', 'external_url': 'https://github.com/kaxil/boring-cyborg', 'html_url': 'https://github.com/apps/boring-cyborg', 'created_at': 'kaxil', 'id': 8811558, 'node_id': 'MDQ6VXNlcjg4MTE1NTg=', 'avatar_url': 'https://avatars.githubusercontent.com/u/8811558?v=4', 'gravatar_id': '', 'url': 'https://api.github.com/users/kaxil', 'html_url': 'https://github.com/kaxil', 'followers_url': 'https://api.github.com/users/kaxil/followers', 'following_url': 'https://api.github.com/users/kaxil/following{/other_user}', 'gists_url': 'https://api.github.com/users/kaxil/events{/privacy}', 'received_events_url': 'https://api.github.com/users/kaxil/received_events', 'type': 'User', 'user_view_type': 'public', 'site_admin': False}, 'name': 'boring-cyborg', 'description': 'A Github bot to automatically label PRs, issues and perform all the boring operations that you don\'t want to do.\r\n\r\n\r\n![Using Boring Cyborg Probot to add new labels](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/kaxil/boring-cyborg/master/assets/usage-screenshot-1.png)\r\n\r\n![Congratulate user on first merged PR](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/kaxil/boring-cyborg/master/assets/usage-first-merged-pr.gif)\r\n\r\n## Features\r\n\r\n* Add labels based on the path of the file that are modified in the PR.\r\n* Welcome new users to your project when they open their first Issue/PR or first merged PR by an\r\nautomated comment. \r\n* Insert Issue (Jira/Github etc) link in PR description based on the Issue ID in PR title.\r\n* Verifies if commits/PR titles match the regular expression specified\r\n* Check if a branch is up to date with the master when specific files are modified in the PR. This is helpful when you desire the changes to be applied sequentially, for example, alembic migrations.\r\n\r\n## Usage\r\n\r\n1. **[Configure the Github App](https://github.com/apps/boring-cyborg)**\r\n2. After installing the Github app, create `.github/boring-cyborg.yml` in the default branch to enable it\r\n3. It will start scanning for pull requests within few minutes.\r\n\r\n```yaml\r\n##### Labeler ##########################################################################################################\r\n# Enable "labeler" for your PR that would add labels to PRs based on the paths that are modified in the PR.\r\nlabelPRBasedOnFilePath:\r\n  # Add \'label1\' to any changes within \'example\' folder or any subfolders\r\n  label1:\r\n    - example/**/*\r\n\r\n  # Add \'label2\' to any file changes within \'example2\' folder\r\n  label2:\r\n    - example2/*\r\n\r\n  # Complex: Add \'area/core\' label to any change within the \'core\' package\r\n  area/core:\r\n    - src/core/*\r\n    - src/core/**/*  \r\n\r\n  # Add \'test\' label to any change to *.spec.js files within the source dir\r\n  test:\r\n    - src/**/*.spec.js\r\n\r\n##### Greetings ########################################################################################################\r\n# Comment to be posted to welcome users when they open their first PR\r\nfirstPRWelcomeComment: >\r\n  Thanks for opening this pull request! Please check out our contributing guidelines.\r\n\r\n# Comment to be posted to congratulate user on their first merged PR\r\nfirstPRMergeComment: >\r\n  Awesome work, congrats on your first merged pull request!\r\n\r\n# Comment to be posted to on first time issues\r\nfirstIssueWelcomeComment: >\r\n  Thanks for opening your first issue here! Be sure to follow the issue template!\r\n\r\n###### IssueLink Adder #################################################################################################\r\n# Insert Issue (Jira/Github etc) link in PR description based on the Issue ID in PR title.\r\ninsertIssueLinkInPrDescription:\r\n   # specify the placeholder for the issue link that should be present in the description\r\n  descriptionIssuePlaceholderRegexp: "^Issue link: (.*)$"\r\n  matchers:\r\n    # you can have several matches - for different types of issues\r\n    # only the first matching entry is replaced\r\n    jiraIssueMatch:\r\n      # specify the regexp of issue id that you can find in the title of the PR\r\n      # the match groups can be used to build the issue id (${1}, ${2}, etc.).\r\n      titleIssueIdRegexp: \\[(AIRFLOW-[0-9]{4})\\]\r\n      # the issue link to be added. ${1}, ${2} ... are replaced with the match groups from the\r\n      # title match (remember to use quotes)\r\n      descriptionIssueLink: "[${1}](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/${1}/)"\r\n    docOnlyIssueMatch:\r\n      titleIssueIdRegexp: \\[(AIRFLOW-X{4})\\]\r\n      descriptionIssueLink: "`Document only change, no JIRA issue`"\r\n\r\n###### Title Validator #################################################################################################\r\n# Verifies if commit/PR titles match the regexp specified\r\nverifyTitles:\r\n  # Regular expression that should be matched by titles of commits or PR\r\n  titleRegexp: ^\\[AIRFLOW-[0-9]{4}\\].*$|^\\[AIRFLOW-XXXX\\].*$\r\n  # If set to true, it will always check the PR title (as opposed to the individual commits).\r\n  alwaysUsePrTitle: true\r\n  # If set to true, it will only check the commit in case there is a single commit.\r\n  # In case of multiple commits it will check PR title.\r\n  # This reflects the standard behaviour of Github that for `Squash & Merge` GitHub\r\n  # uses the PR title rather than commit messages for the squashed commit ¯\\_(ツ)_/¯\r\n  # For single-commit PRs it takes the squashed commit message from the commit as expected.\r\n  #\r\n  # If set to false it will check all commit messages. This is useful when you do not squash commits at merge.\r\n  validateEitherPrOrSingleCommitTitle: true\r\n  # The title the GitHub status should appear from.\r\n  statusTitle: "Title Validator"\r\n  # A custom message to be displayed when the title passes validation.\r\n  successMessage: "Validation successful!"\r\n  # A custom message to be displayed when the title fails validation.\r\n  # Allows insertion of ${type} (commit/PR), ${title} (the title validated) and ${regex} (the titleRegexp above).\r\n  failureMessage: "Wrong ${type} title: ${title}"\r\n\r\n###### PR/Branch Up-To-Date Checker ####################################################################################\r\n# Check if the branch is up to date with master when certain files are modified\r\ncheckUpToDate:\r\n  # The default branch is "master", change the branch if you want to check against a different target branch  \r\n  targetBranch: master\r\n  files:\r\n  # File paths that you want to check for\r\n  # In this example, it checks if the branch is up to date when alembic migrations are modified in the PR.\r\n  # It helps avoid multiple heads in alembic migrations in a collaborative development project.\r\n    - airflow/migrations/*\r\n    - airflow/migrations/**/*\r\n    - airflow/alembic.ini\r\n```\r\n\r\nAll the features are optional. Simply add the config for the feature you want to use.\r\n\r\nIf you are having issues with the GitHub app not working, please create an issue on https://github.com/kaxil/boring-cyborg/issues.\r\n\r\n', 'external_url': 'https://github.com/kaxil/boring-cyborg', 'html_url': 'https://github.com/apps/boring-cyborg', 'created_at': '2020-01-04T23:52:58Z', 'updated_at': '2020-03-13T21:08:37Z', 'permissions': {'checks': 'write', 'issues': 'write', 'metadata': 'read', 'pull_requests': 'write', 'single_file': 'read', 'statuses': 'write'}, 'events': ['issues', 'label', 'pull_request', 'pull_request_review', 'pull_request_review_comment']}}]

'author_association': 'CONTRIBUTOR', 'body': "@ruanwenjun \r\nI spent some time reading through the main code, and I think directly write `scheduleTime` with prop `system.schedule.time` into `ScheduleWorkflowCommandParam.commandParams` in `WorkflowScheduleTrigger.constructTriggerCommand` is the better than add a new entity.\r\n\r\nIt's always propagated to sub-workflows. At runtime, it will be merged into `globalParams`, and easily to retrieve `scheduleTime` with minimal code changes.\r\n\r\nthen refactor some date operations like `CuringParamsServiceImpl.preBuildBusinessParams` or `BusinessTimeUtils.getBusinessTime` to use `system.schedule.time` to calculate dates.\r\n\r\nBut there are still a few issues to resolve:\r\n\r\n1. The master's failover process always takes over all workflows, including sub-workflows. So, when a sub-workflow is taken over, it can also retrieve the schedule time from `globalParams`. But there's an issue with failing over sub-workflow tasks; it triggers a new sub-workflow instance to run alongside the original master-taken-over sub-workflow. I prefer to directly take over the sub-workflow task rather than triggering a new sub-workflow, as the sub-workflow may contain many tasks. The issue is: https://github.com/apache/dolphinscheduler/issues/16767\r\n\r\n2. Some task or parameter operations do not verify whether the workflow is a sub-workflow. As a result, resulting in many `workflowInstance.getScheduleTime()` calls may needing assessment. I modified several code sections to use `commandParams` instead：https://github.com/apache/dolphinscheduler/compare/dev...reele:dolphinscheduler:fix-16768-2\r\n\r\n3. Currently, parameter runtime values are obtained in real-time, while `globalParams` stores the definition values. This causes the parameter view on the UI page to display the definition value rather than the runtime value. and also I think storing the runtime value may help with instance failover.\r\n\r\n4. **The last issue is bigger! dependent task use `workflowInstance.scheduleTime == null` to determine if the workflow is manual run, there can not replace with builtin parameter, that will cause db performance issue, so  scheduleTime need always set a value in sub-workflow(from parent instance)**\r\nthere need a value to get the initial command type, or change to another way to implement the dependent logic.", 'reactions': {'url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/apache/dolphinscheduler/issues/comments/2468487492/reactions', 'total_count': 0, '+1': 0, '-1': 0, 'laugh': 0, 'hooray': 0, 'confused': 0, 'heart': 0, 'rocket': 0, 'eyes': 0}, 'performed_via_github_app': None}]

The majority of popular languages can be analyzed automatically; no configuration is required!\r\n\r\nWith [SonarQube Cloud](https://sonarcloud.io/github), you get:\r\n\r\n-   Fast, precise static analysis and feedback on your code\r\n    \r\n-   Support for popular languages, frameworks, and IaC tools\r\n    \r\n-   Free analysis for open-source projects and private projects up to max 50k LoC\r\n    \r\n-   Automatic analysis of pull requests and branches with results reported inline\r\n    \r\n-   IDE Support with [SonarQube for IDE](https://www.sonarsource.com/products/sonarlint/) integration\r\n    \r\n-   Quality Gate (added as a GitHub check) acting at two different levels - first, preventing you from merging pull requests that contain issues - and later, helping you to release only clean, safe code\r\n    \r\n-   Sign up for SonarQube free tier and begin scanning your private and public repositories\r\n    \r\n\r\nA [GitHub Action](https://github.com/marketplace/actions/sonarcloud-scan) is available in the marketplace to make it easy for you (for projects where automatic analysis isn't available). SonarQube Cloud also integrates smoothly with Jenkins, CircleCI, TravisCI, CirrusCI, and many other tools.\r\n\r\nA free tier is available that allows you to explore the benefits of SonarQube Cloud using your public and private repositories. Comments: [{'url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/apache/dolphinscheduler/issues/comments/2456103572', 'html_url': 'https://github.com/apache/dolphinscheduler/pull/16763#issuecomment-2456103572', 'issue_url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/apache/dolphinscheduler/issues/16763', 'id': 2456103572, 'node_id': 'IC_kwDOClTkms6SZSqU', 'user': {'login': 'boring-cyborg[bot]', 'id': 59518230, 'node_id': 'MDM6Qm90NTk1MTgyMzA=', 'avatar_url': 'https://avatars.githubusercontent.com/in/50386?v=4', 'gravatar_id': '', 'url': 'https://api.github.com/users/boring-cyborg%5Bbot%5D', 'html_url': 'https://github.com/apps/boring-cyborg', 'followers_url': 'https://api.github.com/users/boring-cyborg%5Bbot%5D/followers', 'following_url': 'https://api.github.com/users/boring-cyborg%5Bbot%5D/following{/other_user}', 'gists_url': 'https://api.github.com/users/boring-cyborg%5Bbot%5D/gists{/gist_id}', 'starred_url': 'https://api.github.com/users/boring-cyborg%5Bbot%5D/starred{/owner}{/repo}', 'subscriptions_url': 'https://api.github.com/users/boring-cyborg%5Bbot%5D/subscriptions', 'organizations_url': 'https://api.github.com/users/boring-cyborg%5Bbot%5D/orgs', 'repos_url': 'https://api.github.com/users/boring-cyborg%5Bbot%5D/repos', 'events_url': 'https://api.github.com/users/boring-cyborg%5Bbot%5D/events{/privacy}', 'received_events_url': 'https://api.github.com/users/boring-cyborg%5Bbot%5D/received_events', 'type': 'Bot', 'user_view_type': 'public', 'site_admin': False}, 'created_at': '2024-11-05T02:36:16Z', 'updated_at': '2024-11-05T02:36:16Z', 'author_association': 'NONE', 'body': 'Thanks for opening this pull request! Please check out our contributing guidelines. (https://github.com/apache/dolphinscheduler/blob/dev/docs/docs/en/contribute/join/pull-request.md)\n', 'reactions': {'url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/apache/dolphinscheduler/issues/comments/2456103572/reactions', 'total_count': 0, '+1': 0, '-1': 0, 'laugh': 0, 'hooray': 0, 'confused': 0, 'heart': 0, 'rocket': 0, 'eyes': 0}, 'performed_via_github_app': {'id': 50386, 'client_id': 'Iv1.2c01d706e79ed3c6', 'slug': 'boring-cyborg', 'node_id': 'MDM6QXBwNTAzODY=', 'owner': {'login': 'kaxil', 'id': 8811558, 'node_id': 'MDQ6VXNlcjg4MTE1NTg=', 'avatar_url': 'https://avatars.githubusercontent.com/u/8811558?v=4', 'gravatar_id': '', 'url': 'https://api.github.com/users/kaxil', 'html_url': 'https://github.com/kaxil', 'followers_url': 'https://api.github.com/users/kaxil/followers', 'following_url': 'https://api.github.com/users/kaxil/following{/other_user}', 'gists_url': 'https://api.github.com/users/kaxil/gists{/gist_id}', 'starred_url': 'https://api.github.com/users/kaxil/starred{/owner}{/repo}', 'subscriptions_url': 'https://api.github.com/users/kaxil/subscriptions', 'organizations_url': 'https://api.github.com/users/kaxil/orgs', 'repos_url': 'https://api.github.com/users/kaxil/repos', 'events_url': 'https://api.github.com/users/kaxil/events{/privacy}', 'received_events_url': 'https://api.github.com/users/kaxil/received_events', 'type': 'User', 'user_view_type': 'public', 'site_admin': False}, 'name': 'boring-cyborg', 'description': 'A Github bot to automatically label PRs, issues and perform all the boring operations that you don\'t want to do.\r\n\r\n\r\n![Using Boring Cyborg Probot to add new labels](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/kaxil/boring-cyborg/master/assets/usage-screenshot-1.png)\r\n\r\n![Congratulate user on first merged PR](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/kaxil/boring-cyborg/master/assets/usage-first-merged-pr.gif)\r\n\r\n## Features\r\n\r\n* Add labels based on the path of the file that are modified in the PR.\r\n* Welcome new users to your project when they open their first Issue/PR or first merged PR by an\r\nautomated comment. \r\n* Insert Issue (Jira/Github etc) link in PR description based on the Issue ID in PR title.\r\n* Verifies if commits/PR titles match the regular expression specified\r\n* Check if a branch is up to date with the master when specific files are modified in the PR. This is helpful when you desire the changes to be applied sequentially, for example, alembic migrations.\r\n\r\n## Usage\r\n\r\n1. **[Configure the Github App](https://github.com/apps/boring-cyborg)**\r\n2. After installing the Github app, create `.github/boring-cyborg.yml` in the default branch to enable it\r\n3. It will start scanning for pull requests within few minutes.\r\n\r\n```yaml\r\n##### Labeler ##########################################################################################################\r\n# Enable "labeler" for your PR that would add labels to PRs based on the paths that are modified in the PR.\r\nlabelPRBasedOnFilePath:\r\n  # Add \'label1\' to any changes within \'example\' folder or any subfolders\r\n  label1:\r\n    - example/**/*\r\n\r\n  # Add \'label2\' to any file changes within \'example2\' folder\r\n  label2:\r\n    - example2/*\r\n\r\n  # Complex: Add \'area/core\' label to any change within the \'core\' package\r\n  area/core:\r\n    - src/core/*\r\n    - src/core/**/*  \r\n\r\n  # Add \'test\' label to any change to *.spec.js files within the source dir\r\n  test:\r\n    - src/**/*.spec.js\r\n\r\n##### Greetings ########################################################################################################\r\n# Comment to be posted to welcome users when they open their first PR\r\nfirstPRWelcomeComment: >\r\n  Thanks for opening this pull request! Please check out our contributing guidelines.\r\n\r\n# Comment to be posted to congratulate user on their first merged PR\r\nfirstPRMergeComment: >\r\n  Awesome work, congrats on your first merged pull request!\r\n\r\n# Comment to be posted to on first time issues\r\nfirstIssueWelcomeComment: >\r\n  Thanks for opening your first issue here! Be sure to follow the issue template!\r\n\r\n###### IssueLink Adder #################################################################################################\r\n# Insert Issue (Jira/Github etc) link in PR description based on the Issue ID in PR title.\r\ninsertIssueLinkInPrDescription:\r\n   # specify the placeholder for the issue link that should be present in the description\r\n  descriptionIssuePlaceholderRegexp: "^Issue link: (.*)$"\r\n  matchers:\r\n    # you can have several matches - for different types of issues\r\n    # only the first matching entry is replaced\r\n    jiraIssueMatch:\r\n      # specify the regexp of issue id that you can find in the title of the PR\r\n      # the match groups can be used to build the issue id (${1}, ${2}, etc.).\r\n      titleIssueIdRegexp: \\[(AIRFLOW-[0-9]{4})\\]\r\n      # the issue link to be added. ${1}, ${2} ... are replaced with the match groups from the\r\n      # title match (remember to use quotes)\r\n      descriptionIssueLink: "[${1}](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/${1}/)"\r\n    docOnlyIssueMatch:\r\n      titleIssueIdRegexp: \\[(AIRFLOW-X{4})\\]\r\n      descriptionIssueLink: "`Document only change, no JIRA issue`"\r\n\r\n###### Title Validator #################################################################################################\r\n# Verifies if commit/PR titles match the regexp specified\r\nverifyTitles:\r\n  # Regular expression that should be matched by titles of commits or PR\r\n  titleRegexp: ^\\[AIRFLOW-[0-9]{4}\\].*$|^\\[AIRFLOW-XXXX\\].*$\r\n  # If set to true, it will always check the PR title (as opposed to the individual commits).\r\n  alwaysUsePrTitle: true\r\n  # If set to true, it will only check the commit in case there is a single commit.\r\n  # In case of multiple commits it will check PR title.\r\n  # This reflects the standard behaviour of Github that for `Squash & Merge` GitHub\r\n  # uses the PR title rather than commit messages for the squashed commit ¯\\_(ツ)_/¯\r\n  # For single-commit PRs it takes the squashed commit message from the commit as expected.\r\n  #\r\n  # If set to false it will check all commit messages. This is useful when you do not squash commits at merge.\r\n  validateEitherPrOrSingleCommitTitle: true\r\n  # The title the GitHub status should appear from.\r\n  statusTitle: "Title Validator"\r\n  # A custom message to be displayed when the title passes validation.\r\n  successMessage: "Validation successful!"\r\n  # A custom message to be displayed when the title fails validation.\r\n  # Allows insertion of ${type} (commit/PR), ${title} (the title validated) and ${regex} (the titleRegexp above).\r\n  failureMessage: "Wrong ${type} title: ${title}"\r\n\r\n###### PR/Branch Up-To-Date Checker ####################################################################################\r\n# Check if the branch is up to date with master when certain files are modified\r\ncheckUpToDate:\r\n  # The default branch is "master", change the branch if you want to check against a different target branch  \r\n  targetBranch: master\r\n  files:\r\n  # File paths that you want to check for\r\n  # In this example, it checks if the branch is up to date when alembic migrations are modified in the PR.\r\n  # It helps avoid multiple heads in alembic migrations in a collaborative development project.\r\n    - airflow/migrations/*\r\n    - airflow/migrations/**/*\r\n    - airflow/alembic.ini\r\n```\r\n\r\nAll the features are optional. Simply add the config for the feature you want to use.\r\n\r\nIf you are having issues with the GitHub app not working, please create an issue on https://github.com/kaxil/boring-cyborg/issues.\r\n\r\n', 'external_url': 'https://github.com/kaxil/boring-cyborg', 'html_url': 'https://github.com/apps/boring-cyborg', 'created_at': 'name': 'boring-cyborg', 'description': 'A Github bot to automatically label PRs, issues and perform all the boring operations that you don\'t want to do.\r\n\r\n\r\n![Using Boring Cyborg Probot to add new labels](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/kaxil/boring-cyborg/master/assets/usage-screenshot-1.png)\r\n\r\n![Congratulate user on first merged PR](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/kaxil/boring-cyborg/master/assets/usage-first-merged-pr.gif)\r\n\r\n## Features\r\n\r\n* Add labels based on the path of the file that are modified in the PR.\r\n* Welcome new users to your project when they open their first Issue/PR or first merged PR by an\r\nautomated comment. \r\n* Insert Issue (Jira/Github etc) link in PR description based on the Issue ID in PR title.\r\n* Verifies if commits/PR titles match the regular expression specified\r\n* Check if a branch is up to date with the master when specific files are modified in the PR. This is helpful when you desire the changes to be applied sequentially, for example, alembic migrations.\r\n\r\n## Usage\r\n\r\n1. **[Configure the Github App](https://github.com/apps/boring-cyborg)**\r\n2. After installing the Github app, create `.github/boring-cyborg.yml` in the default branch to enable it\r\n3. It will start scanning for pull requests within few minutes.\r\n\r\n```yaml\r\n##### Labeler ##########################################################################################################\r\n# Enable "labeler" for your PR that would add labels to PRs based on the paths that are modified in the PR.\r\nlabelPRBasedOnFilePath:\r\n  # Add \'label1\' to any changes within \'example\' folder or any subfolders\r\n  label1:\r\n    - example/**/*\r\n\r\n  # Add \'label2\' to any file changes within \'example2\' folder\r\n  label2:\r\n    - example2/*\r\n\r\n  # Complex: Add \'area/core\' label to any change within the \'core\' package\r\n  area/core:\r\n    - src/core/*\r\n    - src/core/**/*  \r\n\r\n  # Add \'test\' label to any change to *.spec.js files within the source dir\r\n  test:\r\n    - src/**/*.spec.js\r\n\r\n##### Greetings ########################################################################################################\r\n# Comment to be posted to welcome users when they open their first PR\r\nfirstPRWelcomeComment: >\r\n  Thanks for opening this pull request! Please check out our contributing guidelines.\r\n\r\n# Comment to be posted to congratulate user on their first merged PR\r\nfirstPRMergeComment: >\r\n  Awesome work, congrats on your first merged pull request!\r\n\r\n# Comment to be posted to on first time issues\r\nfirstIssueWelcomeComment: >\r\n  Thanks for opening your first issue here! Be sure to follow the issue template!\r\n\r\n###### IssueLink Adder #################################################################################################\r\n# Insert Issue (Jira/Github etc) link in PR description based on the Issue ID in PR title.\r\ninsertIssueLinkInPrDescription:\r\n   # specify the placeholder for the issue link that should be present in the description\r\n  descriptionIssuePlaceholderRegexp: "^Issue link: (.*)$"\r\n  matchers:\r\n    # you can have several matches - for different types of issues\r\n    # only the first matching entry is replaced\r\n    jiraIssueMatch:\r\n      # specify the regexp of issue id that you can find in the title of the PR\r\n      # the match groups can be used to build the issue id (${1}, ${2}, etc.).\r\n      titleIssueIdRegexp: \\[(AIRFLOW-[0-9]{4})\\]\r\n      # the issue link to be added. ${1}, ${2} ... are replaced with the match groups from the\r\n      # title match (remember to use quotes)\r\n      descriptionIssueLink: "[${1}](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/${1}/)"\r\n    docOnlyIssueMatch:\r\n      titleIssueIdRegexp: \\[(AIRFLOW-X{4})\\]\r\n      descriptionIssueLink: "`Document only change, no JIRA issue`"\r\n\r\n###### Title Validator #################################################################################################\r\n# Verifies if commit/PR titles match the regexp specified\r\nverifyTitles:\r\n  # Regular expression that should be matched by titles of commits or PR\r\n  titleRegexp: ^\\[AIRFLOW-[0-9]{4}\\].*$|^\\[AIRFLOW-XXXX\\].*$\r\n  # If set to true, it will always check the PR title (as opposed to the individual commits).\r\n  alwaysUsePrTitle: true\r\n  # If set to true, it will only check the commit in case there is a single commit.\r\n  # In case of multiple commits it will check PR title.\r\n  # This reflects the standard behaviour of Github that for `Squash & Merge` GitHub\r\n  # uses the PR title rather than commit messages for the squashed commit ¯\\_(ツ)_/¯\r\n  # For single-commit PRs it takes the squashed commit message from the commit as expected.\r\n  #\r\n  # If set to false it will check all commit messages. This is useful when you do not squash commits at merge.\r\n  validateEitherPrOrSingleCommitTitle: true\r\n  # The title the GitHub status should appear from.\r\n  statusTitle: "Title Validator"\r\n  # A custom message to be displayed when the title passes validation.\r\n  successMessage: "Validation successful!"\r\n  # A custom message to be displayed when the title fails validation.\r\n  # Allows insertion of ${type} (commit/PR), ${title} (the title validated) and ${regex} (the titleRegexp above).\r\n  failureMessage: "Wrong ${type} title: ${title}"\r\n\r\n###### PR/Branch Up-To-Date Checker ####################################################################################\r\n# Check if the branch is up to date with master when certain files are modified\r\ncheckUpToDate:\r\n  # The default branch is "master", change the branch if you want to check against a different target branch  \r\n  targetBranch: master\r\n  files:\r\n  # File paths that you want to check for\r\n  # In this example, it checks if the branch is up to date when alembic migrations are modified in the PR.\r\n  # It helps avoid multiple heads in alembic migrations in a collaborative development project.\r\n    - airflow/migrations/*\r\n    - airflow/migrations/**/*\r\n    - airflow/alembic.ini\r\n```\r\n\r\nAll the features are optional. Simply add the config for the feature you want to use.\r\n\r\nIf you are having issues with the GitHub app not working, please create an issue on https://github.com/kaxil/boring-cyborg/issues.\r\n\r\n', 'external_url': 'https://github.com/kaxil/boring-cyborg', 'html_url': 'https://github.com/apps/boring-cyborg', 'created_at': '2020-01-04T23:52:58Z', 'updated_at': '2020-03-13T21:08:37Z', 'permissions': {'checks': 'write', 'issues': 'write', 'metadata': 'read', 'pull_requests': 'write', 'single_file': 'read', 'statuses': 'write'}, 'events': ['issues', 'label', 'pull_request', 'pull_request_review', 'pull_request_review_comment']}}]

'2024-11-05T12:04:51Z', 'author_association': 'NONE', 'body': '> We will remove `waiting` strategy in the next version.\r\n\r\nWhen using a stop strategy, the following issue may occur: After the master node distributes a task to the worker, the worker submits the task to its thread pool for execution and attempts to reply to the master. However, if the master has stopped when the worker tries to reply, the worker will attempt to reconnect to the current master several times before throwing an exception. At this point, the worker may already be executing the task, but since the original master has failed, triggering failover, another master takes over. attempts to reply to the master. However, if the master has stopped when the worker tries to reply, the worker will attempt to reconnect to the current master several times before throwing an exception. At this point, the worker may already be executing the task, but since the original master has failed, triggering failover, another master takes over. This raises the question: could this situation lead to duplicate task execution\r\n\r\nYes, if the task might be duplicate execute in worker, this is an existing problem, and is same with https://github.com/apache/dolphinscheduler/issues/16481. WorkerHeartBeat(workerHostWeight=100, threadPoolUsage      =7)\r\n```\r\n\r\nIf worker status is busy,  it will cause  `workerHostWeightsMap` empty or without the workgroup:\r\n\r\n```\r\n        /**\r\n         * Sync worker resource.\r\n         *\r\n         * @param workerGroupNodes  worker group nodes, key is worker group, value is worker group nodes.\r\n         * @param workerNodeInfoMap worker node info map, key is worker node, value is worker info.\r\n         */\r\n        private void syncWorkerResources(final Map<String, Set<String>> workerGroupNodes,\r\n                                         final Map<String, WorkerHeartBeat> workerNodeInfoMap) {\r\n            try {\r\n                Map<String, Set<HostWeight>> workerHostWeights = new HashMap<>();\r\n                for (Map.Entry<String, Set<String>> entry : workerGroupNodes.entrySet()) {\r\n                    String workerGroup = entry.getKey();\r\n                    Set<String> nodes = entry.getValue();\r\n                    Set<HostWeight> hostWeights = new HashSet<>(nodes.size());\r\n                    for (String node : nodes) {\r\n                        WorkerHeartBeat heartbeat = workerNodeInfoMap.getOrDefault(node, null);\r\n                        Optional<HostWeight> hostWeightOpt = getHostWeight(node, workerGroup, heartbeat);\r\n                        hostWeightOpt.ifPresent(hostWeights::add);\r\n                    }\r\n                    if (!hostWeights.isEmpty()) {\r\n                        workerHostWeights.put(workerGroup, hostWeights);\r\n                    }\r\n                }\r\n                syncWorkerHostWeight(workerHostWeights);\r\n            } catch (Throwable ex) {\r\n                log.error("Sync worker resource error", ex);\r\n            }\r\n        }\r\n\r\n        private void syncWorkerHostWeight(Map<String, Set<HostWeight>> workerHostWeights) {\r\n            workerGroupWriteLock.lock();\r\n            try {\r\n                workerHostWeightsMap.clear();\r\n                workerHostWeightsMap.putAll(workerHostWeights);\r\n            } finally {\r\n                workerGroupWriteLock.unlock();\r\n            }\r\n        }\r\n    }\r\n\r\n    public Optional<HostWeight> getHostWeight(String workerAddress, String workerGroup, WorkerHeartBeat heartBeat) {\r\n        if (heartBeat == null) {\r\n            log.warn("Worker {} in WorkerGroup {} have not received the heartbeat", workerAddress, workerGroup);\r\n            return Optional.empty();\r\n        }\r\n        if (ServerStatus.BUSY == heartBeat.getServerStatus()) {\r\n            log.warn("Worker {} in workerGroup {} is Busy, heartbeat is {}", workerAddress, workerGroup, heartBeat);\r\n            return Optional.empty();\r\n        }\r\n        return Optional.of(\r\n                new HostWeight(\r\n                        HostWorker.of(workerAddress, heartBeat.getWorkerHostWeight(), workerGroup),\r\n                        heartBeat.getCpuUsage(),\r\n                        heartBeat.getMemoryUsage(),\r\n                        heartBeat.getDiskUsage(),\r\n                        heartBeat.getThreadPoolUsage(),\r\n                        heartBeat.getStartupTime()));\r\n    }\r\n\r\n```\r\n\r\nI think this can be optimized, when the server is busy,  it does not means work group not exist, it only indicate the server is busy.\r\n\r\n', 'reactions': {'url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/apache/dolphinscheduler/issues/comments/2440653900/reactions', 'total_count': 0, '+1': 0, '-1': 0, 'laugh': 0, 'hooray': 0, This is not a good idea.\r\n\r\nOn Fri, Oct 25, 2024 at 5:12\u202fPM gaotong521 ***@***.***> wrote:\r\n\r\n> I think this module should not be removed, data quality is a very\r\n> important part of big data, the current mainstream big data products have\r\n> the data quality module, if removed, developers may need to write their own\r\n> programs to complete the quality check task, which is a very painful thing\r\n> for developers.our team is using data quality, although it's hard to use.\r\n> So I hope it should be rewritten instead of deleted.\r\n>\r\n> —\r\n> Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub\r\n> <https://github.com/apache/dolphinscheduler/issues/16728#issuecomment-2437287626>,\r\n> or unsubscribe\r\n> <https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/AIDI74PRBZTAT7KWBOSQBQDZ5IDOTAVCNFSM6AAAAABQOKHXDWVHI2DSMVQWIX3LMV43OSLTON2WKQ3PNVWWK3TUHMZDIMZXGI4DONRSGY>\r\n> .\r\n> You are receiving this because you commented.Message ID:\r\n> ***@***.***>\r\n>\r\n", 'reactions': {'url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/apache/dolphinscheduler/issues/comments/2477768025/reactions', 'total_count': 0, '+1': 0, '-1': 0, 'laugh': 0, 'hooray': 0, 'confused': 0, 'heart': 0, 'rocket': 0, 'eyes': 0}, 'performed_via_github_app': None}]

'https://api.github.com/users/kaxil/events{/privacy}', 'received_events_url': 'https://api.github.com/users/kaxil/received_events', 'type': 'User', 'user_view_type': 'public', 'site_admin': False}, 'name': 'boring-cyborg', 'description': 'A Github bot to automatically label PRs, issues and perform all the boring operations that you don\'t want to do.\r\n\r\n\r\n![Using Boring Cyborg Probot to add new labels](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/kaxil/boring-cyborg/master/assets/usage-screenshot-1.png)\r\n\r\n![Congratulate user on first merged PR](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/kaxil/boring-cyborg/master/assets/usage-first-merged-pr.gif)\r\n\r\n## Features\r\n\r\n* Add labels based on the path of the file that are modified in the PR.\r\n* Welcome new users to your project when they open their first Issue/PR or first merged PR by an\r\nautomated comment. \r\n* Insert Issue (Jira/Github etc) link in PR description based on the Issue ID in PR title.\r\n* Verifies if commits/PR titles match the regular expression specified\r\n* Check if a branch is up to date with the master when specific files are modified in the PR. This is helpful when you desire the changes to be applied sequentially, for example, alembic migrations.\r\n\r\n## Usage\r\n\r\n1. **[Configure the Github App](https://github.com/apps/boring-cyborg)**\r\n2. After installing the Github app, create `.github/boring-cyborg.yml` in the default branch to enable it\r\n3. It will start scanning for pull requests within few minutes.\r\n\r\n```yaml\r\n##### Labeler ##########################################################################################################\r\n# Enable "labeler" for your PR that would add labels to PRs based on the paths that are modified in the PR.\r\nlabelPRBasedOnFilePath:\r\n  # Add \'label1\' to any changes within \'example\' folder or any subfolders\r\n  label1:\r\n    - example/**/*\r\n\r\n  # Add \'label2\' to any file changes within \'example2\' folder\r\n  label2:\r\n    - example2/*\r\n\r\n  # Complex: Add \'area/core\' label to any change within the \'core\' package\r\n  area/core:\r\n    - src/core/*\r\n    - src/core/**/*  \r\n\r\n  # Add \'test\' label to any change to *.spec.js files within the source dir\r\n  test:\r\n    - src/**/*.spec.js\r\n\r\n##### Greetings ########################################################################################################\r\n# Comment to be posted to welcome users when they open their first PR\r\nfirstPRWelcomeComment: >\r\n  Thanks for opening this pull request! Please check out our contributing guidelines.\r\n\r\n# Comment to be posted to congratulate user on their first merged PR\r\nfirstPRMergeComment: >\r\n  Awesome work, congrats on your first merged pull request!\r\n\r\n# Comment to be posted to on first time issues\r\nfirstIssueWelcomeComment: >\r\n  Thanks for opening your first issue here! Be sure to follow the issue template!\r\n\r\n###### IssueLink Adder #################################################################################################\r\n# Insert Issue (Jira/Github etc) link in PR description based on the Issue ID in PR title.\r\ninsertIssueLinkInPrDescription:\r\n   # specify the placeholder for the issue link that should be present in the description\r\n  descriptionIssuePlaceholderRegexp: "^Issue link: (.*)$"\r\n  matchers:\r\n    # you can have several matches - for different types of issues\r\n    # only the first matching entry is replaced\r\n    jiraIssueMatch:\r\n      # specify the regexp of issue id that you can find in the title of the PR\r\n      # the match groups can be used to build the issue id (${1}, ${2}, etc.).\r\n      titleIssueIdRegexp: \\[(AIRFLOW-[0-9]{4})\\]\r\n      # the issue link to be added. ${1}, ${2} ... are replaced with the match groups from the\r\n      # title match (remember to use quotes)\r\n      descriptionIssueLink: "[${1}](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/${1}/)"\r\n    docOnlyIssueMatch:\r\n      titleIssueIdRegexp: \\[(AIRFLOW-X{4})\\]\r\n      descriptionIssueLink: "`Document only change, no JIRA issue`"\r\n\r\n###### Title Validator #################################################################################################\r\n# Verifies if commit/PR titles match the regexp specified\r\nverifyTitles:\r\n  # Regular expression that should be matched by titles of commits or PR\r\n  titleRegexp: ^\\[AIRFLOW-[0-9]{4}\\].*$|^\\[AIRFLOW-XXXX\\].*$\r\n  # If set to true, it will always check the PR title (as opposed to the individual commits).\r\n  alwaysUsePrTitle: true\r\n  # If set to true, it will only check the commit in case there is a single commit.\r\n  # In case of multiple commits it will check PR title.\r\n  # This reflects the standard behaviour of Github that for `Squash & Merge` GitHub\r\n  # uses the PR title rather than commit messages for the squashed commit ¯\\_(ツ)_/¯\r\n  # For single-commit PRs it takes the squashed commit message from the commit as expected.\r\n  #\r\n  # If set to false it will check all commit messages. This is useful when you do not squash commits at merge.\r\n  validateEitherPrOrSingleCommitTitle: true\r\n  # The title the GitHub status should appear from.\r\n  statusTitle: "Title Validator"\r\n  # A custom message to be displayed when the title passes validation.\r\n  successMessage: "Validation successful!"\r\n  # A custom message to be displayed when the title fails validation.\r\n  # Allows insertion of ${type} (commit/PR), ${title} (the title validated) and ${regex} (the titleRegexp above).\r\n  failureMessage: "Wrong ${type} title: ${title}"\r\n\r\n###### PR/Branch Up-To-Date Checker ####################################################################################\r\n# Check if the branch is up to date with master when certain files are modified\r\ncheckUpToDate:\r\n  # The default branch is "master", change the branch if you want to check against a different target branch  \r\n  targetBranch: master\r\n  files:\r\n  # File paths that you want to check for\r\n  # In this example, it checks if the branch is up to date when alembic migrations are modified in the PR.\r\n  # It helps avoid multiple heads in alembic migrations in a collaborative development project.\r\n    - airflow/migrations/*\r\n    - airflow/migrations/**/*\r\n    - airflow/alembic.ini\r\n```\r\n\r\nAll the features are optional. Simply add the config for the feature you want to use.\r\n\r\nIf you are having issues with the GitHub app not working, please create an issue on https://github.com/kaxil/boring-cyborg/issues.\r\n\r\n', 'external_url': 'https://github.com/kaxil/boring-cyborg', 'html_url': 'https://github.com/apps/boring-cyborg', 'created_at': '2020-01-04T23:52:58Z', 'updated_at': '2020-03-13T21:08:37Z', 'permissions': {'checks': 'write', 'issues': 'write', 'metadata': 'read', 'pull_requests': 'write', 'single_file': 'read', 'statuses': 'write'}, 'events': ['issues', 'label', 'pull_request', 'pull_request_review', 'pull_request_review_comment']}}, {'url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/apache/dolphinscheduler/issues/comments/2425397422', 'html_url': 'https://github.com/apache/dolphinscheduler/pull/16703#issuecomment-2425397422', 'issue_url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/apache/dolphinscheduler/issues/16703', 'id': 2425397422, 'node_id': 'IC_kwDOClTkms6QkKCu', 'user': {'login': 'sonarqubecloud[bot]', 'id': 39514782, 'node_id': 'name': 'boring-cyborg', 'description': 'A Github bot to automatically label PRs, issues and perform all the boring operations that you don\'t want to do.\r\n\r\n\r\n![Using Boring Cyborg Probot to add new labels](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/kaxil/boring-cyborg/master/assets/usage-screenshot-1.png)\r\n\r\n![Congratulate user on first merged PR](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/kaxil/boring-cyborg/master/assets/usage-first-merged-pr.gif)\r\n\r\n## Features\r\n\r\n* Add labels based on the path of the file that are modified in the PR.\r\n* Welcome new users to your project when they open their first Issue/PR or first merged PR by an\r\nautomated comment. \r\n* Insert Issue (Jira/Github etc) link in PR description based on the Issue ID in PR title.\r\n* Verifies if commits/PR titles match the regular expression specified\r\n* Check if a branch is up to date with the master when specific files are modified in the PR. This is helpful when you desire the changes to be applied sequentially, for example, alembic migrations.\r\n\r\n## Usage\r\n\r\n1. **[Configure the Github App](https://github.com/apps/boring-cyborg)**\r\n2. After installing the Github app, create `.github/boring-cyborg.yml` in the default branch to enable it\r\n3. It will start scanning for pull requests within few minutes.\r\n\r\n```yaml\r\n##### Labeler ##########################################################################################################\r\n# Enable "labeler" for your PR that would add labels to PRs based on the paths that are modified in the PR.\r\nlabelPRBasedOnFilePath:\r\n  # Add \'label1\' to any changes within \'example\' folder or any subfolders\r\n  label1:\r\n    - example/**/*\r\n\r\n  # Add \'label2\' to any file changes within \'example2\' folder\r\n  label2:\r\n    - example2/*\r\n\r\n  # Complex: Add \'area/core\' label to any change within the \'core\' package\r\n  area/core:\r\n    - src/core/*\r\n    - src/core/**/*  \r\n\r\n  # Add \'test\' label to any change to *.spec.js files within the source dir\r\n  test:\r\n    - src/**/*.spec.js\r\n\r\n##### Greetings ########################################################################################################\r\n# Comment to be posted to welcome users when they open their first PR\r\nfirstPRWelcomeComment: >\r\n  Thanks for opening this pull request! Please check out our contributing guidelines.\r\n\r\n# Comment to be posted to congratulate user on their first merged PR\r\nfirstPRMergeComment: >\r\n  Awesome work, congrats on your first merged pull request!\r\n\r\n# Comment to be posted to on first time issues\r\nfirstIssueWelcomeComment: >\r\n  Thanks for opening your first issue here! Be sure to follow the issue template!\r\n\r\n###### IssueLink Adder #################################################################################################\r\n# Insert Issue (Jira/Github etc) link in PR description based on the Issue ID in PR title.\r\ninsertIssueLinkInPrDescription:\r\n   # specify the placeholder for the issue link that should be present in the description\r\n  descriptionIssuePlaceholderRegexp: "^Issue link: (.*)$"\r\n  matchers:\r\n    # you can have several matches - for different types of issues\r\n    # only the first matching entry is replaced\r\n    jiraIssueMatch:\r\n      # specify the regexp of issue id that you can find in the title of the PR\r\n      # the match groups can be used to build the issue id (${1}, ${2}, etc.).\r\n      titleIssueIdRegexp: \\[(AIRFLOW-[0-9]{4})\\]\r\n      # the issue link to be added. ${1}, ${2} ... are replaced with the match groups from the\r\n      # title match (remember to use quotes)\r\n      descriptionIssueLink: "[${1}](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/${1}/)"\r\n    docOnlyIssueMatch:\r\n      titleIssueIdRegexp: \\[(AIRFLOW-X{4})\\]\r\n      descriptionIssueLink: "`Document only change, no JIRA issue`"\r\n\r\n###### Title Validator #################################################################################################\r\n# Verifies if commit/PR titles match the regexp specified\r\nverifyTitles:\r\n  # Regular expression that should be matched by titles of commits or PR\r\n  titleRegexp: ^\\[AIRFLOW-[0-9]{4}\\].*$|^\\[AIRFLOW-XXXX\\].*$\r\n  # If set to true, it will always check the PR title (as opposed to the individual commits).\r\n  alwaysUsePrTitle: true\r\n  # If set to true, it will only check the commit in case there is a single commit.\r\n  # In case of multiple commits it will check PR title.\r\n  # This reflects the standard behaviour of Github that for `Squash & Merge` GitHub\r\n  # uses the PR title rather than commit messages for the squashed commit ¯\\_(ツ)_/¯\r\n  # For single-commit PRs it takes the squashed commit message from the commit as expected.\r\n  #\r\n  # If set to false it will check all commit messages. This is useful when you do not squash commits at merge.\r\n  validateEitherPrOrSingleCommitTitle: true\r\n  # The title the GitHub status should appear from.\r\n  statusTitle: "Title Validator"\r\n  # A custom message to be displayed when the title passes validation.\r\n  successMessage: "Validation successful!"\r\n  # A custom message to be displayed when the title fails validation.\r\n  # Allows insertion of ${type} (commit/PR), ${title} (the title validated) and ${regex} (the titleRegexp above).\r\n  failureMessage: "Wrong ${type} title: ${title}"\r\n\r\n###### PR/Branch Up-To-Date Checker ####################################################################################\r\n# Check if the branch is up to date with master when certain files are modified\r\ncheckUpToDate:\r\n  # The default branch is "master", change the branch if you want to check against a different target branch  \r\n  targetBranch: master\r\n  files:\r\n  # File paths that you want to check for\r\n  # In this example, it checks if the branch is up to date when alembic migrations are modified in the PR.\r\n  # It helps avoid multiple heads in alembic migrations in a collaborative development project.\r\n    - airflow/migrations/*\r\n    - airflow/migrations/**/*\r\n    - airflow/alembic.ini\r\n```\r\n\r\nAll the features are optional. Simply add the config for the feature you want to use.\r\n\r\nIf you are having issues with the GitHub app not working, please create an issue on https://github.com/kaxil/boring-cyborg/issues.\r\n\r\n', 'external_url': 'https://github.com/kaxil/boring-cyborg', 'html_url': 'https://github.com/apps/boring-cyborg', 'created_at':
